loans.name: Adelita

texts.en: Adelita A. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 42 years old, married and has five school-age children. They are from the village of Lurogan, Valencia City, Bukidnon. Adelita has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Adelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Martiniano

texts.es: El Señor Martiniano es un hombre muy trabajador, el es albañil y trabaja mucho para darle a su nieto una buena educación, ya que el pequeño vive con el, por que los padres del menor  lo dejaron a cargo del Señor Martiniano, el vive solo con su nieto, son muy unidos y el señor esta preocupado por la compra de Útiles escolares de este nuevo ciclo escolar.  Necesita de este préstamo para comprar  el uniforme de la escuela, así como zapatos y también los útiles escolares. El señor Martiniano esta muy agradecido con el apoyo que le puedan brindar.
texts.en:
Martiniano is a very hard working man. He is a construction worker and he works long hours to provide his grandson with a good education. The little boy lives with him after his parents left him in his care. He lives alone with his grandson. They are very close but he is concerned about needing to purchase school supplies for the new school year. He needs this loan so that he can purchase a uniform, shoes, and school supplies for the boy. Martiniano is very grateful for the support they receive.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase school supplies.

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Prak C. is 39 years old and has been selling a few fresh fish around the busy market for more than nine years. She sells fish after buying them from her wholesale supplier and from other fishermen.

Prak C. is married to Banh Peuv, 39, who owns a motorcycle that he currently uses to provide a taxi service. This couple helps each other in order to generate money to support three of their kids who are students, while another one is no longer in school and is employed in a casino club.

Prak C.’s husband is concerned that his motor-taxi is getting old and often breaks down, so his income has been affected. To help remove this obstacle, Prak C. decided to request a loan from Kiva’s field partner, HKL, to be used to replace her husband’s old motor-taxi.

loans.use: To replace her husband's old motor-taxi

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 30 años, es un padre de familia muy amoroso y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Flor de 28 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo al que se dedica Juan, es la siembra de papa y choclo, los cuales después de cosecharlos, vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de tarma, en donde ya tiene varios clientes, que sabiendo de la calidad de su producto no dudan en esperarlo para comprarle todo al por mayor.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus chacras de la plaga de insectos. En adelante, espera seguir vendiendo sus productos, pero para mejorar sus ganancias desea comprarse un auto, con el cual él mismo pueda transportar sus cultivos. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, si desea acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy responsable y preocupado por el bienestar de su grupo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará insumos para proteger sus siembra de la plaga de insectos.
texts.en:
Juan is 30 years old; he is a very loving father and a hard working person. He lives in his own home together with his wife Flor, 28 years old, and their two beloved children. He hopes to provide them with a better quality of life. Juan business is cultivating potatoes and corn. When the harvest has been collected he sells his products to wholesalers in the city of Tarma, where he already has various clients. His clients don't hesitate to wait to buy his entire stock of product because of the high quality he consistently provides. What he most likes about his work is planting seeds in his fields and to cultivate them. He has 15 years experience in his business. The most difficult part is having to ward insects away from the fields. In the future he hopes to keep selling his products but he would like to improve his earnings to be able to afford a car. He will be able to transport his products himself. This is his eighth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He knows that he must make his payments on time if he wishes to have access to any future loans. He is a very responsible and engaged member in his community bank. With the three thousand nuevos soles that he requests he will purchase pesticides for his plantations.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pesticides.

loans.name: Martha Petrona

texts.es: Martha Petrona se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos también se dedica a vender productos lácteos, ella busca la forma de generar ingresos para su hogar. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para su negocio. A su cargo esta su hija de 7 años, que con el esfuerzo de ella estudia, ella ha realizado un gran esfuerzo para mantener sus negocios. Pues todos los días se levanta muy temprano para comenzar con su labor. Con este crédito quiere realizar la compra de leche, cuajada, crema y queso es una mujer responsable.
texts.en:
Martha Petrona sells clothing and cosmetics but she also sells dairy products. She is always looking for ways to increase family income. This isn’t her first business loan. She has a 7 year old daughter in her care that is able to go to school thanks to her efforts for she has put in a great effort to keep her businesses running. She rises very early every day to start her tasks. She will use the loan to buy milk, cottage cheese, cream and cheese. She is a responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk, cheese, cream and cottage-cheese.

loans.name: Jennifer Elieth

texts.es: Jennifer Elieth tiene 29 años, su actividad es la venta de dulces. Hace más 2 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que ha sido muy reconfortante es madre de 1 hijo menor de edad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, esta actividad  considera que lo más difícil es que existe mucha competencia pero ella ofrece un buen servicio. Este es el primer crédito que ella va a realizar para la compra de galletas, caramelos, bombones entre otras cosas. Sueña con mejorar su negocio y además vende al por mayor.
texts.en: Jennifer Elieth is 29 years old and she has a candy store. For more than 2 years she has had the business. It has been very assuring for her especially because she is the mother of a young son.  The most difficult part of her work is that there is a lot of competition but she always provides excellent customer service. This is a first time loan and she will invest it in the purchase of cookies, caramels, bonbons and other merchandise. She dreams of improving her business and she would love to sell in wholesale.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en:
Bolormaa T. is 21 years old and lives with her mother, husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live in their own small apartment.

Bolormaa's mother has been operating a clothing trade business in Narantuul Trade market in the city since 2007 and she manages this business with help of her husband today. Bolormaa provides a variety of clothing and t-shirts to satisfy their customers' needs. Over the years, the family business has reached a sustainable level. Her purpose of applying for the bank loan is to increase her working capital. For the future, she hopes to improve her house. She is a very modest person. Bolormaa is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to increase her working capital for her retail business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Juvet

texts.en:
Juvet A. is from Silanga, Tangub City. She is 36 years old. Juvet is single. To make a living, Juvet owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising fish and crabs for sale. Juvet has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juvet joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Juvet is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Juvet from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inicio la Señorita Ma-Fatima M. domiciliada en el Barrio San Jose de la Ciudad de.
   “Nuevo Amanecer”fue denominado el comité y actualmente se encuentra en la etapa Septimo con 19 integrantes, es un grupo de señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras, ellas se dedican diversas actividades.
     Algunas de las integrantes ya contaban con trabajo antes de formar parte D. comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y se integraron para lograr mejorar su emprendimiento, otras sin embargo comienzan con su primera actividad ajena a los que se refiere su familia.
     Las mujeres Agradecen a la Fundación Paraguaya por la iniciativa ya que mediante ella logramos desarrollar bastante nuestra capacidad de trabajo.
     Todas realizan actividades independientes, pero ayuda y esfuerzo lo realizan en forma conjunta. 
El comité lo conforman mujeres muy sacrificadas que han luchado toda su vida para llevar adelante a sus familiares a pesar de los obstáculos que siempre existen. 
Se puede comentar el caso de la Sra. Agustina quien se dedica hace varios años a la venta de chipa, ella se levanta muy temprano a preparar su chipa para salir a vender. 
La venta lo realiza de forma ambulante  para el recorrido lo ayuda su sobrina y su marido. 
La Sra. Agustina agradece de manera especial a la Fundación por que mediante el apoyo brindado por la misma pudo adquirir más capital y así poder agradar su negocio porque ahora cuenta con más vendedores de chipa, mediante la compra de insumos  como queso, almidón de yuca, harina  de maíz, leñas para la elaboración de chipas.
texts.en:
This committee was set up by Miss Maria Fatima M. in the San José neighborhood of the city.  The committee was named “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) and it is currently in its seventh loan cycle with 19 members.  It is a group of very responsible and hard-working ladies.  They carry out a number of different business activities.

Some of the members already had work before becoming part of the 'Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Committee of Enterprising Women) and joined the group so that they could improve their businesses.   Others, however, are just starting out with their first business activity.

The women would like to thank Fundación Paraguaya for the initiative since through it they have managed to develop their ability to work.

All of the members of the group carry out independent business activities but help and hard work are something they share.

The committee is made up of very selfless women who have fought all their lives to get their families ahead in life, in spite of the obstacles which are always to be found.

Here we can mention the case of Agustina who has been selling 'chipa' (a typical Paraguayan bread) for several years.  She gets up very early in the morning to prepare her 'chipa' so that she can go out and sell it.  She sells her product as a street trader.  Her niece and husband help her with her sales.

Agustina would like to give special thanks to Fundación Paraguaya for the support which they have provided because it has enabled her to acquire more capital and thereby expand her business as she now has more 'chipa' sellers.  She has been able to use this capital to buy ingredients such as cheese, yucca starch, corn flour and firewood for preparing her 'chipas'.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making 'chipas' (bread), such as starch, cheese, milk, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old married man and the father of four school-age children. He has been working in flooring for the past nine years. And in 2008, he started taking on private projects. He works hard to raise his four children and to satisfy their needs. He works on a freelance basis at the request of the clients. Today he is requesting $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a polishing machine and paving cutter to be able to take on more projects and increase his business income. His income is vital because he is the main income provider of the family. He hopes that with the new machines his business will grow and he will have the opportunity to work closely with construction entrepreneurs concerning flooring.

loans.use: To purchase a polishing machine and paving cutter

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose Z. is from the village of Benito, Soliven, Isabela. He is 39 years old. Jose is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Jose owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Jose has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 25000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Jose joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jose has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Jose is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jose from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Munkherdene

texts.en: Munkherdene is 24 years old, married, and has one son. His family lives together in a wooden house on their plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife Nyamdulam, who is also 24 years old, is studying to become a lawyer at a state university. Their parents take care of their son in Bayankhongor province. Munkherdene used to work at an auto repair shop as a manager. In 2009, he began operating his own business replacing and fixing car windshields. Munkherdene is planning to expand his business in the future. He is requesting 2,800,000 MNT loan to increase his working capital.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Keva Jumaa

texts.en:
Keva Jumaa S., 37, is from Bombolulu. He is married to Damaris and together they have two children. Keva has been in the transport business for the last three years. This marks his second loan from KADET and with it, he plans to repair his motor bike.

The profits will be directed to the expansion of his business. Keva's dream is to open a retail shop for his wife.

loans.use: To repair his motor bike.

loans.name: Koryun

texts.en:
Koryun M. is engaged in cattle breeding. He raises cows and calves on his farm. He likes his occupation very much, and his wife helps him in farming. Thereby they keep their family and were able to develop their farm, which they have run since 2002. 

Along with farming, Koryun and his wife have their regular work. Koryun works at Lchashen village's administration, and his wife works as a teacher. 
  
Koryun seeks a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy four cows for his farm, which will help him increase his family’s future income. Koryun is 50 years old, and he lives in Lchashen village, Sevan area.

loans.use: To buy four cows for his farm

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
La Sra. Betty pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin. Es Soltera, tiene 38 años y es madre de 02 niñas que aun dependen de ella.

Su espíritu luchador que siempre le caracterizo y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes. Nos cuenta que lleva varios años ejerciendo este tipo de negocio. Poco a poco fue ganando experiencia, confianza y haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.
Con lo que actualmente logro con clientela fija; amigos del barrio, moradores y vecinos que a diario acuden a su tienda a comprar sus productos.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará diferentes tipos de productos como: leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, avena en paquetes, té en diferentes sabores (manzanilla y anís), verduras de la zona, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

 Betty está contenta con la actividad que realiza día a día y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Betty belongs to the communal ban “Los Eucaliptos” in the Tarapoto district of San Martin province. She is single, 38 years old, and is the mother of 2 dependent children.

Betty has always been known for her tenacious spirit and her strong desire to get a head through her own means, and this motivated her to start her own grocery store.  She tells us that she has had this business for a number of years.  Little by little, she gained experience and confidence and became well-known and liked by her customers.  

Now she has a regular customer base, including friends from the neighborhood, residents and neighbors, who come to her store daily to buy her products.

With this loan of 2,500 Peruvian soles, she will buy different types of products such as milk, cases of canned fish of various brands, oatmeal packets, tea in different flavors (chamomile and anise), local vegetables, household cleaning products, and personal hygiene products so that she can provide better service to her customers.

Betty is content with the business that she manages every day. She thanks Manuela Ramos for contributing toward the completion of her dreams and goals.

loans.use: to buy different types of products such as milk, cases of canned fish of various brands, oatmeal packets, tea in different flavors (chamomile and anise), local vegetables, household cleaning products, and personal hygiene products

loans.name: Ana Iris

texts.es: Ana Iris H. D. A., resiD. en San Francisco Goteras, ubicado en el departamento D. Morazán, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo y un hijo D. 6 años D. edad. Ana posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos D. primera necesidad, contando con muy buena clientela ya que es la única tienda en el lugar y así mismo debido a que cuenta con varios años D. trabajar en este negocio. Ana solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. productos D. primera necesidad, sobre todo aquellos que cuentan con más demanda por parte D. las personas. Con el préstamo hecho a Integral ella alberga la esperanza D. poder mejorar las ventas D. su negocio, y D. esta manera contar con más ganancias las cuales le permitan brindarle todo lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en: Ana lives in San Francisco Goteras, which is in the Morazán department. She lives there with her husband and a six year old son. Ana has a store where she sells basic groceries. Because she has the only store in the place and has been running it for a number of years, she has a good customer base. Ana is requesting a loan so that she can buy a greater quantity of basic groceries, in particular those that are in most demand by her customers. With the loan maD. by Integral, she hopes to be able to improve her sales and so to have more income with which to offer her family everything they need.

loans.use: To buy perishable goods to sell.

location.town: San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán

loans.name: Safia Amjad Masih's Group

texts.en:
Safia is 31 years old and has no child yet. She spends most of her time at home doing household tasks. Safia lives in Jaranwala, which is a small city in Pakistan’s Punjab known for its agricultural activity. She has been living there with her family in a four-room brick house for the last four years.

Safia’s husband is A. M., and he is a vegetable vendor who gets up early in the morning to go to vegetable shops. His clients are mainly people who sell vegetables from their shops in different areas of the city. He provides them with fresh vegetables and so earns a good profit.

Safia is a client of Kiva’s partner Asasah; this will be her second loan with them. During her previous loan year, she paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting. Safia has now applied for a loan for the further improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan he will buy fresh vegetables in bulk to sell through his own shop.

Safia is hopeful that such an investment will improve his business and increase his monthly income.

loans.use: To buy fresh vegetables in bulk to sell

loans.name: Tita's Group

texts.en:
Tita M. is from the village of Marracuro, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 45 years old. Tita is the group leader of a 8-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tita M.'s group.

Tita is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Tita owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Tita has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 4200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Tita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Tita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Tita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Rahab Wanja

texts.en: Rahab is 47 years old and a single mother of three children. She has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 23 years. She was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by one of our field staff and this will be her second loan. She paid her previous loan of 60,000 KES well and in good time. She plans to use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Rahab hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a business selling maandazi (dumplings). She sells from home to her neighbors and schoolchildren. Mejumaa faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to satisfy her customers needs in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, beans, salt and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, beans, salt and cooking oil

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita is from the village of Diklum, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 68 years old. Enriquita is widowed and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, junk foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $233 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Enriquita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 27,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods and beverages. This will be her 10th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods and beverages.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita runs a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells items like fruits, vegetables and spices to the people in her community. 

She requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, vinegar and vegetables. 

Lucita works hard to improve her business and living conditions. She hopes to have a bigger store and more items to sell.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, vinegar and vegetables.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 32 years old and married to Patrick.  They have been blessed with six children who are between 4 and 24 years old.  Jacinta runs a general retail shop, earning KES. 30,000 a month.

She has borrowed a loan of KES 10,000.  This is her first loan and she intends to use the entire amount to buy stock of goods like rice, maize flour, and sugar to sell. 

Teresa anticipates using her profits to repay her loan and invest in her business for better returns.  Her future hopes and dreams are to expand her business into a supermarket and be able to build her own residential home.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of rice, maize flour, and sugar to sell in her retail shop.

loans.name: Alohagbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ALOHAGBE est composé de trois personnes qui résident toutes dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mireille Sènami est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Mireille Sènami est née en  1978 dans une ville du Bénin, et est mariée à un Plombier du nom de Patrick. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Mireille Sènami a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Mireille Sènami mène comme activité depuis cinq ans la vente de conserves, de savons et des cartes de recharges téléphoniques de façon secondaire. Mireille Sènami s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Mireille Sènami sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ALOHAGBE, un premier crédit.
texts.en: The ALOHAGBE group consists of three members who all live in the same area.  The representative of the group, named Mireille-Senami, is the one with the hand raised in the photo.  Mireille-Senami was born in 1978 in a city of Benin.  She is married to a plumber named Patrick.  The couple have three children, all in school and under their care.  Mireille-Senami dropped out of secondary school.  To provide for her needs and those of her family, Mireille-Senami has been in business for five years selling canned goods, soap, and phone cards.  Mireille-Senami stocks up at one of the markets in Benin.  In the pursuit of customer satisfaction and to increase her revenues and her income, Mireille-Senami is asking for, with the other members of the ALOHAGBE group, a first loan.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soaps, and phone cards.

loans.name: Nemer

texts.en:
Nemer is a 24-year-old single man from Chtaura. He has been working in a Hooka Cafe since 2009.  A hooka is "an oriental tobacco pipe with a long, flexible tube that draws the smoke through water contained in a bowl". He also delivers hookas to homes and businesses upon request, since renting hookas is becoming popular these days.

Nemer is a man with a good reputation. He is liked by most of his customers who are mostly friends, relatives and neighbors. Nemer is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva partner for the first time to increase the number of hookas he owns, and to buy additional plastic tables and chairs to increase the number of customers accepted at the shop.

Nemer also works on a school bus in the autumn-winter season to increase his income.  He works hard to seek a better living. To improve his business more, part of the loan will be invested in doing necessary maintenance to his van. Nemer hopes to improve his business more and more in the future through buying a new big school bus.

loans.use: To increase the number of his Hookas and to buy additional chairs and tables to his cafe

loans.name: Rosa Elia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Elia es madre de familia y tiene un hijo bajo su responsabilidad. 
Desea que su hijo tenga los estudios necesarios para que tenga un mejor futuro, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar la inscripción y los uniformes de la escuela. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una clínica de salud.
texts.en:
Rosa Elia is the mother to her family and has one son who she is responsible for.  She hopes that her son will complete the necessary studies so that he has a better future.  This is why she is requesting a loan to be able to pay for his enrollment and the school uniforms.

She plans to pay the loan with a part of the salary she receives from her work in a health clinic.

loans.use: to pay enrollment costs and to buy uniforms.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 21 years old, married and has one child.

Sara is an owner for a farm for rearing calves and cows since 2005. She has a long experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local consumers and she is becoming well known in her area.

She decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to buy a dairy cow. She is aiming to gain more profits to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Adjo Georgette

texts.fr:
Adjo Georgette est une femme âgée de 32 ans. Elle est mariée å un pasteur. Elle n’a pas d’enfants 
Adjo Georgette travaille comme couturière et revendeuse de pagnes il y a 2ans. Elle vend à ses clients de façon ambulante et achète les produits au Grand Marché de Lomé. 
Adjo Georgette a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes.
texts.en: Adjo Georgette is a 32 year-old woman. She is married to a clergyman. She does not have children. Adjo Georgette started working as a seamstress and retailer of pagnes (local fabric) 2 years ago. She sells to her customers door-to-door and purchases her products from the Grand Market in Lome. Adjo Georgette has requested her first loan cycle from WAGES in order to purchase pagnes.

loans.use: to buy 'pagnes' (local fabric).

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en: Narantsetseg is 41 years old and lives with her three children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province of Mongolia. Her eldest daughter is a college student and the other two are high school students. Narantsetseg started her business by selling retail goods at the local market. She sells home product such is a dipper, pot, sewing string, needle, sink etc. She has many years of experience in her field. With the profits she earns, she pays the college tuition fee of her daughter. She is a a diligent woman who is requesting a 2,200,000 MNT loan to purchase more products and goods, such is a toilet paper, towel, dipper to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more products, such is a toilet paper, towels and diapers, for resale

loans.name: Laura Maria

texts.es:
La señora Laura tiene 27 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Concepción con su marido Walter quien se recibió como radiólogo, pero que no ejerce su profesión. La pareja tiene un hijo y otro que esta en camino.
La señora Laura y su marido habían viajado a España para buscar mejores futuros, según cuenta la señora esos tres años que estuvo trabajando en España fueron días y días de arduo trabajo y añoranza. Tres años después regresaron e iniciaron un negocio en su propia casa. Ella tiene una tienda donde vende todo de artículos, como comestibles, bebidas y otros de primera necesidad. Comenta que tiene muy buena clientela, lo cual le genera muy buenos ingresos, mediante los cuales puede ayudar a su familia. El mayor deseo de la señora es que sus hijos cuando crezcan estudien para que puedan ejercer una profesión y que no pasen lo que sus padres tuvieron que pasar.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, con lo cual podrá abastecer su negocio y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Está esperanzada con el crédito, pues de obtenerlo le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Laura is 27 years old and lives in the city of Concepción with her husband Walter who is trained as a radiologist but doesn't work in his profession.  The couple have one child and another on the way.

Laura and her husband traveled to Spain in search of a better future.  Laura tells us that the three years she spent working in Spain were days and days of hard work and homesickness.  Three years later, they returned home and started a business in their own house.  Laura has a store where she sells all sorts of goods such as food, drinks and other basic household products.  She says that she has good customers and this makes her very good income with which she is able to help her family.  Laura's biggest wish is for her children to study when they grow up so that they can work in a profession and not have to go through what their parents went through.

Laura is requesting this loan to buy drinks with which to stock her store and meet her customer demand.  She is hopeful about this loan as it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy drinks to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en:
Tsetsegmaa is 50 years old and lives with her children and husband in a ger, a traditional Mongolian yurt, in Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her three children are working in Ulaanbaatar city. Her husband used to work as a driver and has not worked since 2000. 

She graduated from the technological training center, majoring in fashion and sewing in 1980. She worked at the local fashion house as a tailor for 20 years. After she retired from work, she started her own sewing business. She has no work partner so far. In the future, she plans to expand her business operation by increasing her turnover and hiring one worker. 

She is an open-minded and hard working person who says "If I have a collateral, it would be easy for me to take bank loans and increase the business turnover. I want to expand my business very well." She is requesting a 750,000 MNT to increase her working capital and purchase cloth and materials.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and materials

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 41 years old and a single mother of one.  

She does tailoring to earn a living. She mainly makes clothes and pillow covers. She has been in the business for four years. She was previously employed before she went into business. She has retained her business because of her good customer care.

Eunice hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future. She needs 50,000 KES to buy fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is married and blessed with two children. He has been selling fried fish for the last one year to make a living. He is also employed elsewhere. Hence, he has employed two people to run his business when he is absent. He has been able to retain his business because of good reputation with his customers. With the 20,000 Kenya shillings, he wants to buy ingredient such as cooking fat for frying fish.  In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. Martin dreams of buying a piece of land in the future.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat for frying fish.

loans.name: Choijamts

texts.en: Choijamts is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger (or traditional Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Both of his children are in school and he and his wife earn a living by selling second-hand clothes.They started their business in 2003 by renting a counter in a local market. They have done well because they handpick all of their products and sterilize them before they go on sale. Choijamts is eager to expand his business and is applying for a loan for 1,500,000 MNT to buy winter clothes to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is married with 5 children aged 6 to 19. He has been a maize farmer for 25 years. He would like a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides to grow his crop.

He will use the Kiva loan to cover labor costs and fertilizer costs during maize production. They need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production.
 
With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides to grow his crop.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: La socia sigue administrando y mejorando su negocio de restaurante, la socia poco a pococ podra hacer realidad su negocio ella pondra en sus mismo local un horno para sacar polllo a la braza, pero por ahora la socia requiere el prestamo para invertir en la compra de productos al por mayor, ahora que los productos subieron ella desea invertir en la compra de arroz en  bolsas, aceite por bidones, fideos, sal en bolsas, entre otros productos. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para implementar sus tienda y para poder elaborar sus comidas caseras y extras, la socia seguira trabajando para concretar sus proyectos a corto plazo.
texts.en:
The member continues managing and improving her restaurant business.  Little by little she will be able to make her business a reality.  In her same place she will install an oven to make barbecued chicken, but for now she needs the loan to invest in buying products wholesale.  Now that the products went up she wants to invest in buying bags of rice, cans of oil, vermicelli, bags of salt, and other products.

The member is requesting the loan to buy household necessity items to set up her store and to be able to make her homemade and additional meals.

She will continue working to realize her short-term projects.

loans.use: to buy household necessities to set up her store and to make her homemade and additional meals.

loans.name: Dukundane Group

texts.fr:
Stéphanie fait partie du groupe Dukundane. Elle a 36 ans et elle est mariée avec 4 enfants de 4 à 11 ans, dont 3 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3  ans de primaire.

Stéphanie est cultivatrice de pomme de terre. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des semences, des engrais chimiques location de champs et paiement main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de pommes de terre. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de moderniser son agriculture. Dans les prochaines années, Stéphanie voudrait être une grande cultivatrice des pommes de terre dans sa région. Avec les profits,elle prévoit de scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Stéphanie is a member of Dukundane Group. She's 36 years old and married with four children, aged 4 to 11. Out of them, three attend school. Her own level of educations amounts to three years of elementary school.

Stéphanie is a potato farmer. This is her second loan cycle with Kiva's partner, ACB. She will use her loan to buy seeds, chemical fertilizers, rent fields, and pay for labor for her potato farming business.

Her strategy for growing her business is to modernize her farming techniques. In the forthcoming years, Stéphanie would like to become a large potato cultivator in her region. With her profits, she intends to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy seeds, chemical fertilizers, rent fields, and pay for labor for her potato farming business

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 16 y 13 años de edad, ella administra un comedor el cual lo heredo de su familia, tiene una experiencia de 15 años en el negocio y lo atiende de 7:00am a 8:00pm.
Ella actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para preparar la comida en el negocio, comprando aceite por mayor cantidad, azúcar, maíz, carnes, condimentos, gaseosas, todo esto para surtir y disponer al momento de preparar los alimentos.
El propósito de Rosa es que su negocio crezca, trabajando fuertemente para poder generar para su familia los ingresos necesarios, apoyando a su esposo en cualquier situación.
texts.en: Rosa lives with her husband and 2 children aged 16 and 13 years. She is the manager of a diner which she inherited from her family. She has 15 years experience in the business and takes care of it from 7:00am til 8:00pm. She is currently asking for a loan to buy merchandise with which to prepare food for the business, bulk buying oil, sugar, corn, meat, seasonings, soft drinks, to stock up and use at the time of making the meals. Rosa's purpose is to grow the business by working hard to generate the income needed for her family, supporting her husband in any situation.

loans.use: to buy sugar, corn, meat, seasonings, soft drinks.

loans.name: Javanshir

texts.en: Javanshir is a 47-year-old farmer who lives in a small village in the Imishli region with his wife and three children. He breeds sheep and cattle and has 15 years of experience in this field. During these years, Javanshir has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business. He purchases lambs and calves in the central livestock market and raises them. Sheep raising takes about 3-4 months and cattle breeding takes 5-6 months. After fattening the animals, he resells them for a profit in the Imishli livestock bazaar. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. His business requires a lot of physical strength and Javanshir spends most of his time in the open air. His wife helps him to feed the animals. Javanshir's monthly income is 300 Azerbaijani manats (AZN) and Javanshir wishes to increase it. As meat is in high demand, Javanshir needs more capital to put into his business to cover the market. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1800 AZN. He will use the loan to buy 10 sheep, two cattle and one cow. He has already demonstrated himself to be a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and cattle.

loans.name: Deciderio

texts.es: Deciderio de 42 años está casado con Teodora de 40 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 2 hijos con los que viven en su casa propia ubicada en el centro poblado de Chuvivana del distrito de Sivia. Él es un agricultor de buena trayectoria que ya viene dedicándose por lo menos 7 años atrás cultivando cacao y café, productos que en estos últimos años dejan muy buena retabilidad en su comercialización y más en el mercado exterior, es por ello que los pecios de éste producto se han elevado. Gracias al empeño en el trabajo y el apoyo que tiene de su querida esposa son las ganancias que ahora ellos disfrutan. Deciderio tiene una visión a futuro, pues sabe que la fuerza física ya le va ir abandonando poco apoco a medida que su edad avanza, por tal razón desea habilitar su vivienda para una tienda de abarrotes. Este será su segundo credito con MFP, por el que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente este segundo credito. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles invertirá en la mejora de su campo agrícola, para ello contratará peones.
texts.en: Deciderio, 42, is married to Teodora, 40, and they have two children and live in their own house located in the central village of Chuvivana in the district of Sivia.  He is a farmer with a good business who, for at least seven years, has been growing cocoa and coffee.  Both products have been very profitable over the last few years, especially in the overseas markets.  This is why prices have increased.  Thanks to his hard work and support from his loving wife, they now can enjoy the profits they have earned.  With the future in mind, Deciderio knows that his physical strength will abandon him at some point as he ages, so he wants to set up a grocery store in his home.  This is his second loan through MFP and he is committed to paying it back on time.  He plans to use the 3,000 PEN loan to improve his farmland and hire workers.

loans.use: To hire workers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 49 year old business lady. She is married to Francis, who is employed. They are blessed with three children. She has been selling cereals for the past three years with the monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD., after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Elizabeth will use the loan to buy dry maize and beans for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build a store for her grains.

loans.use: to buy dry maize and beans for her business.

loans.name: Sokmaly

texts.en:
Sokmaly (pictured here), age 54, is a weaver. Her husband, Phy, age 56, is a house constructor. In addition, the couple also grows rice when rice farming season come. They live in a village along Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. And they have twelve children-six are married and live separately, two have full-time employment, one is a garment work and two are monks and another one attends school. 

Sokmaly is asking for a loan of $300 to put additional of her house.

loans.use: To put additional of her house.

loans.name: Kidubuli Banana Farmers Savings & Credit Group

texts.en:
John is a 32-year-old, hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goals include educating his children, building a permanent home and buying a car. 

John is a retailer who faces hardships such as unpredictable weather changes, customers not paying on time and high fuel and transportation costs. However, he has a vision of diversifying his business to include farming, hiring employees to help him expand his business, moving his business to a more permanent location and expanding his business to new markets. 

Christine needs a loan to buy sugar and salt for resale.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and salt for resale.

loans.name: Selomin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SELOMIN est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même ville. La représentante du groupe, nommée  Fumilayo Fifamè Edwige (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 30 ans a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Fumilayo Fifamè Edwige ne vit plus avec son mari. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Fumilayo Fifamè Edwige vit seule avec ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. C'est Pour cette raison, Fumilayo Fifamè Edwige vend des mèches et des produits cosmétiques depuis dix ans par la méthode de distribution et à son domicile. Fumilayo Fifamè Edwige s’approvisionne dans un marché du Nigéria et au Ghana. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Fumilayo Fifamè Edwige ensemble avec les membres du groupe SELOMIN sollicite pour la cinquième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont étés bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des mèches et des parfums.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is 42 years old married to Paul and blessed with five children aged between 18 and four years old.She has been into milk and tea selling business for eight years and earns a monthly income of KES.5,000.

This being her first loan with Vision Fund Kenya,she intends to pay fees, buy more milk and tea for resale in the village as she anticipates to help the husband in paying school fees for their children from the expanded business profits.


Her dream is to educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: To pay fees and purchase milk and tea to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 47 years and has 1 child. She sells food products in an area that has a lot of salaried workers. She sells local food items like gari,corn dough,cassava dough and canned foods. She also deals in fresh produce like plantains,cocoyams,yams,and cassava. Due to the high demand for these items, Rose is sometimes unable to satisfy all her clients adequately. She decided to partake in the TEACH sessions of KRABAN SUPPORT FOUDATION to equip her properly for the running of her store. With this background, she seeks the KIVA loan to procure more food items from her supplers to meet customers\' demand.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rose Mumbi Kamau intends to buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Suy

texts.en:
Mrs. Suy N. Y. is married with 2 children who are students. She lives with her husband (pictured here because Y. is at a factory) in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She and her husband make a living by selling clothes near a garment factory and make around $10 of profit. Due to a great demand and satisfying the needs of her clients, N. Y. is requesting a $1000 loan to increase her inventory by purchasing more clothes for both adults and youths.
In the future, N. Y., 37 years old, hopes to have sufficient money to expand her business by owing a clothing shop, from which she can increase her family's savings.

loans.use: To purchase more new clothes for her inventory

loans.name: Nwanbuoku

texts.en: Mrs. Nwanbuoku C. is 40 years old. She is happily married with six children. She is requesting a loan of $800 to buy more goods for sale in her little grocery store. She has 3 years' experience in her business and has been a member of LAPO for three years as well.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs to sell in her little grocery store

loans.name: Sik

texts.en: Mrs. Sik Y., age 29, is a housewife with three children who are students. Her husband, age 33, is a moto-taxi driver and earns $3 per day. She would like to borrow $325 to purchase a passenger cart to attach to her husband's moto-bike so that he can become a tuk-tuk operator and increase their income.

loans.use: Sik would like to purchase a passenger cart to attach to her husband's moto-bike so he can become a tuk-tuk operator.

loans.name: Erika Patricia

texts.es:
Since she was very young, Erika aged 33 years and her dear sister Angela, always dreamed of opening a beauty salon where they can offer quality service to their clients; finally no after much effort and much sacrifice they managed to rent and establish a small shop in the very busy commercial core of their city Juliaca. Thanks to their habilities and capabilities as cosmetologists they have earned significant clientele that has brought their beauty shop much acclaim. Erika's wish, as a working mother of a 9-month old baby, is to expand her beauty salon called "Enredos" and this way make the salon the most successful in their city, for this she wishes to obtain a loan to invest in the purchase of hair dryers, hair dyes, etc. And this way offer their demanding clientele quality service with ease, to provide her adorable baby a better quality of life. Let's support her to keep up the success in her trade as a cosmetologist.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde muy jovencita, Erika de 33 años de edad y su querida hermana Ángela, siempre anhelaron abrir su centro de belleza y ofrecer un servicio de calidad a sus clientes; finalmente ahora a base de mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio pudieron alquilar e implementar un pequeño local en un centro comercial muy concurrido de la ciudad en la que radican, Juliaca. Gracias a sus habilidades y capacidades como cosmetólogas fueron acopiando una gran cantidad de clientes que aportan a su centro de belleza muchas satisfacciones.El deseo de Erika, madre emprendedora de un bebé de 9 meses es implementar y ampliar su salón de belleza denominado “Enredos” y hacer de este local el más visitado y concurrido de su ciudad, para esto desea obtener un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de secadoras de cabello, tintes para cabello, etc. Y así ofrecer a sus exigentes clientes un servicio de calidad con suma comodidad, para brindar a s adorable bebé una mejor calidad de vida.Apoyémosla a seguir prosperando con su digna labor de cosmetóloga.

loans.use: Purchase of hairdryers, hair dyes and other articles to increase the clientele for this salon.

loans.name: Ivana

texts.es:
Mrs. Ivana buys fabric by the yard to create blanket shawls (mantas) with braiding. She works alone as her children are young and her husband is a chauffeur. She lives in the Callapa zone and her shop is located at the same address. This is the fifth time she has requested a credit from Impro and her second request for Kiva’s support. Her last payment was completed in December so she is requesting a new loan. Her history with our institution qualifies her as a first-rate customer with good completion in the payments of her debts. The sum requested will be used for purchasing basic materials (fabric, lining, braiding, and thread). Her work experience and previous credits with Impro permit her access to this credit, and her business provides sufficient income to cover the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: La señora Ivana compra tela por corte para elaborar mantas con trencillas, trabaja sola ya que sus hijos son pequeños y su esposo es chofer. Vive en la zona de Callapa y su taller también esta ubicado en la misma dirección. Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro y la segunda que solicita el apoyo de Kiva, su ultima cuota ha sido cancelada en diciembre por lo que solicitan un nuevo préstamo. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de materia prima (Tela, forro, trencilla e hilo). Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio. El cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase basic materials to create shawls

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.en:
Guillermina A. is forty-seven years old and is married to Miguel Malgarejo who is fifty-five years old. They have a son who is a student in the middle of his second school year. Guillermina is a hairdresser who works to provide for her family. A few years ago after finishing her courses to become a hairdresser, Guillermina still was not able to pay her bills. She had to sacrifice living in the city and worked as a hairdresser traveling from town to town. Now, after two years of hard work, she has saved enough money to open her own beauty salon.

Today her beauty salon is in a strategic location in Ybycuí, a town outside of Asuncion, and has had great success. However, Guillermina needs a loan to buy new furniture and supplies so that her customers are comfortable and satisfied. She is asking for a loan in order to buy chairs for the waiting room, shampoo, new scissors and to stock up on necessary supplies.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, scissors, new chairs for the waiting room, and general supplies

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam has always distinguish herself as a good business owner at her brake shop located in the city of La Merced. Thanks to her responsibility and her performance, she and her family have been able to open a repair shop and spare parts garage at their home. The great demand that exists at her town for this service has given her the opportunity to increase her income but to be able to fulfill that she will need a bigger quantiy of products and spare parts brands that she orders from the capital. She hopes that she can count with your help to increase her investment capital and the daily support of her family, if you can help her, please don't hesitate and donate to help her

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Miriam, siempre se ha caracterizado por desempeñarse adecuadamente en su negocio D. venta D. frenos, en la ciudad D. la Merced, gracias a su responsabilidad y desempeño; ella y su familia han podido abrir un pequeño local y taller D. repuestos en su casa.La gran demanda que hay en la ciudad le ha otorgado la oportunidad D. incrementar sus ingresos pero para ello requiere D. mayor cantidad D. productos y marcas D. repuestos que demanda desD. la ciudad capital D. su país.Una D. sus esperanzas es poder contar con vuestra ayuda para incrementar su capital D. inversión y solicita una suma D. dinero que le ayudará ha adquirir su mercadería D. la cual depenD. su negocio y el sustento diario D. su familia, si usted pueD. ayudar no lo duD..

loans.use: Increasing capital to acquire a larger quantity of spare parts from the different car manufacturers in order to service most of the cars that drive around town on a daily basis.

loans.name: Editra's Faith Group

texts.en:
Editra is a 30-year-old single mother of one living in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. From 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day, Editra sells decorations to support her 12-year-old child. She earns about $50 a month.

Editra hopes to expand her business so that they can lead a better life. That's why she has applied for a group loan of $575 U.S. dollars with two other women she truly trusts, Hawa S. and Fatuma N.. These women have their own business, selling cloth and soap. Because all three are determined and dedicated, Editra is certain that they will be able to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for a decorations store

loans.name: Souad

texts.en:
Souad is a 39 years old woman. She has three children. She works and lives with her family in the Beirut suburbs.

Souad is a tailor. This is the second time she applies for a loan at Al Majmoua. With the loan, she wants to buy electrical scissors for her business.

loans.use: To buy electrical scissors for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace E. is 52 years old, She is married with seven children and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks, a business she has been in since 2002. She started the business on her own.

She is a LAPO client and needs a loan of $1200 to buy more drinks and provisions for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.name: Lizabeth

texts.en: Lizabeth H. sells food stuffs. She is married, but her husband's income from driving a taxi is not sufficient for Lizabeth and their four children. Since demand for her goods is high, Lizabeth is requesting a loan of $475 to expand the business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Sobhiyeh

texts.en: Sobhiyeh is 54 years old and lives in a small village in the South of Lebanon. Sobhiyeh owns a grocery store that she named Al Saadeh (Arabic: Happiness). She needs a loan of US$ 200 to enlarge and diversify the inventory of goods she can offer to her clients. This is the first time Sobhiyeh has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: Purchase of inventory for her grocery shop

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Phạm Thị Thành, 48 yeaqrs old, is a TYM member since 2002. Her house's location is ideal for a business. She and her family run a refreshment shop right in their house serving the locals. They also supply drinks to other businesses as well. They started small, with time they have expanded their operation. They have invested a lot of money into their busibess, hundred millions VND. Their income is very stable, 300.000 VND a day. Their business plan is to offer more beer brands and soft drink variety. Their children are still attending school. This time, she is requesting a loan of 16.000.000 VND. Her family income is 7.000.000 VND a month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer.

Tham gia Quỹ năm 2002, chị Phạm Thị Thành 48 tuổi với thuận lợi gia đình chị gần mặt đường nên rất phù hợp cho công việc kinh doanh. Hiện nay gia đình chị kinh doanh các mặt hàng giải khát như bia và nước ngọt phuc vụ khách có nhu cầu giải khát tại cửa hàng gia đình chị, ngoài ra cửa hàng gia đình chị còn là nơi cung cấp cho các cho các gia đình khác cũng kinh doanh giải khát quanh khu vực. Tù những đồng vốn vay nhỏ lẻ đến nay gia đình chị đã ngày càng phát triển kinh tế số vốn đầu tư vào kinh doanh là rất lớn, hàng 100 triệu đồng. Nguồn thu nhập từ kinh doanh rất đều đặn bình quân 300.000đ/ ngày. Kế hoạch của gia đình chị trong thời gian tới sẽ mở thêm nhiều mặt hàng Bia và các loại nước ngọt khác để có thể mở rộng thị trường kinh doanh, các con chị hiện đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 16.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào kinh doanh. Thu nhập bình quân. 7.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: refreshment shop

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en: Tatu is 24 years old, and married with a 1-year-old child. She runs her own shop and she has been a clothes and cassava seller since 2005. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $100 from her sales. Tatu is now looking for a loan to expand her business by increasing her current stock.

loans.use: Tatu would like to expand her business by increasing her current stock.

loans.name: Cathy's Group

texts.en:
Cathy N. is a 38 year old married lady with eight children, who are all still in school. She also takes care of two orphans that belong to her late brother.

Cathy has had a shop for four years in which she sells new clothes. She sells a variety of women's, men's, and children's clothing of different styles and makes. In addition to the clothes business, she has had a poultry business for the last five years. She keeps 150 broilers in her garage and she would like to increase the number once she constructs more housing for them.

Cathy and the other lending group members seek to improve their businesses in order to provide for their families and dependents, especially with school fees. Cathy has booked more broilers and the loan she is asking is partly for buying the feeds that she'll need for the two months of keeping them. She will repay the loan using part of her shop profits.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell and feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Nayah Odilia

texts.en:
Odilia lives in Bamenda, Cameroon, with her husband. She supports her five children with her street grocery stall. With her loan she will purchase engine oil, kerosene, bananas, sugar cane, oranges, papaya, and watermelon. She intends to contribute 25,000 CFA ($50 USD) of her savings towards her business.

She is confident that her polite and welcoming manner will mean that her customers will continue to purchase her items. Odilia is well presented and proud of her clean premises. With the profits from this loan, Odilia will reinvest in her business, help to pay her children’s school fees, support her husband in his business, and help her daughter to start a business.

This is Odilia’s second loan; she has been a member of GHAPE since 2007. Odilia is happy to be taking out a loan with GHAPE as they have educated her on how to use her money, while still providing her with a low interest rate. She hopes to pay her loan quicker than the loan term so that she can continue to increase her loan amount with GHAPE.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Engine oil, kerosene, bananas, sugar cane, oranges, papaya, watermelon

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha tiene 26 años, vive con sus padres y hermanos. Trabaja cada día en su propio estudio fotográfico, en un pequeño local que arrendó en sociedad con una de sus tías, la impulsó el querer trabajar de manera independiente y de esta manera apoyar a sus padres. Ella atiende en su estudio fotográfico de lunes a sábado durante todo el día, sabe que los meses de mejores ingresos en su negocio son de diciembre a febrero, por ello se está preparando e implementando sus equipos fotográficos para ofrecer  un servicio de mayor calidad, ella realiza este esfuerzo para salir adelante, pensando en su futuro. Es la segunda vez que está solicitando un préstamo en MFP, ha sido puntual en sus pagos en el ciclo anterior. Berta solicita este dinero con el que podrá implementar más su estudio fotográfico con papel de impresión y una impresora fotográfica.
texts.en:
Bertha is 26 years old and lives with her parents and siblings. She works every day in her own photo studio in a small shop that she rents in a partnership with one of her aunts. She wants to work on her own in order to help support her parents. She attends to the customers in the studio all day from Monday to Saturday. The best months for her to make money in her business are from December to February; this is why she is trying to set up new photographic equipment in order to offer a better service to her customers. She puts forth a lot of effort in her business in order to create a better future for herself. This is the second loan she has requested from MFP and she was very punctual in her payments on her first loan. Berta is requesting this loan in order to set her studio up with printing paper and a photo printer.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a photo printer

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro, tiene 43 años  está acompañado con la señora Iluminada Portillo que es ama de casa tienen cuatro hijos uno mayor de edad  que se dedica a la venta ambulante de mercerías y los tres son menores dependientes de sus padres. El se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de mercaderías como por ejemplo: frutas, verduras, panificados, arroz, azúcar, aceite, yerbas entre otros.
Pedro  se ha dedicado a este rubro por más de  ocho años y su local comercial se encuentra en su  casa, dónde para esto, el realizo algunas modificaciones para poder tener el espacio correspondiente para su salón comercial. 
Pedro, con sus ganancias de las ventas aporta a los ingresos de la casa, y junto con su compañera hacen frente a los gastos  familiares.
Pedro, comenta que tiene bastante venta. Es por ello que  desea adquirir mayor cantidad de mercaderías como frutas, verduras, productos cárnicos, arroz, aceite, azúcar, etc., de este modo podrá abastecer la fuerte demanda que tiene en la zona.
texts.en:
Pedro is 43 years old and lives with his partner, Mrs. Iluminada Portillo, who is a homemaker. They have four children. One is grown up, and works selling merchandise from a cart. Three of their children are still young, and dependent on their parents. Pedro sells all kinds of merchandise, such as: fruits, vegetables, flat bread, rice, sugar, cooking oil, and herbs, among other things. Pedro has been working in this field for more than eight years. His store is in his house, where he's done some renovations in order to have a space to sell his products. Pedro uses his earnings to contribute to the family's income, and together with his partner is able to cover the family's expenses. Pedro is selling a lot. Because of this he'd like to buy larger quantities of merchandise, like fruits, vegetables, meats, rice, cooking oil, sugar, etc. In this manner he can supply the strong demand in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise, rice, sugar, cooking oil, vegetables, fruits, flat bread, and meats.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
El señor Alejandro R., tiene su casita pero el detalle es que solo tiene una recamara, desea construir un cuarto mas en la casa no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material. 
 Él esta solicitando para empezar la construcción, sus ingresos proviene como operador D. una maquiladora en esta ciudad, el no pagara mano D. obra, porque también sabe D. construcción y realizara la mejora en horas adicionales a su empleo.
 Estará muy agradecido por el apoyo recibido por ustedes, cuando realizamos la visita al domicilio del señor Alejandro no se encontraba estaba en su trabaja es por eso que en la foto sale su esposa e hijos quienes fueron los que nos atendieron.
texts.en:
Mr. Alejandro R. has a small home but it only has one bedroom. He wishes to build another room but doesn’t have the necessary funds to buy the materials. He is asking for a loan to start construction. His income as a factory worker in this city provides his income. He won’t pay labor because he also knows construction and can make the home improvement when he isn’t working. He will be very grateful for your support. When we visited his home Alejandro wasn’t there as he was at work so we met with his wife and children and they are in the photograph.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room onto his home.

loans.name: Khuseyn

texts.en:
Khuseyn M. is married with three children. This is an average family from Imishli, Azerbaijan. However, Khuseyn is a unique entrepreneur. Together with his wife, he has been selling women's clothes in the central city market for about 7 years. The secret of his success is simple: he tries to not only let their customers know the benefits of their products, he also gives them a sense of belonging which brings them back again and again.

However, Khuseyn doesn’t want to stop where he is with his venture. Khuseyn is seeking a loan of 1200 USD to replenish the merchandise in his store. We believe that Khuseyn’s desire to excel by pleasing his customers will determine his further success and encourage new customers to buy from him.

loans.use: Purchase women's clothing

loans.name: Juana Fransisca

texts.es:
Juana Francisca P. C. tiene la edad de 59 años, su estado civil es soltera. 
Doña Juana la actividad económica es la venta de ropa ella inicio este negocio hace mas de nueve años que se dedica a este negocio y por la necesidad de obtener un medio de ingreso para su familia. Los propósitos de Doña Juana son de son de invertir en su capital de trabajo para obtener más ingresos. El financiamiento esta destinado a capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar la compra de más ropa. Sus sueños son de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda por que le gustaría realizarle mejoras. La cantidad es de C$ 6.000 cordobas.
texts.en:
Juana Francisca P. C. is 59 years old and single. Juana sells clothing. She began this business more than 9 years ago and she has this business as her means of generating income for her family. Juana plans to invest the loan into working capital in order to generate more income. The financing will be used as working capital because she needs to buy more clothing. Her dreams are make home improvements on her home. She is seeking C$6.000 cordobas.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a resident of Magsaysay, Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte. She’s 35, married and has two kids who are both in elementary school. Her husband is a miner. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store in her barangay (village), which she established using her family's savings.

Mary Jane became a member of the Paglaum Cooperative last September and took out a loan worth Php 5,000.00 as additional capital for her sari-sari store. She plans to use the money to purchase grocery items. Mary Jane's hopes and dreams are to expand the business, for it to become a mini grocery store in the future and for both of her children to finish college.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items

loans.name: Maoiai

texts.en: Maoiai V., 52, is married with 8 children.  She has 4 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people/public 2 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (about US $140).  SPBD loans are Maoiai’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. The loan will be used for the business only.

loans.use: Farming supplies

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. Maria Isabel M. tiene 33 años de edad y esta casada con el Sr. Milton Casco, con quien ha tenido 3 hijos de los cuales todos estan en la escuala comunal. su esposo es motorista y trabaja en la empresa San Benito, ella se dedica al comercio desde hace 1 año, ella necesita el credito para comprar mercaderia para surtir mas su negocio en el cual le va muy bien y es su unica fuente de ingresos y como lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion no descuida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Isabel M. is 33 years old and married to Mr. Milton Casco, with whom she has three children, all in the community school. Her husband is a driver and works for the San Benito company. She has been a trader for a year. She needs credit to purchase merchandise to better stock her business, which is going well for her and is her sole source of income. As it is located in her home, she doesn't have to leave her children.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase butter, sugar, beans, rice, soap, coffee, bread

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Джураев Баходир -мужчина 33 лет. Баходир женат отец 3-х детей. Баходир недавно приехал с Российской Федерации с заработок. Баходир раньше был пастухом. Баходир хочет на полученный займ купит у знакомых пастухов скот и перепродать по выгодной ему цене. Жена Баходира домохозяйка воспитывает детей. Баходир очень рад, что сотрудничает, с нами наш займ является, для него удобным и доступным
texts.en:
Bahodur J. is a 33-year-old man. He is married and the father of three children. Recently, Bahodur returned from Russia where he had been working. In the past, Bahodur was a shepherd. With the loan he will receive, Bahodur wants to purchase livestock from his fellow shepherds and resell it at a profit. Bahodur's wife is a housewife, who raises their children. Bahodur is pleased to collaborate with MicroInvest, as the loan is opportune and affordable.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle
