loans.name: Ana Deysi

texts.es: Ana Deysi R. H. de 45 años de edad reside en San Martín, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos. Ella posee 15 años de tener un bazar y una librería, de la cual han logrado obtener muy buenas ganancias en todo este tiempo debido a que no posee ningún tipo de competencia. Ana solicita un préstamo con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, y al mismo tiempo surtirlo con mucho más producto como ropa, papelería entre otras cosas más. Esto será muy beneficioso para ella ya que podrá obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana Deysi R. H. is 45 years of age, and she lives in the town of San Martin along with her husband and two children. For 15 years she has run a small bookstore and general merchandise store which has been quite successful and profitable, due in part to the fact that she doesn’t have any competition. Ana is requesting a loan to improve her store, and to offer a broader range of items for sale, including clothing, paper goods, etc. This will be very helpful to her, enabling her to increase her profitability.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital - purchase stock for resale

loans.name: Namana

texts.fr:
Cette  femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de  chaussures, elle fait ce commerce dans le marché local de hedzranawoè, elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Vu la situation géographique de son activité elle réalise de bonnes recettes tous les jours, actuellement elle veut agrandir son activité et vendre plus. Pour se faire elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 70 chaussures de grande qualité. 
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman earns her living selling shoes. She sells them in the local market of Hedzranawoè. She buys her inventory in the big open-air market of Lomé. In view of the location of her business, she has a good turnover every day. Presently, she wants to expand her business and sell more. For that reason, she is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 70 pairs of high quality shoes.

She is married and the mother of 2 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of shoes for re-sale

loans.name: Safura

texts.en:
Safura is 40 years old. She is married and the mother of six children. Five of her children are currently in school. Safura is committed to providing better education for them and meeting their basic needs.

Safura loves selling goods, a business through which she makes a living. She trades in cereals, such as groundnuts. She fries the groundnuts to obtain the groundnut paste, which she sells in the market center. She gets her stock from Tachiman in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She is requesting a loan to buy more groundnuts to prepare the paste. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply groundnuts and other foods.

loans.name: Ahmad Zabir Group

texts.en:
A. Zabir is the leader of the A. Zabir loan group. There are four members in this group. Each member wants a loan to expand her/his business and makes it larger. 

A. Zabir wants a loan for his taxi. Shkarui wants a loan for her husband who sells paint. Roaullah wants a loan for her husband who has a general store. Haren wants a loan for her embroidery business. Together, they are requesting a group loan of 40000 Afghani. They are very thankful to Kiva lenders who can support all poor people.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa J. is from the village of San Simon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 54 years old. Josefa is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Josefa owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling eggs in the local community and local market. Josefa has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In February 2008, Josefa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Josefa is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Josefa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen M., a 35-year-old woman living in the custom area near the market, is married to a driver who drives a land cruiser in the United Nation Development Program (UNDP). She is the mother of two children. Her business is selling charcoal and she requests a loan to build a charcoal store for better storage, safe from rain.

In the future, Ellen says that if she realises possible profits, she will purchase a lorry that will carry charcoal from the producers to her main store.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a charcoal store

loans.name: Emmie

texts.en:
Emmie A. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 29 years old. Emmie is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Emmie owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling dried fish in the local community. Emmie has been engaged in her business for over 8 years with an approximate average monthly earnings of 3,000 PHP from these activities.

In 2007, Emmie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emmie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. Emmie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in a sari-sari store and raising pigs, in addition to her existing business. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Emmie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees so that they can finish their studies. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in new businesses.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma tiene 58 años, es madre D. 4 hijos, los cuales ya son mayores D. edad, independientes y radican en otros lugares fuera D. su región. En la actualidad vive junto con su esposo y su padre en su casa propia. DesD. muy temprana edad Irma se considera una mujer muy trabajadora, es por ello que cuenta con una chacra D. 30 hectáreas D. palma aceitera, pero también cultiva frutas como naranjas, mandarinas, toronjas y mangos. En esta labor ya tiene 4 años y cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo, quien se dedica netamente al cuidado D. la palma. Lo que le gusta a Irma D. su trabajo es que se mantiene ocupada, además D. serle muy rentable porque su palma ya cuenta con un comprador estable (una empresa aceitera) y sus frutas las envía al mercado cada 8 días.
Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta D. su banco comunal es que todos los integrantes ya están acostumbrados a trabajar unidos y están bien organizados. Con el dinero que solicita comprará abono para fortalecer sus plantas D. palma y sus frutas.

loans.use: Compra de abono

loans.name: Yeni Xiomara

texts.es:
la sra. YENI XIOMARA P. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia, ella es madre soltera, el cual depende a un 100% de ella. Yeni inicio con una pequeña pulpería la cual le ha ayudado en gran manera para poder seguir adelante, tamabien vende cosmeticos y cuando sale a vender cosmeticos es su hijo quien le ayuda a vender en la pulpería la que dia a dia va creciendo, debido por la buena atención con que atiende a los clientes y por la buena adminsitración que le dan a la misma.
ella tiene  1 1/2 año de haber iniciado con la pulpería y durante este tiempo le ha ido muy bien ya que sus
condiciones de vida han mejorado.- ella manifesto sentirse muy contenta por estar saliendo adelante.
Yeni esta solicitando el credito para surtir mas el negocio el cual le generara mayores ventas y su utiliddes de igual manera aumentaran.
texts.en:
Yeni Xiomara P. sells popular consumer products. She has a general store. She is a single mother, so her children are 100% dependent on her. Yeni started with a small store, and that really helped her be able to get ahead. She also sells cosmetics. When she goes to sell cosmetics, her son helps her by selling in the store. The store is growing day by day because of the good attention she gives her customers and her good administration. She started the store a year and a half ago. During this time it has gone very well for her, and her living conditions have improved. She feels very happy to be getting ahead. Yeni is asking for a loan to stock her business, which will generate more sales and more profit.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soap, shortening, oil, coffee, bread, crackers, butter, soft drinks, churros, preserves, toilet paper, pasta, salsas, and canned goods

loans.name: Tacko Mbenda

texts.fr: Tacko Mbenda F. est une femme de 45 ans elle est célibataire et vit avec son unique fille. Avec son crédit elle va renforcer sa boutique en divers produits tels que des oignons de la pomme de terre, du sucre, du thé, de la boisson en canette etc. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de contribuer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Tacko Mbenda F. is a 45-year-old woman who is unmarried and living with her only daughter.  With her loan, she is going to bolster her shop with a variety of goods, such as onions, potatoes, sugar, tea, canned drinks, etc.  Her profits enable her to help improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her small commercial business

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou S. est une femme de 50 ans, elle est veuve et mère de 7 enfants qui sont à charge. Elle est membre de BV depuis 7 ans et demi et y a reçu 15 prêts qu'elle a bien géré et remboursé. Elle développe un petit commerce de mil, d'oignons, d'arachide et de sel. Avec les bénéfices générés elle entretient ses enfants et subvient à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Fatou S., aged 50, is a widow with seven children who depend on her financially. She has been a member of Village Bank for seven and a half years, and has received and repaid 15 loans. She has a small business selling millet, onions, peanuts and salt. The income she generates is used to support her children and her personal needs.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To promote her retail food business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying fertilizer and increasing her acreage

loans.name: Anavi

texts.fr: F. Anavi est née en 1952 et vit depuis environs 57 ans à Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à NOUTCHE Kocou, un pêcheur, Anavi est mère de trois enfants, dont un est à sa charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. La famille vit à Fiégnon. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Anavi n’a pas été à l’école. Depuis près de 50 ans, Anavi vend du poisson fumé à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Anavi s’approvisionne au bord de la mer à Cotonou. Anavi a bénéficié antérieurement de deux crédit à ALIDé, et les a bien remboursés. Anavi sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’agrandir davantage son activité. Anavi ambitionne devenir plus tard un grossiste, ce qui lui permettra de vendre à des semi-grossistes et des détaillants, ses produits.
texts.en:
Anavi F. was born in 1952 and has lived for approximately 57 years in Fiégnon in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to a fisherman, Kocou Noutche, Anavi is the mother of three children, one of whom is still in her care. All her children have been educated. The family lives in Fiégnon. The couple shares the family expenses. Anavi did not attend school. For almost 50 years, Anavi has been selling smoked fish at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. Anavi gets her stock from the edge of the sea in Cotonou. Anavi has previously benefited from two ALIDé loans and repaid them both in full. Anavi is requesting a third loan from ALIDé in order to increase her business. Anavi wishes to become a wholesaler one day, which will allow her to sell her products to semi-wholesalers and retail traders.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of fresh fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Eseza Tumugirwa ‘S Group

texts.en:
Eseza is a 34-year-old married woman with five children between the ages of 10 and 20. All her children go to school. Eseza takes care of additional family members. She rents and lives in a two-room house with five people. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day. 

Eseza owns a stall where she sells secondhand clothes.  She incurs transportation costs to and from buying the clothes at the Owino Market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda.  She works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala.  She works seven days a week. She receives an average of thirty customers a day and sells to all categories of people, both on a retail and a wholesale basis.  

Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family, paying school fees for her children, and paying rent for her business and her residence. Her major business challenge is the rainy season, which hinders her customers' ability to reach her because she works in a muddy place. 

Eseza has been in this business for ten years and with the Kiva field partner, MCDT (Micro-Credit for Development and Transformation), for eight years, now servicing her 16th loan, working with the same group mates. Eseza joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women. 

She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of secondhand clothes. She hopes to see her business grower bigger so she can sell on a wholesale basis only.

loans.use: To buy more bales of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
La Sra Diana R. vive en la compañía Itapé de la ciudad de Carapeguá, desde muy joven se dedicó al oficio de tejer artículos de sobrecamas de hilo,  este oficio lo aprendió de su madre que también se didica a lo mismo, de los ingresos que obtuvo pudo estudiar como así también ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Hoy día gracias a la gran demanda que recibe de sus vendedores vió la necesidad de contar con más capital para comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima por lo que se acercó hasta la Fundación Paraguaya para solicitar un préstamo que le ayudara a  solventar la necesidad que su negocio prescindía.
Solicitó el préstamo para la compra de hilo y color.
texts.en:
Diana R. lives in the Itapé community in the city of Carapeguá. She has been weaving bedspreads since she was very young. She learned this craft from her mother who also does this. From the income she received, she was able to go to school and also help with the household expenses. Now, thanks to the great demand she gets from her sellers, she sees the need to have more capital to buy a greater quantity of raw material. That is why she has come to the Paraguaya Foundation to request a loan. The loan will help her meet the needs of her business. She asked for the loan to buy thread and dye.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy thread and dye

loans.name: Joséphine

texts.fr: G. Joséphine est née vers 1967 à Kpomassè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Joséphine vit à Cocotomey, un quartier de Cotonou, depuis environ 18 ans. Mariée à VIHO Antoine, un cuisinier,  Joséphine est mère de quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Joséphine a également un autre enfant à charge. Joséphine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Joséphine vient en aide à son mari pour supporter les charges de la famille. Pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille, Joséphine exerce comme activité, la vente de sacs d’oignons, de piments et de façon secondaire Joséphine vend également de la tomate fraiche. Joséphine effectue ses achats au marché de Sékou, dans le département de l’atlantique, et à Ouègbo au Bénin. La livraison de ses produits se fait aux revendeuses de Cococodji, un quartier de Cotonou. Cela fait bientôt 8 ans que Joséphine exerce son activité bien que n’ayant pas fréquenté l’école. Joséphine a déjà obtenu un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui a été bien remboursé. Joséphine désire augmenter sa quantité d’approvisionnement afin de mieux faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante des revendeuses des marchés de Cocotomey mais est limitée par les moyens financiers. C’est la raison pour laquelle Joséphine sollicite auprès de ALIDé un deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
G. Joséphine was born around 1967 in Kpomassè in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has been living in Cocotomey, a district of Cotonou, for about eighteen years.  Married to VIHO Antoine, a cook, she is the mother of four children, who have all had schooling.  She also has another child to support.  Joséphine helps out her husband in supporting the family. To provide for the family, Joséphine has a business selling sacks of onions, and she sells chili peppers on the side.  She also sells fresh tomatoes. She makes her purchases at the Sékou market, in Atlantique County, and in Ouègbo, in Benin.  Her goods are delivered to retailers of Cococodji, a district of Cotonou.  She has been in this business for nearly eight years, even though she did not attend school.  She has already had an ALIDé loan, which has been repaid.  She would like to have more supplies in order to cope better with the ever-growing demand of the retailers of the Cocotomey market.  But she is limited by her financial means.  This is the reason why Joséphine is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying five baskets of tomatoes

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice sells groceries and drinks. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. Beatrice, 25, is married with a child. Her husband is a civil servant and he also supports their family. Beatrice is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 26 year old married man.  His wife runs a salon.  He offers computer services such as printing documents and making business cards. He also sells rubber stamps in his shop to earn a living. He has been involved in this business for one and a half years and has one employee.  He hopes to open outlets and improve his living standards in the future.  He has requested for a loan of kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy a computer.

loans.use: To purchase a computer

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita N. is from the town of Concepcion, Tarlac. She is 45 years old, married and has 6 school-aged children. Teresita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Teresita has been involved in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,200 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting her first loan, of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Libertad Group

texts.es:
Verónica M. es integrante de la Asociación Comunal Libertad que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Panamericana, tiene 26 años y es vecina de la ciudad de El Alto, menciona que ingresó a Pro Mujer a invitación de una vecina.
 
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, desde hace 3 años aproximadamente en la feria 16 de Julio, los jueves y domingos.

Las demás integrantes de esta  Asociación tienen actividades económicas de producción, servicio y comercio y necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o materia prima, según el negocio que tengan.
texts.en:
Verónica M. is a member of the “Libertad” (Freedom) Communal Association, which is part of the Pan American Community Center. She is 26 years old and resides in the city of El Alto. It should be mentioned that she joined Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation from a neighbor. Verónica has been selling clothing for approximately three years at the July 16th fair every Thursday and Sunday.

The other members of this Association have business activities in the manufacturing, service, and retail sectors. They need this loan to acquire merchandise, supplies, and raw materials according to their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Lukia

texts.en: Lukia  is married with three children and all her children go to school. Lukia takes care of additional family members (her sister’s children). The family has access to electricity but no piped water. Lukia owns a stall selling second hand clothes and buys these clothes from Owino market, one of the biggest markets in Uganda. Lukia wants to use this loan of 400,000/ to buy more bales of second hand clothes. She has been in this clothing business for a very long time. Besides this clothing business, she also gets some money from rental rooms.  Lukia goes shopping once a week and uses public transport to and from shopping.  She doesn’t pay rent for her business because she works from her home. Lukia works six days a week and sells to all categories of people but only at retail. Business challenges include seasonality and the ever-increasing prices of second hand clothes. Lukia aspires to own a permanent business premise. Lukia joined MCDT because she wanted to access enough capital for her business.  Her monthly expenses includes food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Sreymao is single and lives with her parents and brothers and sisters along National Road Number One, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has been a farmer for more than twenty years. She grows vegetables and flowers and sells her products to a middleman. 

Sreymao previously asked for a Kiva loan to purchase a motorcycle for commuting one time already. But, she changed the purpose of the loan to connect her house to an electricity utility service, because she did not have electricity to use especially at night.
Now she is applying for her second loan of $800 to continue the purpose of purchasing a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married to a professional teacher  and they have  three children. All her children go to school.  Christine also takes care of her two nieces and her sister.  She owns a stall in Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda, selling onions. She has been in this business for seven years and with MCDT for five years. 

Christine wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of onions.  She works seven days a week. She at times sells onions to selected supermarkets in Uganda.  Her customers come from different areas within Uganda. She doesn’t incur any transport cost to and from shopping because she buys from her place of work.  Her business challenge is the ever increasing prices of onions due to floods which hit most parts of Uganda.  

Christine is aspiring of owning her own delivery van and also building her house. Christine joined MCDT because of its methodology of loaning to low income women who are in groups. Christine resides in and rents a two-roomed house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food, rent, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of onions

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 34 years old and married to a driver.  She started selling poultry three months ago, and previously she sold charcoal for a living. She wants to stabilize her business hence she has requested for a loan of KES 50,000 to buy more chickens for selling. Catherine is blessed with twins, Dennis and Kelvin, and she works hard to educate them.  She hopes to buy a piece of land and build a home in the future.

loans.use: To buy chickens for selling.

loans.name: James Lemaiyian

texts.en:
James Lemaiyian K. is a 27-year-old farmer supporting his family. His spouse is named Virginia Wambui, and she is also a farmer. In fact, he and his wife farm together on their own land. More specifically, James is a pea farmer, and he has been in this line of business for the last eight years.

This would be his second loan. In particular, he is seeking $20,000 KES (250) to buy fertilizer and chemicals for his pea farm. The remaining $20,000 KES would be used to weed and water the farm. He hopes to be able to buy some farming machinery with the expected profits as a result of this loan to expand his farming operations. His hope and dream for his business and family is to become a large-scale farmer and to be financially stable so that he can properly educate his children and build a nice house

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing fertilizer and chemicals for his farm

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es conviviente, tiene 4 hijos que estudian, Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Futuro hace 10 años y lo que aprendió en este tiempo es ser puntual.
Nancy vende golosinas y frutas en la puerta de su casa que se encuentra cerca del Colegio Libertadores, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Nancy tiene una mototaxi con la cual trabaja su esposo realizando transporte. Nancy tiene proyectado ampliar su negocio con la venta de algunos productos mas.
Nancy solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo.
Nancy tiene una casa de material rustico y su mayor sueño es tener una casa de material noble.
texts.en:
Nancy has a live-in life partner and four children who are students. She has been a member of the “Futuro” (Future) communal bank for 10 years and she learned to be punctual in this time. Nancy sells sweets and fruit in the dorrwoay of her house, which is located near Libertadores School, every day. In addition, Nancy has a mototaxi (three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo) that her husband drives providing transportation services. Nancy plans to expand her sales by adding a few additional products to her stock. Nancy requests a 1000 sol loan to buy rice, sugar and pasta. Nancy’s home is made of flimsy materials and her greatest dream is to have a house made with substantial materials.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, pasta.

loans.name: Shahnaaz

texts.en:
Shahnaaz lives in Kasur, which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its leather industry. She lives in a small home that contains two rooms in the area of Qadirabad.
 
Shahnaaz is 44 years old and has given birth to three children. Both her son and elder daughter have left their education while her youngest daughter is studying in 5th standard. 

Her husband has a business of a power loom (a machine that manufactures clothes). He operates his business in a nearby market. Shahnaz supports her family by doing an embroidery and sewing business. She learned this art from her mother. She produces quality work and receives regular orders. They have three sewing machines at their home currently. Her elder daughter also helps her in her business and sometimes her friend also joins her in this business, taking guidance from Shahnaaz about sewing. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Asasah for the expansion of her embroidery business. With the help of the loan money, she will buy an embroidery machine which will be used by her daughter because presently, she makes handmade embroidery which delays completing the orders of the customers on time. She will also buy some embroidery material such as beads, colored thread and cloth to fulfill larger orders on time. 

She is hopeful that she will definitely earn better income after investing money in her business. She is regular loan user of Asasah and is in her fourth loan cycle. In previous loan years, she has proved herself a responsible client who never missed a single meeting.

loans.use: Purchase embroidery machine and embroidery material for embroidery business

loans.name: Nana Adjoa

texts.en: Nana Adjoa A. smokes fish for sale in Elmina.  She has received a senior high school education.  She is married and has three children.  Her husband is a trader.  She helps her husband with the general upkeep of the home.  Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale.  She hopes to use the profits from her business to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: La señora Teresa tiene 57 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pues son importantes para su negocio. Ella es una mujer muy alegre y dinámica, se siente muy contenta por tener más experiencia con su actividad. Inicio hace más de 16 años con esta actividad por lo que con mucho sacrificio ha logrado mejorar cada día. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, jugos lácteos entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Señora Teresa is 57 years old and runs a small general store. This isn’t the first time that she’s had a loan as they are important for her business. Teresa is a lively and dynamic woman who is happy to have had a lot of experience running her store. She began more than sixteen years ago and by making a great deal of effort, she has gradually managed to improve it. She is now asking for a loan to buy candies, soft drinks, bread, juices and milk products etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jane A, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Joel

texts.es: Joel, de 31 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Elizabeth de 28 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Los campos de cultivo, han sido en la vida de Joel, una actividad necesaria para vivir, ya que desde muy pequeño sus padres siempre le enseñaron que trabajando en la chacra nada le faltaría, es por eso que decidió continuar con esta labor familiar y ahora tiene sus propios cultivos, donde tiene sembrados papa, arveja y flores, los cuales una vez cosechados llevará a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar, ya que sabe que de esta actividad depende la tranquilidad de su familia, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de los cambios bruscos del clima, ya que eso afecta mucho su productividad. Para más adelante, desea seguir trabajando duro y mejorando sus cultivos. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en: Joel is 31 years old and he is a very simple and hard working person. He lives in his own home together with his wife Elizabeth, 28 years old, and their three beloved children. He wishes to provide them with a better quality of life. Cultivating farm land for Joel's life has been a necessary part of living. Since he was very young his parents always taught him to work the land so he will never want for anything. He decided to continue on in the family business and now he has his own fields where he harvests potatoes, peas, and flowers. Once harvested, he takes the products for sale in the wholesalers' market in the city of Tarma. What he most enjoys about his work is sowing the fields, knowing that this business is what provides for his family. He has 8 years in the business. The most difficult part of the work is having to cope with the sudden changes in weather because it impacts productivity. In the future he hopes to keep working hard to improve his plantations. This is the fifth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He knows that this support will be very beneficial in the development of his business. He is a very responsible member of the community bank and he is well respected for it. The three thousand nuevos soles he requests will be used to purchase more fertilizer for his plantations.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Elfa

texts.en:
Elfa L. is from the village of Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Elfa is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Elfa owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Elfa is just starting this business.

In 2010, Elfa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elfa is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Elfa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Homero

texts.en:
Homero M., Jr. opened M. Gas and Tire two months ago because he wanted to be his own boss. He’s been doing this most of his life with his father, who owns convenience stores.

Homero originally went to Wells Fargo for his loan.  He said they referred him to ACCION Texas-Louisiana because they only lend to businesses that have been open for four years.  Homero says the loan will help a lot with inventory, so the store won’t look so empty.  If he does not get the loan he says “I probably would still be doing [business], but struggling a bit more.”

Homero has two sons. His wife works at a drug rehab center for children. Homero is proud of his business and he advises other business owners to “take it day by day.”

loans.use: To buy inventory for his store, primarily beer

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada A. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Balacan, Brgy. Pangobilian, Brookes Point, Palawan. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: selling fish selling and raising hogs. Her husband Billy A., who is 62 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living and helps with his wife’s business activities.  They have three children between 29 to 40 years old. 

Iluminada joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Iluminada has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 29,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 6,000 PHP to improve the family’s standard of living.  

For for her 19th loan, Iluminada is borrowing 29,500 PHP to buy fresh fish to sell at the market and to continue to saving to improve her business and provide for the education of her grandchildren. Iluminada A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through its alleviation program, NWTF is empowering women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass their dreams. They have chosen a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Luzviminda's Group

texts.en:
Luzviminda L. is from the village of San Pablo, Cauayan City, in the province of Isabela. She is 33 years old. Luzviminda is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Luzviminda is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Luzviminda owns and operates a business in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling crispy pork skin "chicharon" in the local community. Luzviminda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2006, Luzviminda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzviminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 37000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Luzviminda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the her business.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: San Pablo Proper, Cauayan City, Isabela

loans.name: Edith Amondi

texts.en:
Edith Amondi N. is 24 years old and resides at Kopere in Kapsabet town. She is a single lady and has one child who she supports. Her child is one year old. For the past two years, Edith has operated a salon in Kopere trading centre. Her monthly profits from the business are 8,500 KES. 

She has borrrowed a loan of 40,000 KES, which she intends to use to purchase braids and hair driers for her business. The anticipated profits will be saved for her child's future education. This is Edith's third loan from KADET LTD. Her previous loan of 20,000 KES was paid back successfully. In the future, she hopes to move her business from a rural area to the city. She also hopes to open a supermarket and educate her child.

loans.use: To purchase braids and hair driers

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang S., 56, is married and resides with her two children in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. S. sells rice, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 4 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 30 on food and USD 65 on the other necessary expenses. 

Neang is requesting a loan of USD 750 to purchase a motorbike for the family use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva’s partner. S. appears in the photograph with her daughter.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia E., tiene 55 años de edad, tiene hijos, todos mayores ya.
La señora Lidia E. se dedica a la venta de chipas, que es una masa preparada a base de harina de maíz y almidón, cocinadas en un horno calentado a leña. Esta venta lo realiza en forma ambulante recorriendo toda la ciudad vendiendo su producto.
Nos cuenta que para empezar con esta actividad desde muy joven trabajaba con una señora que realizaba este producto y ella lo vendía por la ciudad, posteriormente se independizó y comenzó a producir su propio producto, con la ayuda de su marido, quien realizaba la preparación y el horneado del mismo.
Ya hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este rubro y gracias al mismo logró hacer estudiar a todos sus hijos.
El préstamo solicitado es para la ampliación del horno.
La intención de la señora es la de lograr producir una mayor cantidad de chipas para un mayor ingreso.
texts.en:
Lidia E. is 55 years old.  She has children who are all now grown up.

Lidia's business is selling 'chipas'.  'Chipa' is a bread product which is made from corn flour and starch and baked in an oven heated by firewood.  She makes her sales on foot, traveling throughout the city selling her products.

Lidia tells us that she started in this business when she was very young.  She worked with a lady who made these products and sold them in the city.  Lidia then started working for herself.  She started producing her own goods, with her husband's help.  Her husband would prepare and bake the 'chipas'.

Lidia has been in this line of work for more than 15 years and, through her work, she has managed to help all of her children to complete their studies.  This loan will be used to expand her oven.  Her intention is to produce a larger quantity of 'chipas' so that she can make more income.

loans.use: To expand her oven

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutitas de Camicachi II” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y Departamento de Puno.  Está casada, tiene 41 años de edad y  tiene 06 hijos.  Estudio hasta 5to de educación primaria. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año y medio, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de animales.
Solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá comprando una vaca lechera, trabaja junto con su esposo,  paralelamente trabajan en la chacra sembrando papa, quinua, cebada, habas.  Hilda nos cuenta que su esposo trabaja en construcción civil como obrero. 
Su sueño es tener más capital para mejorar los ganados.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y las charlas de capacitación
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the “Las Kantutitas de Camicachi II” communal bank located in Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department.  She’s married, 41 years old and has six children.  She finished fifth grade.

She has collaborated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for a year and a half.  Her first loan was for 300 new soles that she invested in her livestock buying and selling business.

She will ask for a new 1500 new sol loan to buy a dairy cow.  She works alongside her husband in the fields farming potatoes, quinoa, barley and lima beans.  Hilda tells us that her husband works in civil construction as a laborer.

Her dream is to have more capital to improve the livestock.

What she likes about the communal bank are the meetings and the training sessions.

loans.use: She will buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is currently in the business of selling food in a restaurant. She is 38 years old, a widow with 4 children, and all of them go to school. Regina borrowed a loan to stock more foods to sell in the restaurant. With extra profits from the business, Regina hopes to pay her children in school in the future.

loans.use: stock more foods  to sell in the restaurant

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and school fees. Silas has operated a butcher business for the past three years. His potential customers are the local residents. 

He faces a major challenge of escalating prices of cow meat in the market. With the 20,000 KES he is requesting, Silas wants to purchase a cow for slaughter in his butcher shop. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of its efficiency of loan products.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for slaughter in his butcher shop.

loans.name: Marylou

texts.en:
Marylou is 35 years old. She lives in Trinidad, Bohol with her husband and two children. Her husband is a fisherman. Marylou is the one who sells his catch to the market.

Marylou plans to use her loan to purchase hooks, nets and other fishing materials. This will help them have more fish to sell.

In the future, Marylou hopes to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase hooks, nets and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Kadija

texts.en: This is 31-year-old Kadija K.. She is married and has four children aged 15, 12, 7 and 3. In 1998, Kadija K. started selling foodstuffs. She began her business after gaining enough experience from her elder sister. Working seven days a week and eleven hours a day, she earns about 500,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan of 3,000,000 SLL in order to purchase more food stuff for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL. In the future, Kadija plans to build her own dwelling house and educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn E. is 31 years old, married, and has three children. She is engaged in farming and has been growing rice for five years. Roselyn earns just enough income for the family. She works hard to improve her income and save for her children’s future.

Roselyn is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fertilizers, gasoline for the tractor, and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, gasoline for the tractor, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is from the village of Mandulog, Iligan City. She is 32 years old. Carol is widowed and has four adult children. She raises and sells goats & chickens. She also sells blouses, t-shirts & pants in her community. Carol has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2011, Carol joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Carol is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Carol from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI: 

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

location.town: Mandulog, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Ana Julissa

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal José Cesario Reyes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 28 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres. Es licenciada en publicidad y mercadotecnia. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya por dos  ciclos y le gusta porque con los créditos ella ha podido ir aumentando su pequeño negocio.

Es una mujer muy emprendedora que no solo se conforma con un sueldo sino que busca siempre mejorar su situación, ella trabaja de secretaria en la Notaria Publica De Montecristi pero también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, nos cuenta que sale en las noches una vez que haya terminado sus horas laborables en su trabajo, aunque comenta que allí también tiene clientes a quienes les deja mercadería. Deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días. Tiene cuatro  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.

Su sueño es tener una gran boutique.
texts.en:
The José Cesario Reyes community bank meets every fifteen days in the Montecristi canton, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts, which are recognized on both a national and international level.  It is also known for its famous Panama hats.

Here we meet Ana, who is 28 years old and lives in her parent's house.  She has a degree in advertising and marketing.  She has been a member of the community bank for two cycles and she likes it because she can improve her small business with the loans.

She is an enterprising woman who is not only content with a salary, but is always looking to improve her situation.  She works as a secretary at the Notary Public of Montecristi, but she also sells clothing of all types.  She sells door to door.  She goes out at night after her work hours have ended, although she also has customers for whom she leaves merchandise.  She offers credit to her customers and collects payments every fifteen days.  She purchases her merchandise in Guayaquil every fifteen days.  She has been doing this work for four years and it is going very well.  

She will use this loan to purchase more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.

Her dream is to have a large boutique.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is 27-year old businessman, married, and the father of two children. He specializes in selling second-hand clothes and his business has been in operation for 11 years. This is his first loan from KADET to buy more clothes for sale. He intends to repay on time and diversify into other market areas in order to support his family. He wants to expand his business and purchase land to provide a better living standard for his family.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Assa

texts.en:
Assa  lives in  Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.  Assa has a business selling crafts.  She has been in this business for five years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Assa sells her products at the market, retail.    

Assa has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crafts like baskets, mats and tablecloths. 

The main business challenges for Assa include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to employ women to help in making and weaving these crafts.   

Assa lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more baskets, mats and tablecloths.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses, a 38-year-old married father of five children, owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in agriculture for 20 years, having started with a banana plantation but later diversifying to other crops such as coffee, avocados and potatoes. His major business hardships are price fluctuations and high transportation costs.

Moses is requesting this loan to plough his land. His goals are to have a model farm and a well-educated family free from poverty.

loans.use: to plough his land.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
Socorro vive al sur de la  ciudad de Barranquilla, con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 14 y 18 años; allí se dedica a la confección de ropa de maternidad, actividad que inició hace 4 años cuando vendía en un almacén de insumos para la confección y de allí le nació la idea de independizarse y emprender su propia aventura de negocios, instalándose en un local, el cual es atendido por su esposo,  desde hace más de un año, mientras Socorro se capacitó en la actividad de modistería y sastrería en el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje “Sena”,  institución que cumple la función de invertir en el desarrollo social y técnico de los trabajadores colombianos, con Formación Profesional Integral gratuita, para lograr la incorporación y el desarrollo de las personas en actividades productivas que contribuyan al desarrollo social, económico y tecnológico del país. 
Así es que una vez aprendió  este oficio, se enfocó en la línea de maternidad que hasta hoy también comercializa en su local.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará materias primas e insumos para confeccionar, pues está sacando nuevas colecciones para impactar a su clientela. 
Su meta es consolidar su almacén ubicado en la zona norte de la ciudad y que este se convierta a su vez en una fuente de ingreso y empleo para su familia.  Su máximo desafío es lograr su posicionamiento en el mercado, pues es muy fuerte la competencia aunque sus productos son de muy buena calidad y por eso su operación es de alto costo. Mientras cumple sus sueños maneja una rentabilidad no inferior al 48% que cada día se esfuerza por que esta sea estable y superarla.
texts.en:
Socorro lives to the south of the city of Barranquilla, with her husband and two children, aged 14 and 18. She makes maternity clothes, an activity she began 4 years ago when she was working as a sales assistant in a shop selling dressmaking supplies. From there was born the idea of becoming independent and starting her own business venture. She installed herself in a location, which her husband staffed for over a year while Socorro trained in design and sewing with the National Learning Service. The National Learning Service is an institution which invests in the social and technical skills development of the Colombian workforce, providing free professional training courses to support people's development in activities which contribute to the social, economic and technological development of the country.

Once she had learned her trade this way, Socorro focused on the line of maternity wear that she still sells in her shop today. Her Kiva loan is the first finance she has had from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and with it she will buy materials and supplies for dressmaking, because she is bringing out new collections to please her customers. Her aim is to consolidate her store in the north of the city, and to build it up over time into a source of income and employment for her family. Her greatest challenge is securing her position in the market, because the competition is stiff and, because her clothes are of very good quality, her costs are high. While she works to achieve her dreams she is working at a profit of no less than 48%, and every day she works to ensure this is stable and even to improve on it.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for dressmaking.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 28-year-old married man, working since December 2001 at selling used spare parts. His work is unique in his area.

Abdallah buys used appliances and takes them apart to sell each part alone, which people find attractive since most of the time these parts are needed but can't be found easily anywhere.

Abdallah is a man with a good reputation; he is well known in his region and recommended by most of his customers.

Abdallah is working hard on expanding his business and to buy a small plot of land where he can build his dream house for his family to enjoy living in a healthy environment. He is requesting a loan from Al Mjamoua, a Kiva partner, in order to increase his inventory of used spare parts, which will definitely increase his income  and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To increase his inventory of used spare parts.

loans.name: Carlos Manrique

texts.es:
Carlos Manrique es un señor de 37 años de edad, vecino de una comunidad rural de Costa Rica situada 45 kilómetros al sur de San José llamada San Cristóbal Norte. San Cristóbal es una zona un poco montañosa donde se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, agricultura de hortalizas, café y otros, artesanía, ganadería y muchas otras actividades. Don Carlos vive con su esposa e hijos.

Desde hace varios años que don Carlos inició en el campo de la agricultura especialmente de hortalizas. El siembra diferentes productos los cuales vende en su negocio a la hora de la cosecha. Su microempresa ha ayudado a que la condición de vida de su familia haya mejorado considerablemente. Dice que el poder brindar un buen servicio a las personas y cumplir con sus exigencias, son la base del éxito del negocio.

Actualmente don Carlos requiere un préstamo de ¢400.000 (cuatrocientos mil colones) para la compra variedad de hortalizas. Con esta espera agilizar y facilitar su trabajo.

Don Carlos es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN), una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Carlos Manrique is 37 years old and lives in a rural area of Costa Rica called San Cristóbal Norte, 45 kilometers south of San José. San Cristóbal is a somewhat mountainous region where people engage in activity such as commerce, farming vegetables, coffee, and other crops, handcrafts, ranching, and many other activities. Don Carlos lives with his wife and children.

Several years ago Carlos began farming, especially vegetables. He grows different crops, which he sells in his business at harvest time. His microbusiness has helped to improve his family's quality of life considerably. He says that the basis for his business' success is being able to provide good service to people and meet their demands.

Currently, Carlos needs a loan of 400,000 colones to purchase a variety of vegetables. With this he hopes to speed up his work and make it easier.

Carlos is a member of the San Cristóbal Norte communal bank, one of the 110 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to plant vegetables

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Veronica tiene la edad de 33 años, estudio hasta la primaria, esta casada con el señor Guadalupe que trabaja de obrero, ellos tiene 3 hijos los cuales 2 estudian la secundaria y 1 la primaria. Ellos viven en una zona cañera. 

Ella nos comenta que desde hace 3 años decidio iniciar con su propio negocio de venta de topper y cosmeticos por catalogo porque queria apoyar a su esposo con los gasto del hogar y ademas penso en un futuro sus hijos querian seguir estudiando y pues ella quiere ofrecerles una profesion.

Doña Veronica realiza sus ventas de topper y cosmeticos por catalogo casa por casa,  su manera de trabajar es mostrandole a sus amigas y vecinas sus catalogos, levanta pedidos y ella suerte esos pedidos los cuales entrega a sus clientes y recibe el pago por sus productos.

Ella necesita este credito para la compra de topper, lapiz labial, esmalte, perfumes, delineadores, maquillaje en liquido, sombras y topper para su posterior venta de sus productos.

Doña Veronica se encuentra muy agradecida con fundacion Realidad, y tambien espera que con este credito su negocio prospere.
texts.en:
Sra. Veronica is 33 years old and has an elementary school education.  She is married to Sr. Guadalupe, who is a laborer.  They have three children, two of whom are in high school while the other is in elementary school.  Veronica and her family live in a sugar cane region.  

She says that three years ago she decided to start her own business selling Tupperware and cosmetics through catalogs because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses.  In addition, she thinks about her children’s future and wants them to continue their studies so that they can pursue a profession.  

Doña Veronica sells Tupperware and cosmetics by going house-to-house.  By working in this manner, she is able to present catalogs to her friends and neighbors.  After taking their orders, Veronica stocks up on merchandise and then delivers the orders to her customers and collects payment.  

She needs this loan to buy Tupperware, lip pencils, nail polish, perfumes, eye liners, liquid foundation, and eye shadow for eventual resale.  

Doña Veronica is very grateful to Fundación Realidad and hopes that this loan will prosper her business.

loans.use: to buy Tupperware, lip pencils, nail polish, perfumes, eye liners, liquid foundation, and eye shadow.

loans.name: Berkis

texts.en:
Berkis is a hardworking woman with 8 children. Just 6 of them live together with her and her long term partner. The other two live with their own families. Berkis is located in the agricultural city of Hato Mayor.

She has a little stall in her house to sell vegetables. She will invest this loan to buy different vegetables like plantains, cassava and also salad and fruits. Around 7 years ago, Berkis started her business with her first Esperanza loan, where she started to receive loans with a group. Now she is taking loans by herself in bigger amounts. She is planning to save her profits to help her children attend school, and lately to support them with their university expenses.

She thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Enhbaatar

texts.en:
Enhbaatar is 28 years old and lives with his two children and wife in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. His wife helps him to manage the family business. 

He started his business in 2010 by selling food and other products in his hometown. He is very encouraged with his business growth and expansion. He believes that he will be a successful businessman in the near future. 

He is a diligent and hard-working man who says, "I want to develop and expand my business with the bank loan. I also have a plan to buy a car for my business and family. I think this is only the start of everything." 

He is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to buy construction materials to build the grocery shop.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 35-year-old Ugandan who hails from Kyenjojo district in Uganda. He deals in timber sales and is married with 3 children, ages 7 through 13, living in his own permanent house. He faces a problem of fuel prices that leads to high costs of operation. He has been in this business for 10 years, having gotten his initial capital from the sale of tea which he still grows. Robert intends to use the loan to buy timber for resale.

loans.use: to buy timber for resale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 26 years old, married to Josephine, and blessed with two children, ages 5 and 2. He runs a retail shop and has been in business for three years, with a monthly income of 6,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

He is borrowing a loan of 10,000 KES to add stock to the business, like two crates of soda, cooking fat, and maize flour.

He plans to pay back his loan with the anticipated profit from the business. This is his first loan. His dream is to own a big shop.

loans.use: to buy two crates of soda, cooking fat, and maize flour

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en: Abdullah is a 21-year-old single man from Ramallah. On March 1st, 2010 Abdullah opened his own business, a cell phone store. His store is different from others because it is on the main street, and many people see the store. With this loan, he will buy new accessories to sell for the cell phones he has in the store.

loans.use: To buy new accessories for the cell phones he has in the store.

loans.name: Dancille

texts.en:
Dancille is married with 4 children aged 18 to 33. She has been a maize farmer for 40 years. She would like a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides to grow her crop. She will use Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizers in order to increase production.
 
With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides to grow her crop.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es: Elva, de 21 años, es una mujer del campo. Vive en compañía de su mamá Graciela y sus 3 hermanos: José, Sayuri y Alex a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Armaspampa. Hace poco vendió los 2 toros que poseía. Ella se dedica a la crianza de animales como las 15 ovejas, 3 vacas y toros que posee; los que alimenta para luego engordarlos y venderlos al mejor postor. Le va muy bien en su negocio y le gusta ello, ya que así puede ayudar a sus hermanos y a Graciela, su mamá, que es una valiente madre soltera.  De la misma manera cuenta con sembríos de papa, cebada, alverja, habas y trigo, los que realiza en terrenos agrícolas propios, cuenta que posee 2 hectáreas que en cada cosecha producen los alimentos que comercializa en la feria de Acostambo. Ahora ella desea aumentar su ganado ya que vendió muchos y ahora se quedo con pocos. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Jatum Llacta” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Elva, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlo entre sus cultivos de papa “yungay”.
texts.en:
Elva, 21, is a country woman.  She lives with her mother Graciela and her three siblings, José, Sayuri, and Alex, whom she takes care of in her own home, located in the community of Armaspampa.

A short time ago she sold the two bulls that she had.  She works raising animals, such as her fifteen sheep, three cows, and bulls, which she feeds to fatten and later sell.  It is going very well for her in her business and she likes this, since in this way she can help her siblings and Graciela, her mother, who is a courageous single mother.  At the same time, she has potato, barley, pea, bean, and wheat crops, which she grows on her own croplands.  She says she has two hectares that in each harvest produce food that she sells in the market of Acostambo.

Now she wants to increase her livestock since she sold many animals and has only a few remaining.

She belongs to the Jatum Llacta solidarity group, and this is her first loan with MFP.  She hopes for your collaboration so she can realize her plans.  On the other hand, she promises to make her payments.  Also, she likes to be part of her bank because all the members are responsible and supportive people.

When Elva receives her support she will invest the requested money in buying natural fertilizer to spread on her crop of Yungay potatoes.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Célestin

texts.fr: Célestin est âgé de 41 ans et est marié à une marchande du nom de Odette. Le couple a treize enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a deux autres enfants en charge. Célestin n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Célestin mène comme activité depuis trente ans environs, la culture des céréales qu’il vend dans sa région. Parallèlement à cette  activité, Célestin fait la pêche. C'est dans une ville du Bénin que Célestin exerce ses activités. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Célestin sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Son ambition est d’accroître le niveau de son activité. Les quatre premiers crédits reçus antérieurement par Célestin ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Célestin, age 41, is married to a merchant named Odette. The couple has thirteen children to support, out of which some attend school. In addition, they have two other children to support. The couple covers the various family expenses together.

Célestin never attended school. To provide for himself and his family, he's been growing cereals for about thirty years. He sells his crops in his region.

In parallel, Célestin is a fisherman. He runs his businesses in a town in Benin. In order to bolster his business and better meet customer demand, he's seeking his fifth loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé.

He ambitions to bolster his business. The first four loans he received previously were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy products for his farm business (chili pepper, tomatoes, bean, and corn)

loans.name: Mirna Yoany

texts.es:
Mirna, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, está acompañada y tiene cuatro hijos, vive en su propia casa, ella tiene tres años de estar vendiendo las tortillas, este negocio surge por iniciativa propia, hasta el momento ha logrado sacar a su familia adelante. 
Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en compra de leña y maíz, esta compra le ayudara para mantener lo necesario para la elaboración de las tortillas y continuar así en su negocio.
La aspiración de Mirna es fortalecer el negocio con esta compra, para poder brindarles a sus hijos una mejor solvencia económica y cubrir sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Mirna works selling tortillas. She has a partner and lives with 4 children in her own house. She has been selling tortillas for three years. She launched this business through her own initiative and so far she has been able to move the family forward. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy wood and corn. This purchase will help her to have what she needs in order to make tortillas and to continue with her business.

Mirna’s dream is to strengthen the business with this purchase in order to be able to give her children a better economic situation and to meet their needs.

loans.use: to buy firewood and corn

loans.name: Tecoporave Rekavo Group

texts.es:
14 mujeres de la ciudad de Asunción, se han unido con el objetivo de ayudarse las unas con las otras por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Este grupo se encuentra en el cuarto ciclo, todas las mujeres son trabajadoras, luchadoras y muy sacrificadas.
una de las miembros es la señora Patricia, quien nos comenta que se dedica al reciclaje, este es un trabajo muy sacrificado, ya que ella tiene que recorrer por las cales buscando productos que sean reciclables. Ella está muy orgullosa de lo que hace, pues es un trabajo digno y honesto y gracias a esto puede dar a su familia todo lo que ellos necesitan.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales reciclables en cantidad, para que de esa forma revenda y tenga un poco más de ganancias. Agradece por esta oportunidad que se les da.
texts.en: Fourteen women from the city of Asuncion have joined with the goal of helping each other by working together. This group is in the fourth cycle; all women are working, struggling and living hard lives.  One of the members is Mrs. Patricia, who tells us that she sells recycling, this is very hard work, and she has to go traveling the streets looking for products that are recyclable. She is very proud of what she does, it is a decent and honest job and because of this she can give her family everything they need.  She is requesting a loan for the purchase of recyclable materials in quantity, to resell and have a little more profit. She is thankful for the opportunity given to them.

loans.use: to purchase recyclable materials for resale.

loans.name: Suha

texts.en: Suha is a 34-year-old housewife who has three children. For four years Suha has been working as a hair stylist at home where she has some of the equipment that a beauty salon would have. Now Suha want to buy new hairdryers and other equipment in order to prepare to open a bigger beauty salon that is separate from her house. For this reason, she has applied for a loan.

loans.use: to buy new hairdryers and other equipment.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 51 years old and married with nine children.

Melinda works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store and farming rice businesses in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Melinda has been in this business for eleven years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Melinda aspires to save enough money to expand her business and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Améfa

texts.en:
Born in 1965 in Ghana, Améfa O. is married and the mother of four. She is a persevering and very courageous woman. Though very active, she does not have a lot of financial resources. She has a small «table business», where she sells various items displayed at her stand. Her husband, an accountant, has been without a job for three years, and the situation has become difficult for the family. That is why he turns to his wife to pay practically all the bills. Now then, the income from her business is not at the level needed to meet this responsibility.

And so she is requesting a loan of $750 to increase the size of her business and to clear a substantial profit, in order to deal with household requirements.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1965 au Ghana, Madame O. Améfa est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Elle est une femme persévérante et très courageuse. Très active mais n’ayant pas beaucoup de moyens financiers, elle fait un petit commerce de table de produits divers. Son mari, un comptable, est sans emploi depuis 3 ans et la situation est devenue très difficile dans la famille. C’est alors qu’il revient à la femme de prendre en charge la quasi-totalité des charges du ménage. Or, le revenu tiré de son commerce n’est pas à la hauteur de cette responsabilité.

Aussi, sollicite-t-elle un crédit de $750 qui va augmenter la taille de son activité et dégager un revenu substantiel afin de faire face aux exigences de son ménage.

loans.use: Table business and various items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary Maante intends to buy four steers

loans.name: Steve O.

texts.en: Steve is 24 years old, and a vibrant, “peoples' man”. He aspires to buy a truck and a business licence. This will enable him to transport more goods to the city and thus increase his income.

loans.use: To buy a truck and a business licence

loans.name: Bosede

texts.en: Mr. Bosede O. is a young woman of 31 years, and married with 3 children. She is a native of Ekiti State, Nigeria. She specializes in the sale of clothes, shoes and bags. "I need the above amount to expand my business," said Mrs. Bosede, who has been in this business since 2002.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, bags and shoes

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela and her husband have four daughters - 2 are in grade school, one is about to complete her university degree online, and the 4th is attending university locally.
