In order to supplement their income, they have turned a strategic section of their backyard into a small general store where they sell important household items. In order to stock her store, Manuela often travels to her country's capital, where she purchases a variety of items at good prices. While she travels she depends on her daughters' help running the shop and on the help of her husband who takes on independent side jobs, which is necessary to supplement their expenses and help pay their daughters' educational expenses.

Manuela is requesting a loan of $1,200 USD in order to purchase home decoratives and clothing in order to supplement the products she currently sells in her store. She is planning to repay this loan within 6 months. Together we can quickly make her dreams a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Manuela y su esposo tienen 4 hijas, dos de ellas aún en etapa escolar, la mayor a punto de culminar sus estudios universitarios exitosamente y la segunda en continuas horas de estudio también en las aulas universitarias de su ciudad. Actualmente como sostén del hogar cuentan con una pequeña tienda de venta de artículos de primera necesidad, ubicada en un lugar estratégico en el patio de su casa.Para mantener muy bien equipado y acondicionado este espacio viajan constantemente a la capital de su país con el objeto de traer mayor variedad y cantidad de productos para ofrecerlos a menor costo, cuenta con el apoyo de dos de sus hijas en la bodega mientras esta ausente y adicionalmente también recibe el aporte de su esposo que realiza trabajos en forma independiente para satisfacer exitosamente las necesidades de su hogar y la educación de sus hijas. El próximo objetivo de Manuela es incrementar sus servicios y productos con la venta de ropas y adornos para el hogar. Debido a ello solicita un préstamo de 1200 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un lapso de 6 meses. Juntos podemos lograr la cristalización de sus anhelos en poco tiempo.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase home decorative items and clothing to sell in her store, which will help grow their business.

loans.name: Dalia

texts.es:
In 2004 Dalia began to sell cosmetics from a catalogue and other products, in order to meet household expenses, as her husband works as a fisherman and during the off-season he can’t earn much money. Dalia and her husband have 5 children between 5 and 11 years old, and as a result the expenses of school, clothing and food are very high, and with the little that her husband and Dalia earn the family has to survive.

For this season Dalia wants to prepare by stocking-up merchandise which her customers have asked for as presents. It is for this that she is asking for a loan of $475, to be repaid in a period of 4 months and with the money Dalia will be able to buy merchandise to offer to her clients. With your help Dalia will be able to move forward with her 5 children, who need her very much in order not to stray off-track in their lives.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Desde el 2004 Dalia comenzó a vender cosméticos por catálogo y otros productos, para poder mantener los gastos del hogar, puesto que su esposo trabaja como pescador, y en temporadas de veda, no obtiene mucho dinero. Dalia y su esposo tienen 5 hijos entre los 5 y 11 años de edad, por lo que los gastos de su escuela y los gastos de ropa y comida son muchos, y con lo poco que gana el esposo y Dalia es con lo que vive la familia.

Para esta temporada Dalia se quiere preparar, puesto que es cuando sus clientes le piden cosas para regalos. Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo de US $475 para pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero Dalia podrá comprar mercancía para poder ofrecerles a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Dalia sacará adelante a sus 5 hijos que tanto la necesitan para no irse por el mal camino de la vida.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Aquina

texts.es:
Mrs. M. is a member of the Atenas Portillanas microfinance institution. She lives in Jr. Miguel Grau 150, located in the Yarina Cocha district of Ucayali. She is a 60-year-old mother of 3 dependent children. Her husband is a merchant, but his income is not sufficient enough to cover all the household expenses. Consequently, Aquina decided to use her first loan of 300.00 soles from Manuela Ramos to set up a mini market.

Aquina currently runs her well-stocked market, but at the same time she also makes time to take care of her school age children.

With this loan of 1, 200.00 soles, which she will pay off in 6 months, she will purchase rice, cooking oil, jam, sugar, a large crate of milk, noodles, five packs of bathroom tissue, a box of detergent, and 5 cases of soft drinks.

Aquina is a hard-working woman who has been able to push her children forward with great effort and dedication. She is very happy that Manuel Ramos has supported and trusted her, in so doing giving her the opportunity to advance.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Aquina pertenece al Banco Comunal Atenas Portillanas, vive en el Jr. Miguel Grau 150, ubicado en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 60 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos que aún depende de ella, es casada, su esposo es comerciante, pero el ingreso que tienen no alcanza para cubrir los gastos del hogar, es así que Aquina, con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00, decide invertir en una bodega.

Actualmente Aquina atiende la bodega que es muy surtida, pero a la vez se da tiempo para atender a sus hijos que tienen que ir a la escuela.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará un saco de arroz, dos paquetes de aceite, una caja de conserva, un saco de azúcar, una caja de leche grande, un paquete de fideos, cinco paquetes de papel higiénico, un paquete de detergente y cinco cajas de gaseosa.

Aquina es una mujer luchadora porque supo sacar adelante a sus hijos con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, se siente muy feliz dado que Manuela Ramos le ha apoyado y ha confiado en ella y de esa manera poder seguir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, cooking oil, jam, sugar, milk, noodles, bathroom tissue, detergent, and soft drinks

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is married with four children.  He is 45 years old and he has been in business for the past six years.  His business is the sole source of income for his family.  Samuel has been accessing micro-loans from SMT and he is now requesting a larger loan to continue expanding his business.  He sells used clothing in the town of Kabala in Sierra Leone.

loans.use: Samuel would like to improve his clothing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more cosmetics and possibly home appliances

loans.name: Lake H A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Hawa N.. She is currently in the business of running a grocery store and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Hawa is 42 years old and single. She has 6 children ranging from age 1 to 20 and most of her children go to school. Each week, Hawa makes approximately UGX 21000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business and repay the loan. Hawa has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to purchase more goods and the loan was paid back on time.

Hawa is joined in her small group by Jalia B. and Jaria M.. Jalia B. has a business running a clinic and wants to add more equipment like beds, furniture and mattresses. Jaria M. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to improve her stall.

loans.use: To add more working capital to grocery business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose C. is a trader who owns a provision store. She is the single mother of child. Her income is not sufficient to meet her and her child's financial needs. She wants to increase her income by increasing sales.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Mr Benjamin I. is married with two children. He is 40 years old and he lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He sells cooked food and drinks, a business he learnt from friends for two years. He has been running his own business for the past eight years.

Mr I. needs a loan to buy more drinks and foodstuffs for sales to satisfy the demand of his customers.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and food stuffs for cooking and sales

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! Rehema K. is 40 years old. She is married and has four children between the ages of 11 and 24. In 1997, Rehema established her fish business.

SELFINA is a pioneer in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microlending. SELFINA provides a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Thus, women are termed not credit worthy by financial institutions, because they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, and thus poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from that client, extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment. This process is called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

Rehema has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requests a new loan in order to purchase more fish in bulk to stock her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more fish in bulk to increase inventory

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, 51 years old, lives with his wife and 2 children in Tripoli, Northern Lebanon. Ahmad owns a shop where he sells spare parts and accessories for cars. He is a very hardworking person and very determined to make a difference in his family life.

Ahmad has been working in this business for a long time. He needs a loan of US$1,200 to purchase more goods for his shop. He promises to repay his loan on a monthly basis. This is the first time Ahmad has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

loans.use: To increase shop inventory

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is thirty-eight-year-old Amina from Dar es Salaam; she is married and has four children. Amina runs a small stall from which she sells tomatoes in downtown Dar es Salaam. The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is genge.

A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

Amina started her stall in 2000 and has been earning monthly profits of US$ 150 from it since. This is Amina’s second loan from SELFINA; she successfully repaid her first loan of US$ 275. She is now requesting US$ 625 in order to buy large quantities of tomatoes in bulk and to renovate her stall. Thank you for supporting Amina in her efforts to improve the volume and sales of her business!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence the poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client.

The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To renovate her stall and to buy produce in bulk

loans.name: Mwanajuma's Mkorofi Si Mwenzetu. Group

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is 29 years old and divorced with 2 children aged 14 and 7. She has been a food seller since 2000. Every day, she works from 9AM to 10PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Mwanajuma now requests a loan to buy more food items for expansion of her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses of selling food, charcoal, firewood, clothes, juice and snacks.

loans.use: To buy more food items for expansion of her business.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
Mahmud G. is 46 years old and is married with three children. Mahmud has always opted to make his life in his land, and work hard and grow with it. That is how he decided to rear cows and dedicate himself to agriculture. He has been doing this kind of work for a very long time, as he comes from a family with an entirely agricultural background, and now he is in charge of handing down all that experience to his children.

Today, he wishes to increase the number of his cattle and he would like to buy cows with the hope of increasing his income and the well-being of his home with the innumerable benefits that these special little animals provide him. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 3500 Somoni (US$1050) for the term of 12 months. Extend your solidarity to Mahmud so that he can move forth successfully and accomplish all his goals.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Katherine

texts.en:
Katherine O., 52, lives with her husband and six children in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions, drinks and sarongs and has a good profit from her sales.The demand for her products is high because she is the only person selling these items in the area where she lives.

She is requesting a loan to purchase a generator, repair her refrigerator and also purchase more products to increase her inventory. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase one generator, repair her refrigerator and purchase more provisions for resale.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es: La señora Maria Ester P. tiene la edad de 35 años, habita en el barrio san caralampio ubicado en La Concepción. Junto a su esposo y hijos, el esposo trabaja como conductor para apoyarle con los gastos de la casa, ella se siente muy apoyada por la mano amiga de Afodenic; ya que ella a logrado establecer un poco mas su negocio, lo cual tiene un poco de variedad, con esta solicitud va invertir mas en ropa y adornos navideños par ala temporada de la navidad y así ofertar a sus clientes y captación de otros, la mayor dificultad que anteriormente había tenido era la falta de financiamiento  , pero ella alega que ya no le preocupa por que nuestra financiera siempre le apoya .Los sueños de esta señora es llegar a tener una micelania para poder darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia .
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Ester P. is 35 years old and lives in the San Caralampio neighborhood, located in La Concepción, with her husband and children. Her husband works as a driver in order to help with the household expenses. She feels that she has been supported by Afodenic’s helping hand because she has managed to get her business, which now offers more variety, a little more established. She will invest this loan in clothing and Christmas ornaments for the holiday season, that way, she can offer more products to her customers as well as bring in more customers. Her greatest problem is that she had previously had a lack of funds, but she claims that she no longer worries about that because our microfinance institute always supports her. She dreams of setting up a general store in order to improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing for children and adults

loans.name: Venancio

texts.es:
El Sr. Venancio esta casado con la Sra. Eladia, ellos tienen  2 hijos menores que aun están en la escuela primaria.
El Sr. Venancio se inició en este trabajo con la ayuda de un tío que desde chico le había enseñado la profesión de tapicero.-
El junto su dinero durante varios años para poder independizarse y así dar una estabilidad económica a su esposa e hijos.
La Sra. Eladia le ayuda en algunas pequeñas cosas que ya ha aprendido de su marido.
Ellos viven en un barrio donde son muy queridos por lo vecinos y actualmente ya tienen una clientela formada.
texts.en:
Mr. Venancio is married to Mrs. Eladia, and they have 2 younger children who are still in elementary school. Mr. Venancio started to work when he was very young with the support of his uncle who taught him the profession of upholstery.

He saved money for several years to become independent and offer economic stability to his wife and children.

Mrs. Eladia helps him with some details she has learned from her husband.

They live in a neighborhood where they have an excellent relationship with the neighbors and presently they can count on a group of stable clients.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials such as thread, fabric and leather.

loans.name: Pardaqul

texts.ru: Раджабов Пардакул житель города Яван. Живет очень далеко от центра города. Семью обеспечивает путем разведения и продажи крупно рогатого скота. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 8 лет. Кредит планирует использовать для того, чтобы закупить еще одного молодого бычка. Пардакул женат и имеет шестерых детей. Старшие дети занимаются земледелием и засеивают различного рода злаковые культуры.
texts.en:
Pardaqul R. resides in the town of Yavan, but lives quite far from the center of town. He supports his family by breeding and selling cattle, and has been in this sort of business for the past eight years. He is planning to use the loan to purchase an additional young bull. Pardaqul is married and has six children. The older children work in farming, planting various kinds of cereal grains.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle Breeding

loans.name: Mema Group

texts.en:
Mkema J., age 47, is married with three children ages 17, 12 and 2.  He sells new clothes. He started this business in 2000 and works daily from 8am until 8pm. He is able to earn a monthly profit of around $40. 

This will be Mkema's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his stock of clothes and has repaid the loans successfully. He hopes this loan will increase the size of his business again.
	
Mkema will share this loan with his loan group, Mema, which totals 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable to pay back their loans. In the picture, Mkema is 1st on the left in front.

loans.use: Increase clothing business

loans.name: Mujeres Que Luchan Por El Progreso Group

texts.en:
“Mujeres que Luchan por el Progreso”, or Women Fighting for Progress, is a group of five women entrepreneurs seeking their first loan from Esperanza International.  This group hopes to use their first microfinance loan to finance current businesses, or in the case of the group’s coordinator, Leoncia, finance two new entrepreneurial activities.  

Leoncia, mother of 5 (ages: youngest 16, oldest 30) resides in Santiago and plans to split her loan funds amongst three different entrepreneurial activities.  For as long as she can remember, Leoncia has been selling corn and ice-cream from her house and to local “colmados”, or small grocery stores.  In addition to this business, Leoncia plans to finalize the start of two new product sales: candy and shoes.  Leoncia will make her own candy from her house and similarly to her corn and ice-cream sales, will sell the candy in two different-sized packages from her home and at local colmados.  Leoncia will also sell shoes for men, women and children through catalog sales.  Leoncia is dedicated to the repayment of her loan since she wants to own her own home.    

Other members of Leoncia’s microfinance bank run similar entrepreneurial activities including undergarment, fried food, accessory, and cloth sales.    

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase materials for food and shoe sales

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to buy more bread for sale. Rose is 40 years old and widowed. She has 5 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land she rents.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: buy more bread for re-sale

loans.name: Faavae

texts.en:
Faavae T., 52, is married with four children. She has many years of experience in the sewing business. She sells to the villagers and the general public three days per week. She is requesting a loan to purchase cotton fabric and a new sewing machine.

This is Faavae’s fifth loan through SPBD. These loans are her only access to capital because she is unable to qualify for a loan through traditional banks. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala ($187 USD).

loans.use: Purcahse cotton material and a new sewing machine

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora María De Jesús C. tiene ya más de un año con su negocio de venta de ropa usada, es la fuente de ingresos de su familia. Al negocio le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para surtir el negocio.
Portal motivo está solicitando un préstamo y así invertir en la compra de ropa nueva para que su negocio tenga mas ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. María De Jesús C. has been at her used-clothing business for a year already and is her family’s breadwinner. Her business needs more of a variety of merchandise, but she doesn't have enough money to stock it. This is why she is asking for a loan. She will invest it in buying new clothing so her business earns more for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar mercancía

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa T. owns a small parcel of land. She is 34 years old and has 5 children. Her husband, Domingo T., is also a farmer. They have been tilling land since the start of their marriage.

" I would like to access a loan of Php 5,000 from CEVI. I have just started improving the size of my farm. I need enough capital to buy 1 quart of herbicides and insecticides", she said. Marissa believes that her loan will bring her a good harvest from her farm. In that way, she will be able to buy her children everything they need.

CEVI provides not just loans. CEVI also offers training and insurance coverage as well to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase 1 quart of herbicides and insecticides

loans.name: Maria Celene

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=73232&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Maria  trabajaba limpiando casas, pero tuvo que dejarla por que su hijo tiene parálisis cerebral y no podía dejarlo solo, alquilo un puesto y se puso a vender Salchi-papas, ya tiene dos años  y gracias a Dios le esta yendo bien. 
Desde que Maria esta en Finca, ha recibido capacitaciones de cómo mejorar en el negocio y como  tratar  mejor a las personas , aprendió ahorrar.  
Maria  necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles, para la compra al por mayor de descartadles, platos, bolsas, saco de arroz,  gaseosas. 
El sueño de Maria es  crecer y tener un negocio mas grande
texts.en:
To view Maria's first Kiva loan, click here: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=73232&_tpos=7&_tpg=1 Maria used to work cleaning homes, but she had to quit that because her son has cerebral palsy and she couldn't leave him alone. She rented out a booth [in the market] and started selling salchi-papas. It's been two years, and, thank God, it's going well. Since Maria has been with Kiva partner Finca, she has received training on how to improve her business, treat people better, and save [money]. Maria needs a loan of 1400 soles to buy plates, bags, sacks of rice, and fizzy drinks. Maria's dream is to grow and have a bigger business.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plates, bags, sacks of rice, and fizzy drinks

loans.name: Las Tequileras Group

texts.en:
Las Teliqueras is a group of 12 women who are seeking their very first loan. The women have variety of businesses, including selling clothes, cosmetics and food. One woman has a bakery, another is a cook, and another runs a photocopier in a bookstore.

The members of the group plan to use the loan to provide capital for their businesses and to improve the quality of their goods. Half of the members of the group have previous experience borrowing money from institutions, while the other half of the group is borrowing money for the first time.		

The women sincerely hope that their businesses succeed and their incomes improve.

loans.use: Buying capital and improving quality of products

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Дилором - 46 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Занимается продажей женской обуви и женских платков на рынке Фаровон города Гафурова. Она закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Дилором ездит за товаром 2 раза в месяц. Дилором кредитуется у нас с 2008 года. Она успешно закончила два предыдущих займа и теперь запрашивает новый займ для закупки летней партии обуви и женских платков.
texts.en:
Dilorom is 46 years old. She is married and has 3 children. She sells women’s shoes and women’s scarves at the Farovon market in the city of Gafurov. Dilorom buys her merchandise at a wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan. She goes there twice per month. Dilorom has been our client since 2008. She successfully repaid two of her previous loans and now requests a new loan in order to purchase a summer stock of shoes and women’s scarves.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer shoes and scarves

loans.name: Sakina Muhammad Hussain Group

texts.en:
Sakina baji, the wife of M. H., has lived in Borewala, Pakistan for 18 years. She is not an educated lady because her parents couldn’t afford the education expenses, but she has proven herself through her cloth-selling business. Her business plays a vital role for her household because, with it, she is able to pay for utilities. Her husband is a carpenter who makes furniture on order. This time he has nothing to display in his shop to attract customer. Sakina baji is applying for a loan to buy woods, nails and wooden polisher, so that he can make furniture and gather orders from customers. This loan group consists of three additional people:
  • Noshaba H. baji wants a loan to buy iron, scissors and designs for her tailoring shop.
  • Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy sanitary supplies (taps, pipes) to sell.
  • Salma baji wants a loan to buy wires, switchboards and switches to resell.
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. Sakina baji is seated in the second from the right in this photo. Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy material for a furniture business

loans.name: Florajaida

texts.en:
Florajaida R. is from the village of Labo, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 65 years old. Florajaida is widowed and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Florajaida owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Florajaida has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Florajaida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florajaida has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Florajaida is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Florajaida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel immigrated to the United States seven years ago and today he is a proud business owner. Three years ago when he felt unfilled in his retail job, Angel decided to open his own electronics business.  He started with very little capital, making it tough to grow his business at first.  When Angel looks back on his first year in business, he remembers the endless amount of work involved and is grateful for where his business is today. Angel’s business has seen much growth and so has his family. He is married with two children ages two and six. Even though business is doing well, Angel explains that things are still tight, especially because of the current recession. No matter what, he says opening his own business was the right decision both personally and professionally.  Self-employment and serving his clients has given him a strong sense of honor while creating a legacy for his children.  Angel looks forward with determination as he grows a healthy business.

Angel started his electronics wholesale business in May 2006, because he wanted to go into business for himself. To start his business, he used credit cards and a loan from family and friends, but he is happy to have found ACCION USA because they offer him credit that is much more affordable and dependable. 

He says his greatest success has been importing electronics equipment from other countries, like China. He will use part of this loan to purchase 100 cell phones from China. It's important to increase his stock in cutting-edge items that his customers demand. One of his biggest challenges is keeping customers coming back because he has the highest quality electronics.

loans.use: Wholesale electronics stock

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is engaged in vegetable vending business.  Aside from this, she is also raising hogs in their backyard. She is 28byears old, married and gifted with two children. She sells her own harvested vegetables and her income from this is being used to provide the needs of their family.  

At present, Eunice wanted to borrow the amount of Php27, 000 for the maintenance and expansion of their vegetable farm to be able to have a good harvest. She is hoping that her request will be approved to have additional capital so she can also improve her piggery and have an increase in income.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 56 años, es padre soltero y vive con su hijo en su casa propia. Él se dedica a la siembra de plátanos en su propia chacra, donde también vive. Víctor empezó sembrando 80 “machquis” (plantones) de plátanos, pero como ha notado que éste es un negocio muy rentable en su región, ahora cuenta con 4 hectáreas de plátanos y es quien abastece de este producto a algunos vendedores del mercado de su localidad. A Víctor le gusta mucho su trabajo porque desde muy joven se inclinó por la agricultura, pero su mayor motivación es su hijo, quien va a necesitar de toda su ayuda para salir adelante. 
Con MFP ya tienen 7 préstamos y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que todos sus compañeros son buenas personas y muy responsables con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita contratará personal para trabajar en el mantenimiento de su chacra.

loans.use: Contratación de personal para su chacras

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.es: Peregrina es una mujer trabajadora y optimista, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 44 años, madre de cinco hijos, todos mayores de edad, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y bebidas al por menor, su bodega funciona en su propia casa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Rumbo al Éxito” desde hace un año. El primer préstamo que obtuvo fue de 300 soles que fue invertido en la compra de gaseosas para vender, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1700 soles, que será utilizado para la compra de productos (arroz, azúcar, fideos, gaseosas, detergente, etc) para la venta en su bodega. La meta de Peregrina es ampliar y surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Peregrina is a hard-working and optimistic woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 44 years old and mother to five children, all of whom are older. She is dedicated to selling groceries and drinks at retail prices. Her shop operates out of her home. She has been part of the "Rumbo al Exito" (Path to Success) Community Bank for a year. The first loan that she obtained was for 300 soles which was invested in the purchase of sodas to sell. Now, she needs a loan of 1,700 soles which will be used to buy products (rice, sugar, noodles, sodas, detergent, etc.) to sell in her shop. Peregrina's goal is to expand and stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, noodles, sodas, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Dagvadorj

texts.en:
Dagvadorj O. is 32 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her children, a son and two daughters, all attend a local secondary school.

O. operates a clothing trading business out of a rented stall at the local market in her town. She started her business in 2003 with capital of 200,000 tugrugs (~140 USD). Over the years she has gained much business experience and has built a positive reputation amongst her customers and suppliers. She attributes her business success to her good accounting skills. Today, her working capital exceeds 5,000,000 tugrugs (~3500 USD).

Due to her success, O. has plans to expand her business in the near future. She works very hard to grow her business and increase her earnings as it is the only source of income for her family. She says, "My one wish is for my children to receive a good education and become good people who can lead their lives without difficulties." She is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug loan to import products from China.


About XacBank:
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.
To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.
To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To import products from China

loans.name: Fatim

texts.fr: Fatim F. est âgée de 40 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Depuis 7 ans et demi elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MBOUSNAKH où elle a eu à bénéficier de 15 prêts qu'elle a bien géré et  rembourser. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine, elle achète des moutons et des chèvres les engraisse et les revend. Par ailleurs elle vend des arachides en faisant du porte-à-porte, ses activités lui procurent des bénéfices qui lui permettent de contribuer au bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatim F. is a 40-year old wife and mother of eight children. Over the 7 ½ years she’s been a member of Village Bank of MBOUSNAKH, she has received and repaid 15 loans. She purchases lambs and baby goats and fattens them for resale. She also sells peanuts door-to-door. These activities allow her to contribute to her family’s wellbeing.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her ability to self-finance her business

loans.name: Jamiru

texts.en:
Jamiru is married with five children; his wife is known by the name Naluwu Hamidah. Jamiru is 44 years old and is a hardworking businessman running two businesses: a restaurant and mango tree nursery business. He has mango nursery beds at his place of residence just opposite Rakai Project. He will use the loan to purchase more restaurant items and mango seedlings and polythene papers, among other supplies, so as to expand his business. 

His future plan is to bring in other tree varieties of seedlings, like orange seedlings, coffee, eucalyptus, pine seedlings and so forth. With this loan, he hopes to widen the market and thus have much better sales, which, in the long run, will help him meet his family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase mango seedlings and other supplies for his tree nursery, as well as items for his restaurant

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo, el señor Wilfredo E. se ha dedicado desde hace 12 años a laborar con ahinco en su triciclo llevando personas de un lugar a otro y cobrando una tarifa módica siendo esta actividad la que le permite obtener los ingresos para su desarrollo económico y el de su familia.

El señor Wilfredo hoy en día ha iniciado a mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y para ello ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de los materiales de construcción y así continuar con esta obra cuyo propósito es beneficiar a su cónyuge y a sus tres hijos en edad escolar a los que tiene que mantener y sobre todo brindarle las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Somotillo, Mr. Wilfredo E. has worked eagerly for 12 years, taking people from place to place on his tricycle. He charges a moderate fare, being that this activity is what enables him to obtain income for his and his family's economic development. Nowadays, Wilfredo is beginning to improve the conditions of his home, and for this he has requested a loan through Ceprodel for the purchase of construction materials. In this way, he will be able to continue with this project, whose purpose is to benefit his spouse and their three school-age children, whom they have to support and above all, provide them with the necessary conditions for their development.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
La señora Matilde, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amor y Paz”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 42 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 01 que aun depende de ella.

Matilde, decidió vender sus comidas preparadas y se inicio desde muy joven por iniciativa propia, se encuentra ubicada, en el Mercado Central de su Distrito, donde atiende a sus clientes día a día. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados. 

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza día a día, vende por las mañanas y tardes. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como: arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos de papa, pollos en javas, verduras. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de utensilios para remplazar a sus utensilios antiguos, así brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Matilde, se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar más su restaurante al mismo tiempo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Matilde belongs to the Amor y Paz Communal Bank in the Moyabamba district, Moyabamba province, San Martín department. She is 42, married, and has three children. One is still dependent upon her. Matilde decided to sell prepared food. She started on her own initiative when she was very young. Day to day she waits on her customers in the Central Market in her district. She tells us that she has very good daily sales because of the delicious seasoning she gives her food. She currently continues with the same business. She is very happy with the work that she does day to day. She sells in the mornings and the afternoons. She personally waits on her customers with her characteristic charisma. She will use this loan for 1,000 PEN to buy supplies for the daily preparation of her food. She will buy things like kilos of rice and sugar, gallons of oil, sacks of potatoes, crates of chicken, and vegetables. She will use part of the money to buy utensils to replace her old ones. That way she will give her customers better service. Matilde feels full of life, and she still has the desire to keep going forward. She has a lot of dreams and goals in her life. For example she wants to better equip her restaurant. At the same time, she is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to the start of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food preparation

loans.name: Kathlyn

texts.en:
Katlyn A. is a 26-year-old woman from the coastal town of Cardona, Rizal Province, in the Philippines. She is married to a jeepney (small bus) driver, Aaron James, who is 28 years old. They are blessed with four children. The eldest child, Julianne, is 7 years old and in grade school. The youngest son, Julian Carlo, is a 3-year-old. The couple is working hard to raise their family and give their children a better life.

In 2008, Katlyn joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines. When she received her previous loans, she invested the money in the preparing and selling of dried fish, and later expanded the business with more fish.

Now on her 3rd loan, she requested 15,000 PHP as additional capital for her business. She is positive that her business will grow since she already has regular customers from other villages requesting orders.

She dreams of having a space in the market where she can sell her dried fish. She hopes for a successful business that can provide them with a good life that is far away from poverty. She also dreams of building a concrete house to live in with a happy family.

loans.use: additional capital for her dried fish business

loans.name: Gaby

texts.es:
Gaby C. H. es una mujer que lucha día a día por salir adelante, a sus 50 años es viuda y tiene 4 hijos, dos de ellos son independientes y los otros dos de 25 y 26 años están a su cargo, se dedica al servicio de alquiler de cabinas de internet, desde hace 10 años además alquila equipos de sonido desde hace 20 años y hace 2 meses, ha implementado un locutorio telefónico con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria.
Gaby ha podido comprar maquinas de mejor calidad (pc’s) y apoyar en la educación de sus hijos quienes estudian en la universidad. El gran sueño de Gaby, es comprarse una casa, ya que la vivienda en la cual  reside es alquilada.
El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido en recargas de línea para sus equipos del locutorio y un regalo de matrimonio para su hija. Gaby se encuentra muy agradecida por todo el apoyo brindado, porque le ha ayudado  a mejorar su calidad de vida y el de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gaby C. H. is a woman who fights day after day to get ahead. At fifty, she is a widow and has four children. Two of them are independent and the other two are 25 and 26 years old and responsible. For ten years, she has been dedicated to the service of renting internet booths, as well as renting sound equipment for twenty years and, two months ago, she started a telephone business from the effort of her daily work. Gaby has been able to buy better quality machines (PCs) and support the education of her children who are studying at university. Gaby's great dream is to buy herself a house since the house where she lives in is rented. The recent loan granted will be invested in online refills for her business and for a wedding gift for her daughter. Gaby is very thankful for all the support granted because it has helped her to improve her quality of life and that of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Online refills for her Internet business and for a wedding gift for her daughter.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: âgée de 40 ans, cette dame est très dynamique, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de charbons de bois, elle s'est engagée dans ce commerce en 2007, elle y a associé plus tard la vente de bois de chauffage, elle s'approvisionne dans les villages à l'intérieur du pays ainsi elle arrive à bénéficier d'une réduction sur ses prix d'achat. voulant rehausser son stock, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 22 sacs de charbons de bois, 10 tas de bois de chauffage et assurer le transport de la marchandise.
texts.en:
This 40-year old woman is very dynamic and has an income-generating activity selling charcoal. She started up in this business in 2007 and later on complimented it with the sale of firewood. She gets her supplies in villages inland and thereby manages to benefit from a reduction in the purchase price. In order to increase her stock, she is applying for a loan from WAGES in order to buy 22 bags of charcoal, 10 piles of firewood and cover the cost of the transport of the goods.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal

loans.name: Saikhudja

texts.en: D. Saikhudja is 49 years old. He is married and is the father of three children. He is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children who today are working adults, thanks to his example. Saikhudja is an enterprising man who constantly tries to do things better and to improve day after day. He works hard in his fields where he spends as much time as possible providing the necessary care, fertilizing his land and spraying to prevent diseases that might affect his yields. Saikhudja needs tools and fertilizer to continue his difficult work, tending his crops so that they can be taken to the capital for sale. That's why he's applying for a loan of 5,000 Somoni. Let's be the ones who reach out our hands to help him. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen, 35, lives with her family in a city named Arifwala in Pakistan. She and her family live together in a three-room house. She and her family have been living together for the past 18 years. 

Her husband operates a grocery shop at a local market. He purchases the products from various places at wholesale prices and resells them for a profit. He has been operating this business since 2005. He has been planning to diversify his grocery shop into a store in the future. He has good communication skills and he is a very hardworking person. 

Nasreen also operates a clothes-sewing business. She receives orders from the community and earns a profit from it. They both use their income to complete the needs of the family. 

Currently, she is requesting a loan to purchase food products, including biscuits, sugar and lentils, to diversify her husband’s grocery shop into a store.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her husband's grocery shop

loans.name: Fayida Group

texts.fr:
Les  5 femmes  qui constituent le groupe Fayida sont toutes mariées. Avec une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 5 enfants et vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles Bobo dans la ville de Tominian (région de Ségou, république du Mali), elles se sont connues à travers des liens  de voisinages et de parenté. 
Elles exercent presque la même activité  qui est la restauration et l’achat vente de condiments alimentaires.  
Anou Dembélé qui est la présidente du groupe s’est spécialisée dans la restauration. Cette activité lui est très rentable et elle est très sollicitée. 
Ce groupe Fayida est à son deuxième prêt avec l’institution et Anou compte utiliser le sien pour acheter, des sacs de riz et une grande quantité de condiments alimentaires pour la restauration, sur place à Tominian. Anou vend toutes sortes de plats alimentaires dans son restaurant sis en plein cœur de Tominian au bord du goudron. 
Avec une clientèle constituée essentiellement d’élèves maîtres de  l’Institut de Formations de Maîtres (IFM) et de fonctionnaires, Anou espère réaliser un bénéfice de 25.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Anou ambitionne avoir un prêt plus important pour ouvrir un deuxième restaurant.
texts.en:
The five women in the Fayida group are all married. On average they are 32 years old with five children, living in large traditional Bobo families (the Bobo ethnic group is found in Mali and Burkina Faso), in the town of Tominian in the Segou Region of the Republic of Mali. They were acquainted through family ties and as neighbours. They all have practically the same activity which is the restaurant business and trading in culinary condiments. Anou Dembelé is the group’s president and runs a restaurant. This activity provides good income and she is very much in demand. The Fayida group is requesting their second group loan from the institution and Anou intends to use her part to buy - locally in Tominian - bags of rice and a large quantity of culinary condiments for her restaurant business. Anou sells a variety of food preparations in her restaurant located at the roadside in the very centre of Tominian . Her customers are for the most part student schoolteachers from “l’Institut de Formations de Maîtres (IFM)” and public service officials. She hopes to attain monthly profits of 25,000 FCFA which will be used to reimburse the loan and deal with daily family expenses. Anou’s wish is for a larger loan so that she can open a second restaurant.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic ingredients for restaurant business

loans.name: María Francisca

texts.es:
La señora  María Cárdenas es una mujer muy dinámica tiene 58 años de edad, separada de su cónyuge porque la maltrataba mucho, con el concibió cinco hijos entre las edades 30 y 22 años, su primera  hija es madre soltera de tres niños, vive con su segunda hija casada con quien comparten los gastos del hogar y sus dos hijos solteros que trabajan tanto para sus gastos como para apoyar en casa ya que aun no tienen casa propia.

 Es socia del bankito La Paz  hace doce años y fue invitada por una socia que ya falleció, este banco se encuentra en la urbe de la  ciudad de Cuenca donde una vez fue el asentamiento de los Tomebamba. Está a 2535 metros sobre el nivel del mar y es la capital de la provincia del Azuay, es además la tercera ciudad más importante del Ecuador.

María  elabora y vende tejidos realizados a mano arte que aprendió de una comadre, además vende inciensos   hace tres  años, trabaja cinco días a la semana porque el resto cuida  de sus nietos. Con el crédito solicitado  va a comprar hilos para elaborar sus tejidos, así como incienso y romero para vender.  Su sueño es comprarse un terreno para poder construir su casa.
texts.en:
María Cárdenas is a dynamic 58-year-old. She is separated because her spouse mistreated her a lot; they had five children together who range in ages from 30 to 22 years. She lives with her second daughter who is married and shares household expenses and her two single sons who work both to meet their own personal expenses as well as to support household expenses since they don’t yet have their own homes. Her oldest daughter is a single mother of three children. She has been a member of the La Paz communal bank; she was invited to join by a member who is since deceased. This bank is located in greater Cuenca where once the Tomebamba (a former city-state in the Inca federation) settled. It is located 2535 meters above sea level and is the capital of Azuay province; in addition, it is Ecuador’s third most important city. María manufactures and sells hand-made woven articles that she learned how to make from a comadre (The name by which the godfather and godmother address the mother of their godson or daughter, and by which she also always addresses the godmother); three years ago she also began to sell incense. She is asking for funding to buy thread for her weaving as well as incense and rosemary to sell. She dreams with being able to buy a lot on which to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy thread, incense and rosemary.

loans.name: Faida Group

texts.fr:
Cécile-Elide N.  est une commerçante âgée de 32 ans qui habite la Commune de Kinama en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle a une boutique dans laquelle on trouve divers produits comme les produits alimentaires, les produits de beauté et autres petits articles. C’est un métier qu’elle exerce depuis 5 ans. Elle a fait ses études secondaires avec un diplôme A2 en Gestion . Son époux, Kennedy N., est un chauffeur. Elle arrive au 2e cycle avec le crédit de Turame. 

Elle a 4 enfants : un garçon et 3 filles mais aussi prend en charge 3 autres enfants de sa famille proche. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour acheter de plus grandes quantités d’articles  de boutique à revendre aux clients ; ce qui lui permettra d’acquérir une plus grande capacité de générer du bénéfice pour faire ses épargnes et accroitre son business. Elle a l’espoir de devenir une riche commerçante capable de faire le commerce d’import et être à mesure d’acheter sa propre maison et sa propre voiture et que ses enfants finiront les études avec succès et mener une vie meilleure. Elle a toujours préfère le crédit Turame aux autres institutions financières car le taux d’interet est le plus bas.

 Elle est une des membres du groupe  communautaire « Faida  »
texts.en:
Cécile-Elide N., 32, is a businesswoman who lives in the township of Kinama in the Town Hall neighborhood of Bujumbura. She has a shop where she sells various products--foodstuffs, cosmetics, and other small articles. She has been in this line of work for 5 years. She attended secondary school and got a diploma A2 in business management. Her husband, Kennedy N., is a driver. She is on her second Turame loan. Cécile-Elide has four children, a son and three daughters, but she is also raising three other children who are close relatives. She is requesting the Kiva loan to buy larger quantities of items she sells to her customers. This will allow her to earn more profit so that she can put aside savings and grow her business. She hopes to become a wealthy merchant, able to import goods, to buy her own house and her own car. She also hopes that her children will finish school successfully and lead a more comfortable life. She has always preferred Turame loans over those of other financial institutions because the interest rate is lower. Cécile-Elide is a member of the community group called « Faida ».

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy bigger quantities of the articles she sells to her customers

loans.name: Thou

texts.en: Thou K. is 45 years old and has been selling a few fresh fish in the local busy market for more than nine years. She sells fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing, or buys them from her wholesale supplier and other fishermen. She is married to Setha, 42, who works as a fisherman in and around the lakes of his community. Currently, the fishing is temporarily interrupted because his fishing equipment is broken. For this reason Thou K. requested a loan in order to buy additional fishing equipment.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing equipment.

loans.name: Rosa Eva

texts.es:
La cliente es la Sra Rosa Eva, la misma es separada vive con su hijo, tienen 48 años posee casa propia con todas las comodidades necesarias de un hogar se dedica a la microempresa ya que posee en su domicilio una despensa y al mismo tiepo tambien atiende la Peluquería que se encuentra instalada en su domicilio denominado Rossi, cuenta con 10 años de antigüedad en el rubro lo que le permite contar con muy buena clientela e ingresos.

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora ya que ademas de sus dos negocios ella tambien atiende su casa, pero se encuentra muy satisfecha con sus trabajos ya que  mediante ellos pudo mantener dignamente a su familia.

Solicita el préstamo que lo destinara a la compra de mercaderías traídas de Posadas Argentina como de aceite, yerba, azúcar y algunos accesorios para peluqueria.
texts.en:
The client's name is Rosa Eva, who is separated and lives with her son. She is 48 years old and owns her own house with all the amenities necessary for a home. She works in micro business as she has a grocery store in her home and also runs a home-based hairdressing salon called Rossi. She has been running the business for 10 years and therefore has a very healthy client base and income. She is a very hard-working woman - as well as running her two businesses she also looks after her house, but she is very happy in her work because it allows her an honorable way to support her family. She is requesting the loan in order to buy merchandise from Posadas in Argentina, including hairdressing items, oil, yerba (maté, or Paraguayan tea) and sugar.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise: flour, yerba maté, oil, and hairdressing items.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth C., 49 years old, is a married woman who supports her family by engaging in a general store business. She lives in Hacienda Purisima, Manapla, Negros Occidental, with her husband and their five children who are between 21 and 29 years old. Lilibeth has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 7,200. Lilibeth is now borrowing Php 19,500 to add to her working capital. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Lilibeth aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Jesin

texts.en:
Jesin C. is from the village of Sugarland, Lumbo, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 32 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jesin owns and operates a specialized retail store selling different kinds of vegetables in the local community. Jesin has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 9,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Jesin joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional vegetables to sell. Jesin is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Lesa

texts.en: Lesa F. is 58 and married with five children whose ages range from 12 to 34 years. She plants and harvests taro for sale. Lesa has one year of experience in this business. Lesa needs a loan of 1,000 Samoan talas to purchase weed killers, such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the earnings from her business, estimated to be 400 talas or $167 per week, to improve/expand the business. In 2010, Lesa joined SPBD. This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Lesa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase weed killers, such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Mena

texts.en:
Mena A. Sowah sells pampers, matches, pegs, steel wool and other items at Takoradi. Her loan will be used to buy more of her goods to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in her business.

Mena A. has received a senior high school level of education and is married with two children. Her husband is a driver.

loans.use: To buy more of her goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
La Señora Wilma está casada con el señor Julián  tienen 3 hijos de los cuales 1 de ellos es mayor de edad independiente de ellos, los 2 restantes son menores aún están en  el nivel primario educativo. 
Wilma tiene una despensa bien surtida y es la única del barrio, su negocio está bien surtida y con buenísima clientela ya que es la única despensa que se encuentra en su comunidad.
 Julián es asalariado trabaja como guardia de seguridad de un empresa privada para que con sus ingresos pueda ayudar con los gastos del hogar
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y dedicada a sus hijos. 
Wilma agradece a la fundación por darle la oportunidad de acceder a un crédito, que gracias a eso pudo aumentar su negocio mediante la compra de azúcar, arroz, fideos, y otras mercaderías.
texts.en:
Señora Wilma is married to Señor Julián. They have three children; the eldest is grown up and has left home, while the two younger ones are still in primary school. Wilma runs a store, the only one in the neighbourhood. It is well-stocked and she has a very good customer base as they have nowhere else to do their shopping. Julián earns his living as a security guard for a private company. His wages help with household expenses. Wilma is a very hardworking person and devoted to her children. She is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity to obtain a loan which she is using to buy sugar, rice, pasta and other items to better stock the store.

Translated from Spanish by Jane A, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as sugar, rice, pasta etc.

loans.name: Felix Manuel

texts.es:
Félix es un padre de familia de 47 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos. Se dedica desde hace 20 años a la venta de frutas y verduras. Usualmente comercializa estos productos en el mercado negocio que le ayuda a solventar sus gastos personales y sacar adelante a su familia.Por ello ha solicitado este crédito para la compra de materia prima.
Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y confianza.
texts.en:
Félix is a 47 year old father who lives with his wife and kids. He has sold fruit and vegetables for 20 years. He usually markets his products in a market business, and this helps him cover his personal expenses and get his family ahead in life. He is requesting this loan to purchase produce. 

His greatest wish is to continue growing as a businessman in order to improve his quality of life and that of his family. His is highly trusted and esteemed by those that know him.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Inaam

texts.en:
Inaam is a 54 year old single woman from Chtoura. Since 1995, she has owned a grocery store and she has 35 years of experience in this field. Inaam is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to add new products to her store and increase her income to improve her life. 

This is Inaam’s forth loan from Al Majmoua, and she is a client with a good standing history. Her customers like dealing with her and state that Inaam is a very welcoming person. Inaam hopes to expand her business and open a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: to add new products to her store

loans.name: Jackson Odenyo

texts.en:
Jackson Odenyo L. is 47 years old and married to Pamela Anyango Onyango. They have four school going   children aged 18, 16, 13, and 8 years old.  Their place of residence is in Eldoret-Kenya. He operates a green grocery and has been in this business for 13 years and earns a monthly profit of 15,000 KES.

Jackson learned about KADET LTD through a credit officer and so he is applying for his first loan of 25,000 KES from KADET LTD, which he intends to use to purchase avocado, oranges, lemon, watermellon and pilipilihoho. He plans to use the anticipated profits to expand the grocery and have wholesale stall.

In future Jackson's deeper desire is to see his children realize their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To purchase avocado, oranges, lemon, watermellon, pilipilihoho.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es:
El Sr. Jacinto B. es casado, tiene 64 años de edad, con 4 hijos, todos trabajan y no dependen económicamente de él. Su lavadero montó hace mas de 9 años, pues anteriormente se dedicaba al macate y con ello juntó un pequeño capital con el cual realizó su emprendimiento.

 Es un señor muy activo, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa y sus hijos, además le ayuda en su trabajo un sobrino a quien le tiene mucha confianza.

 El crédito que solicita es para comprar un motor de mayor capacidad ya que se aproxima el verano y en esa temporada tiene más demanda y espera que todos sus clientes salgan con la satisfacción esperada.

 Él necesita mejorar sus ingresos debido a que no tiene jubilación y la única forma de solventar sus gastos es gracias a los ingresos que tiene en el lavadero.
texts.en:
Jacinto B. (64) is married with 4 children, all of whom work and do not financially depend on him. He set up a laundry over 9 years ago. He previously worked as street vendor, which enabled him to gather a small capital that he used to start his own business.

He is very active and has the support of his wife and children. A nephew, whom he trusts, also helps him with his work. 

He requests a loan to buy a larger engine because summer, which is the season with the highest demand, is approaching, and he hopes to provide his customers with a satisfactory service.

He needs to improve his income because he does not have a pension and the only way to cover his outgoings is through the income generated by the laundry.

loans.use: Buy an engine.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana A. is 45 years old, married and supports her family by operating a Ready to Wear (RTW) business. She lives in Bagumbayan 2, Brgy. Maribago, Cordova, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her Ready to Wear (RTW) business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 11,000. Feliciana is now borrowing PHP 6,500 to fund her operations. This will be her fifth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 4,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Feliciana aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: Funds in business operations

loans.name: Jomalin

texts.en:
Jomalin V. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 32 years old. Jomalin is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Jomalin owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk food in the local community. Jomalin has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jomalin joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jomalin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Jomalin is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like biscuits & junk food. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Jomalin from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like biscuits & junk food

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus is a dairy farmer in Murang'a town, central Kenya, where he has been farming for five years. He sells his milk through Kenya Co-operative Creameries. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to take care of the needs of his family.

He has requested this loan of 53,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the increased income from the sale of milk will help in the education of his children. In the future, he would like to improve his dairy farming and be able to produce at least 50 liters of milk daily.

Cyrus is 29 years old and married with two children, ages 4 and 7.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a farmer from the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She is married and has two children aged 25 and 23. She plants and harvests rice and corn crops and then sells her harvest to the market. Farming has been the source of her family's income for quite some time now. She has worked hard to build her business and provide her family with a better standard of living.
Gina joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Gina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon K. is 39 years old, married, and supports a family of three people. His spouse provides additional income. Gideon is a small scale farmer in Kapchemukwai village, located 5km from Kabarnet Town.
  
He started farming three years ago and his monthly income is about $275. Gideon is taking out a 3rd loan of 48,000 KES from KADET after successfully paying off his second loan.
  
He will use 27,000 KES to purchase fertilizers, 17,000 KES for maize seed and 4,000 KES for labor. Gideon intends to use the profits from his business to buy a plot of land. His dreams and hopes are to give his children the best education, diversify his business ventures and be a large scale farmer.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Las Magdalenas De Telixtac Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA MAGDALENAS DE TELIXTAC, POR HONOR A LA PATRONA DEL PUEBLO LA CUAL ES SANTA MARIA MAGDALENA. ESTE GRUPO CUENTA CON 10 INTEGRANTES, UNA DE ELLAS ES LA SEÑORA BAUDELIA M. P. QUE ES LA TESORERA DEL GRUPO Y MADRE DE FAMILIA DE 2 NIÑOS DE 12 Y 7 AÑOS DE EDAD, AMBOS ASISTEN A LA ESCUELA DEL PUEBLO, SU ESPOSO DE LA SEÑORA BAUDELIA SE DEDICA A LA SIEMBRA EN EL CAMPO. LA SEÑORA TIENE UN NEGOCIO DE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS EN SU MISMO DOMICILIO LA CUAL A IDO CRECIENDO CON SUS LOS CREDITOS QUE LE HAN OTORGADO, LLEVA YA 12 AÑOS EN SU NEGOCIO Y MENCIONA QUE SU MAYOR SUEÑO SE HA CUMPLIDO, EL CUAL ES, QUE SUS HIJOS CUENTEN CON UNA MEJOR OPORTUNDAD DE SEGUIR ESTUDIANDO PARA BRINDARLES UNA CARRERA PROFESIONAL. ELLA PIDE ESTE CREDITO PARA SEGUIR CUBRIENDO LA DEMANDA DE SUS CLIENTES YA QUE CADA VEZ TIENE MÁS CLIENTES QUE LA RECOMIENDAN POR SU DEDICACIÓN Y CALIDAD EN SUS PRODUCTOS.La señora es Delgadina S. es la que no se alcanza a ver porque se movio al momento de tomar la foto.
texts.en:
This group is called "Magdalenas de Telixtac" in honor of the patron saint of the village, Saint Mary Magdalene.  It is comprised of 10 members, one of whom is Mrs. Baudelia M. P. who is the treasurer of the group and mother of two children, ages 12 and 7.  Both children attend the village school.  Mrs. Baudelia's husband raises crops.  She has a fruit and vegetable business that she runs out of her own home.  She has been able to increase her activity, which she has been working at for 12 years now, with the loans she has received.
