She says her greatest dream has already come true, meaning her children have had the best opportunity to continue their studies toward a professional career.  She plans to use this loan to continue to meet customer demand.  Her customer base is constantly increasing since she has a good reputation for dedication and product quality.

N.B.  Mrs. Delgadina S. is not pictured in the photo because she moved when it was being taken.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Yem S. is a 41-year-old woman, married to Chin Peaktra, age 43. They earn a living by growing rice on the farmland that they purchased years ago. The couple lives with seven children, two of them whom are employed and consistently contribute to cover the family's expenses. Yem S. plans to use her loan, plus her savings, to buy a plot of her neighbor’s farmland, which is a good location for farming. The loan will provide her with an additional asset.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a 37-year-old widow who supports her family by operating a rice mill and a sari-sari store. She lives in Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. Janet joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Janet has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her seventh loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 to pay for more maintenance on her rice mill so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and family needs. Janet is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To maintain her rice mill

loans.name: Nemencio

texts.en:
Nemencio is a farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He tills his land and prepares it well for cropping. He grows rice that he sells to the market. He has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and ingredients such as flour and sugar.

Nemencio is 36 years old and is a married man. He has six children, the oldest of whom is 18 years old. Nemencio's wife makes rice cakes that she sells around their neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and ingredients such as flour and sugar.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol, de 30 años, convive desde hace 11 años con Percy, su esposo. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Lizbeth y Zidane, a los que quiere mucho en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de San Antonio. La actividad a la que se dedica desde hace 11 años es la agricultura. Sus principales cultivos constan de papa, arveja y maíz. Productos que siembra en las afueras de su localidad, donde tiene sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son las temporadas de campaña agrícolas, donde tiene mayores ingresos económicos, ya que realiza buenos negocios en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Ahora tiene sembrado arveja y habas, que cosechará dentro de unos meses. Marisol, tiene terrenos que se conectan con el río por eso puede sembrar en cualquier temporada del año.”No tengo problemas con el clima”, afirma. Es por está razón que necesita capital de trabajo constante, ya que siembra y cosecha de manera inmediata. Ella pertenece al banco comunal, “Santa Rosa”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan. Marisol, invertirá el crédito en la compra de semilla de papa de la variedad “única”, lo cual sembrará en sus terrenos agrícolas que tiene acceso al río, y de esa manera podrá regar a sus cultivos para que den fruto.
texts.en:
Marisol, age 30, has been living with her husband Percy for 11 years.  They have two children, Lizbeth and Zidane.  She and her family have their own home in the village of San Antonio.  Marisol has been farming for 11 years.  Her main crops consist of potatoes, peas, and corn.  She grows these products on land that she owns on the outskirts of her community.  What she enjoys most about the work is being able to sell her crops because she is able to generate a good income.  Marisol conducts a good level of business at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.  At the moment, she has planted peas and beans that will be harvested in a few months.  Marisol has land that is connected to the river, which allows her to plant at any time of the year.  “I have not had any problems with the weather,” she claims.  For this reason, she is in constant need of operating capital so that she can plant and harvest immediately.  

Marisol is a member of the Santa Rosa Communal Bank.  This is her first loan with MFP and she is grateful for the opportunity that has been given to her.  Marisol will invest the loan in the purchase of potato seedlings of the “única” variety so that she can begin planting on her land that has access to the river, which allows her to irrigate her crops so that they can bear produce.

loans.use: to purchase potato seedlings.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda T. is 45 years old, married, and has four children. She runs a farming business. She has been growing rice for 20 years. She is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and gasoline for her tractor. Rosalinda hopes for her next harvest to increase.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and gasoline for tractor

loans.name: Nawnie

texts.en:
Nawnie is from the village of Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she runs a business venture in the entertainment sector, operating a video karaoke business in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for a year and earns approximately $238 a month for these activities. 

Nawnie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. 

She is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP with which she will purchase another video karaoke for her entertainment business. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase another video karaoke for her entertainment business.

loans.name: 040910 - Lien Minh - Hoang Truong Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liên operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Liên is 33 years old and she is married with 2 children..
Liên is the group leader of the 040910 - Lien Minh - H. T. solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. 
Liên lives with 2 dependents in H. Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Liên has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Liên has been involved in this business for 5 years.
The main harship that Liên faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Liên hopes to maintain  a successful business, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: Chị Hoàng Thị Liên có thu nhập 3.000.000 đồng trên 1 tháng từ công việc kinh doanh của mình. Đây là công việc kinh doanh chính và mang lại thu nhập khá ổn định cho chị.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 28 years old. She is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. Jane has a business selling second-hand shoes, which she has run for five years. She also has a second business selling bricks for building houses.
To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more shoes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Jane hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Los Tres Girasoles Group

texts.es:
El grupo los tres girasoles lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Jeaneth de 34 años ella se dedica al comercio de ropa. Este negocio lo inicio con la venta de hielo, helado y chocobananos…etc. con las ganancias empezó a traer encargos en prendas, perfumes, cosméticos y compro pacas de ropa. 
Cuando inicio con los préstamos decidió solo vender ropa y empezó a comprar ropa nueva y trae encargos. Ella con el crédito comprará mercadería en ropa.
Las otras integrantes son Alicia de 38 quien tiene una fritanga, restaurante popular que consististe en comida frita y realiza sopas de mondongo, y Gladys vende nacatamales y sopa.
texts.en:
The group "Los Tres Girasoles" (The Three Sunflowers") is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial women.  One of them is Señora Jeaneth, aged 34, who has a clothing business. She started this business with the sale of ice, ice cream and chocolate-dipped bananas, etc.  With the profits she began to offer garments, perfumes and cosmetics and to buy bales of clothes.  When she started getting loans, she decided to just sell clothes and started buying new clothes and getting orders.  She will buy clothing merchandise with the loan.

The other group members are Alicia, 38, who has a popular fried-food restaurant which serves fried food and tripe soup, and Gladis who sells nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales) and soup.

loans.use: to buy clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 29 year-old married man and father of one child. He has worked at furniture making since July 2006. He is a man with a good reputation who is liked by customers and friends. To improve his business, Mohamad is going to buy a power generator, that will help him get his work done in a shorter period of time, with the same quality, because electricity is a major problem in his area. That's why Mohamad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time. Mohamad is willing to work hard to provide his child with the best living and education, and stay healthy to assure that all his family's needs are met.

loans.use: To buy a power generator necessary for his business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth tiene ya más de un año dedicándose a la venta de calzado por medio de catálogo.  
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en compra de mercancía de zapatos para mujer, hombres y niño, ya que tiene varios pedidos y no ha podido solicitar el calzado, ya que no quiere descapitalizar el negocio. Vende su mercancía con familiares, amigos, vecinas y también a vender a diferentes partes de la ciudad. 
Porque es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia. 
Con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene pagará el crédito.
texts.en:
Elizabeth has been engaging in selling shoes through catalogues for more than one year.
The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of shoes for women, men and children: she has various pending requests, but she could not request other shoes, because she did not want to decapitalize her activity. She sells her merchandise to family, friends, neighbors and also in different parts of the city. This is the source of income for her family.
She will repay the loan with a part of the income she will make.

loans.use: to invest in shoe sales from catalogues.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a farmer in the Litein area of South Rift, Kenya, where he lives with his family of six, three of whom are of school-going age. His farm produces tomatoes, tea, eggs and milk. He has two farmhands.
Peter has requested a loan of 80,000 KES from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase a dairy cow. He says the income will help him in feeding and educating the family as well as improving his farming investment. He is focusing on starting a transport business in the future. Peter is, however, lamenting the poor market prices for farm produce, but is glad that Juhudi Kilimo has made loans available to farmers.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Virgen De Fátima Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Virgen de Fátima se conforma gracias a una de las miembros. Actualmente el grupo cuenta con 10 integrantes y se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras. Todas ellas son mujeres luchadoras y por sobre todo muy trabajadoras. Se unieron con el objetivo de generar un ingreso para sus familias, para que de esa forma puedan aportar en los gastos de la casa.
La señora Viviana es lavandera, comenta que es un trabajo muy duró puesto que debe cumplir en tiempo con los encargos de los clientes. De todos lados recibe las prendas que debe lavar, en cuanto a eso no tiene quejas. Uno de sus propósitos es mejorar su lavandería para que de esa forma pueda atraer a más clientes. Está muy orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que es un trabajo digno y humilde.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de jabones en polvo, suavizantes de ropas y demás insumos necesarios para su trabajo. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le da.
texts.en:
The communal bank named Virgen de Fátima (Virgin of Fátima) was formed thanks to one of its members. Today the group has 10 members and they are in the first loan cycle of the program for enterprising women. All of them are fighters and, above all, very hardworking women. They have come together with the goal of making an income for their families so that they can contribute to household expenses. 

Viviana is a laundress and she says that it's very hard work because she must meet her customers' orders on time. From all around her she receives garments to be washed, which she has no complaints about. One of her goals is to improve her landromat in order to attract more customers. She is very proud of what she does since it's dignified and humble work. 

She requests the loan to purchase washing powder, laundry softener and other supplies that are necessary for her work. She thanks the Fundación for the opportunity she is given.

loans.use: to purchase laundry soap, detergent and softener.

loans.name: Navruz

texts.ru: Навруз проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ему 19 лет. Он холост. У него имеется среднее образование. Навруз уже три года как предоставляет услугу, такси. Он развозит людей с одного места на другое. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en: Navrus lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  He is 19 years old, single and has a secondary education.  Navruz has been providing a taxi service for three years.  He transports people from one place to another.  He is requesting this loan to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, a 48-year-old married mother of six children, one of whom currently attends school, lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala South region of Uganda. For the past 15 years, she has been working hard to manage her tailoring business, which sells clothes.

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more materials for designing clothes, which will help her to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. She hopes to open a boutique business in the future.

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP), a program primarily serving small entrepreneurs like her who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more materials for designing clothes.

loans.name: Musharaf's Group

texts.en:
Musharaf is a caring lady who performs her household responsibilities by staying at home. In her spare time, she also supports her husband in managing his business, which is about selling milk. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy another buffalo that will allow him to get a larger quantity of milk and increase his sales and profits. 

He has been operating his business for the past eight years and Musharaf is hopeful that an investment will help her husband get more profits and increase his client base.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for the dairy business.

loans.name: Luis Ramon

texts.es: Luis,necesita un nuevo préstamo, el cual utilizara para comprar herbicidas para las plagas, semilla y abono, ya que su cultivo en pipian y papaya, esta por iniciarlo nuevamente, este cultivo es muy sensible a los daños que pueden caudar algunas plagas o insectos, por eso siempre debe incurrir en gastos para la prevencion de cualquier daño en los cultivos, espera que sus cosechas sean abundantes y sanas, Luis a traves de los prestamos es como ha logrado salir adelante, ya que los frutos que trabaja requiere mucho cuido y gasto, por esta razon la ayuda financiera que ha recibido ha sido su mejor opcion.
texts.en: Luis needs a new loan. He will use it to buy herbicides against pests as well as seeds and fertilizer. He grows squash and papaya and is about to plant them again. These crops are very sensitive to damage that can be caused by by some pests and insects. Because of this he always has to incur costs   to prevent damage to his crops. He hopes that his harvests will be abundant and healthy. With the loans, Luis has been able to get ahead, since the products he works with require a lot of care and expense. That is why the financial help he has received has been his best option.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, and squash and papaya seeds.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 37 years old, married, and has two children in school. He sells stationery to earn a living. He has been in this business for five years and has employed one person. He also does farming to earn extra income for his family. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to improve his business.

Moses has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy books and pens. He hopes to expand his business in five years.

loans.use: to buy books and pens.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita, de 35 años, es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo José y sus 2 hijos: Claudio y Mayela, a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Tambo. Hace poco cerro su locutorio, donde brindaba el servicio de llamadas telefónicas. Por motivo de falta de capital de trabajo, tuvo que cerrar. Con el tiempo logró ahorrar una suma considerable de dinero gracias a su esposo, que trabaja en una empresa de autos como mecánico. Con ello compraron un auto, que alquilan para el trasporte público; diario le pagan 30 nuevos soles por el servicio. Este negocio le ayuda mucho en los gastos del hogar, sobre todo porque no necesita mucho mantenimiento, pues su esposo mantiene en perfecta condición, cambiando el aceite y revisando constantemente el auto. Ahora espera juntar el dinero necesario para volver a abrir su primer negocio, donde está segura el ira muy bien. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “IDME” y este es el vigésimocuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Margarita de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en repuestos para arreglar su auto.
texts.en: Margarita, 35, is a hard-working woman.  She lives with her husband, Jose, and their 2 children, Claudio and Mayela, in a house they own in Tambo.  Margarita closed her locutorio business--where she sold phone services--a while back because she didn't have enough capital to keep it going.  She has managed to save a bit of money since then with help from her husband who is an auto mechanic.  She used the money to buy a car that she leases for use as a taxi.  The driver pays her 30 new soles a day for the lease, income that helps to pay household expenses.  The car doesn't require a lot of maintenance because her husband keeps it in perfect condition.  He changes the car's oil and checks it regularly for problems.  Now she wants to pull together enough money to re-open her first business because she is sure it will be a big success this time.  Margarita belongs to the IDME community bank and this is her twenty-fourth MFP loan.  She hopes you will help her to continue working toward her goals.  She has a record of repaying her loans and is committed to repaying this one.  Margarita likes being a member of the community bank because its members are responsible and supportive.  She will use this loan to buy spare parts for her car-leasing business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her car-leasing business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: La señora Nancy trabaja como auxiliar contable en una de las asociaciones de jubilados constructores de  La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para la operación de riñones de su hermano, quien no tiene ningún tipo de seguro y está sumamente enfermo. Nancy vive en casa de sus abuelos la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Pasankeri en la ciudad de La Paz; es divorciada y tiene dos hijos. Este es el tipo de crédito que definitivamente debe ser atendido prontamente y se lo canaliza a través de Kiva porque llega a los corazones de los financiadores.
texts.en:
Sra. Nancy is employed as an assistant accountant for one of the associations of retired construction workers in La Paz. The loan she is requesting will be used to pay for her brother’s kidney operation. He does not have any insurance and is gravely ill. Nancy lives at her grandparents’ home in the District of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz. She is divorced and has two children.

This type of loan definitely deserves a quick response, so this request is being referred to Kiva so that it will reach the hearts of its lenders.

loans.use: to pay for her brother's operation.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
La Amistad está integrado por 13 amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, es por ello justamente que lleva ese nombre. Todas ellas están con ansias de progreso y de salir adelante, pues son mujeres jefas de familia que son muy sacrificadas y luchadoras.
Una de esas mujeres trabajadoras es Gloria, quien se dedica al reciclaje de productos, como ser botellas, cartones, y demás tipos de materiales reciclables. Ella se define como una mujer muy sacrificada, ya que ella se esfuerza mucho por ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo. Gloria trabaja todos los días recolectando los materiales que vende.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales reciclables, que luego venderá en cantidad y con lo cual obtendrá mayores ventajas.
texts.en:
"La Amistad" ("Friendship") is made up of 13 friends and neighbors in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso; this is exactly why they gave their group this name. All these women are anxious to make progress and get ahead, since they are very enterprising, self-sacrificing heads of household.

One of these hardworking women is Gloria, who recycles products like bottles, cardboard and other types of recyclable materials. She defines herself as a very self-sacrificing woman because she tries very hard to help her family through her work. Gloria works everyday collecting the materials that she sells.

She is asking for the loan to buy recyclable materials that she will later resell to gain more benefits.

loans.use: to buy materials for resale.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is married, has two children, and lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She owns a boutique, a business she has run for eight years. She obtained the starting capital from her husband.

She is applying for a loan of Ksh 40,000 to buy a new stock of lessos (screen printed fabric worn around the waist) and shirts. She learned about Milango from an employee. She intends to plow back the income into the business in order to increase the volume of sales. Her long term goals include purchasing a van for distribution.

loans.use: To buy a new stock of lessos and shirts.

loans.name: Wendy Paola

texts.es:
La señora Wendy Paola es casada, tiene 22 años de edad, no tuvo oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 1 hijos, se dedica al comercio,  a la atención a una tienda de consumo diarios, inicio este negocio como operaria y lleva 3 años de experiencia, cuanta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica al comercio.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de productos para la tienda: aguas gaseosas, golosinas, jugos, lácteos, frutas, embutidos, etc. Espera ver su negocio en el futuro, con colaboradores.
texts.en: Señora Wendy Paola is married and 22 years old.  She did not have the opportunity of going to school.  She has 1 son.  She is engaged in the business of running a shop for daily necessities.  She began working in this business and has 3 years of experience.  She has the support of her husband who is also engaged in business.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to purchase products for the shop: soft drinks, sweets, juices. dairy prodcuts, fruits, sausages, etc.  With the help of the loan, she hopes to see her business grow in the future.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, sweets, juices. dairy prodcuts, fruits, sausages, etc.

loans.name: Efrain Leonardo

texts.es:
Efraín Leonardo tiene 41 años de edad es casado tiene 4 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 17, 10,8,6 años de edad en San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC SE LLAMA Yagui Chico tiene el nombre de la Comunidad,  se encuentra a 20 minutos del Cantón San Miguel y se dedican a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos de la familia.

Efrain se dedica a los trabajos en la agricultura para mantener a la familia lo que más siembra es el maíz, trigo y cebada.

Las compras y las ventas lo hace en San Miguel. Solicita el crédito para invertir en la agricultura  y comprar de abonos, fertilizantes, urea, insecticidas y pago de peones.

 Con la ayuda del crédito pudo comprar lo necesario para la siembra del maíz los abonos, y los líquidos.
El seño es poder construir una casa no importa que sea pequeña pero en san Miguel

El desafíos que se le ha presentado son los vientos y la falta de agua.

En el tiempo libre que es el domingo le gusta jugar el boly y disfrutar de  las festividades del carnaval y Divino Niño.
texts.en:
Efraín Leonardo, 41, is married and has four children.  He lives with his wife and children, ages 17, 10, 8 and 6 in San Miguel in the province of Bolívar.

His communal bank is called "Yagui Chico" after the name of the community which is 20 minutes from the San Miguel Canton.  Agriculture is the source of income for the family.

Efraín works in agriculture to support his family and his main crops are corn, wheat and barley.  He buys and sells in San Miguel.  He is requesting the loan to buy fertilizer, urea, and insecticides and to hire workers.  The loan will allow him to buy all he needs for his corn crop, such as fertilizer and other liquids.  

His dream is to build a house in San Miguel, even if it is a small one.

The challenges he is up against are winds and drought.

In his free time he enjoys playing volleyball on Sundays and he also likes the "Divino Niño" festivities and carnival.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, urea, insecticides and to hire workers.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 34-year-old married man. He has 2 children with ages 2 years and 6 years. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a motorcycle transport business where he transports customers. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a potential area and his primary customers are local residents. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital to expand. He will use the 50,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to purchase another motorcycle. His business goal is to purchase a vehicle within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle

loans.name: Midonougbo Group

texts.fr: MIDONOUGBO est un groupe composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mansanvi Mathilde (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 44 ans. Mansanvi Mathilde n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Mansanvi Mathilde est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Sylvain. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Mansanvi Mathilde vend de l'igname, des bananes et du poisson à son domicile depuis onze ans, qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Mansanvi Mathilde s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Mansanvi Mathilde sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe MIDONOUGBO, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter de l'igname, des bananes et du poisson.

loans.name: Melani

texts.en:
Prior to starting her business, Melani worked as an educator in the local school district for 15 years. She is originally from Pittsburg and graduated with a teaching degree in 1995. Her business, Brick4Kids, offers STEM based after school programs, in-school trips, birthday parties, preschool classes and summer camps.

Melani is passionate about the work she does now because it allows her to continue working with kids while offering enrichment programs. She co-owns her business with her husband and employs between 8-10 teachers and teaching assistants per year. So far, Melani has had great success in witnessing outstanding growth in her students. Her greatest difficulty has been in securing enough locations that allow her to offer all of her programs.

Currently, Melani is seeking a loan to continue paying for marketing for her business and to purchase additional supplies needed for the growing number of after school programs her business now offers.

loans.use: to pay for marketing and purchase additional supplies needed for programs

loans.name: Marciano

texts.en:
41-year-old Marciano raises hogs to earn for a living. He hails from the town of Dagohoy, Bohol  with his wife and one dependent. He has sold hogs to locals and town dwellers in his place.

He join Kiva's field partner CEVI to access financial services. Marciano has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to invest in feed.
He  would like to boost his earnings by raising  more quality hogs and having sufficient supply of feeds to become sustainable.  Slowly, he could able to set aside enough savings to invest any business opportunities.
 
In the future, Marciano  is looking forward to have a stable source and extend thanks for the support.

loans.use: to invest in feed

loans.name: Sodéhoé

texts.en:
Born in Lomé in 1955, Sodéhoé A. is married and the mother of five. She spends all her days assisting her unemployed husband in educating their children. She has been doing this by selling various goods and by making and selling Akassan (or Akpan) balls, which are steamed balls of fermented corn mush wrapped in leaves. By obtaining an initial loan, which was repaid in due course, she was able to start this business.

A very energetic and active woman, Ms. A. is requesting a loan of $550 to stock up on corn, the main ingredient in her product, in order to meet the continuously growing demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1955 à Lomé, Madame A. Sodéhoé est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants. Elle a passé toute sa vie à épauler son mari sans emploi dans l’éducation des enfants à travers son activité de vente de produits divers et de préparation et la vente de la boule d’Akassan (Akpan) à base de maïs. Avec son premier crédit qui a été bien soldé, elle a pu relancer son activité.

Très dynamique et active, elle sollicite un appui financier de $550 pour constituer un stock de maïs, matière première de base de son activité afin de répondre à la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Making and selling Akassan balls

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to start selling cereal at wholesale and needs to buy it in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Add stock and renovate his stall

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. Grace O. is a 43 year old widow and LAPO union leader who believes LAPO has really helped her business. She lives in Osazua Street in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria with 5 children. She sells items for babies and hopes to improve her business with the above loan.

loans.use: To buy more baby wares for sale

loans.name: Jimena

texts.en:
Jimena V. is a mother of three and is married to a dentist who specializes in dentures and crowns. Together they started a dental laboratory out of their own home, making dentures, crowns, etc., out of materials such as acrylic, gold and chrome. They have been in business for 14 years, starting out with a few consultations and working with low cost acrylic.

Jimena is requesting this loan to invest in her laboratory, to purchase higher quality materials for dentures and crowns, including porcelain and other flexible materials which are in more demand and will improve her husband's professional results.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Jimena Carola V. Pardo, es madre de 3 hijos, y esta casada con un odontólogo protesista, con quien instalaron un laboratorio dental en su propio domicilio, trabajando con prótesis dentales en distintos materiales como ser acrílicos, oro, cromo y otros. Esta es una actividad que desarrollan hace 14 años, comenzando con algunas consultas simplemente y trabajando en acrílico, material que se considera de bajo costo. Jimena precisa de capital para poder invertir en su laboratorio, con el fin de mejorar los materiales con los que trabaja, incluir trabajos en porcelana y otros materiales flexibles, que son más comerciales y reditúan mejor el trabajo profesional de su esposo.

loans.use: to invest in her laboratory, to purchase higher quality materials for dentures and crowns

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
The A. family has 6 years of experience in growing and selling vegetables (tomatoes, peppers, cabbage), having land and a source of water. They manage to sell the vegetables produced in their two greenhouses and also the vegetables purchased at small vendors, which they sell subsequently at a higher price.

Ms. A. rents a table at the central market in Cahul. During the period May – September, the family sells the vegetables cultivated on their own land and during the other months of the year, they buy and re-sell agricultural products.

Ms. A. came to Microinvest for a loan as this year she has to plow her land. Usually it was an Association that was offering agro services. This autumn she needs financial resources that were not planned for, that is why she decided to take out a loan.

loans.use: Purchase seedlings and  pay someone with a tractor for tilling her land

loans.name: Alisa

texts.en:
Alisa is 23 years old and an unemployed mother. Her husband is employed in a local sawmill. He does not have insurance and works for daily wage of only 15 KM. They have two children who are ages 5 and 3 years old.
This is the second time that Alisa is requesting a loan from Women for Women International. With her first loan,  she purchased herself a cow and now she needs additional money to buy hay for the cow.

loans.use: For buying hay

loans.name: Reymundo Ricardo

texts.es:
Don Reymundo lives in the Tres Ochenta neighborhood in the capital city of Managua, a neighborhood where poverty is rather evident and all of the inhabitants fight day after day to be able to survive. Such is the case of don Reymundo, whose occupation is repairing shoes and sometimes bags and backpacks. He has 15 years of experience in this line of work. Don Reymundo is 38-years-old, is married, and has 3 children. Two of them are in primary school and one is in secondary school. His wife is a housewife, and he is in charge of providing food for his family. His business of repairing shoes provides him with very little to be able to support his family. This is why he started fixing up his house 3 years ago to rent rooms to young students. Don Reymundo needs this money to construct a bathroom for his guests so he can give them better service. The dream of don Reymundo is to buy an industrial machine to repair shoes, and to start making and selling shoes himself.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Don Reymundo habita en el barrio Tres Ochenta de la Capital Managua, un barrio donde la pobreza es bastante evidente y todos sus pobladores luchan día a día para poder subsistir. Tal es el caso de Don Reymundo cuyo oficio es zapatero y algunas otras veces repara bolsos y mochilas, tiene 15 años dedicandose a esta actividad. Don Reymundo tiene 38 años de edad, es casado y con 3 hijos menores de edad, dos de ellos cursando la escuela primaria y uno la escuela secundaria. Su esposa es ama de casa, él es el encargado de proveer de alimentos a la familia. Su negocio de zapatería le da muy poco para mantener a su familia, es por eso que hace tres años, empezó el acondicionamiento de su vivienda para alquilar cuartos a jovenes estudiantes.Don Reymundo requiere el dinero para construir un servicio higiénico y un baño para sus huespedes para poderles dar un mejor servicio. El sueño de don reymundo es comprarse una máquina industrial para su zapatería, y empezar a elaborar él mismo zapatos y venderlos.

loans.use: Purchase of a bathroom

loans.name: Sevda

texts.en: Sevda is a 46-year-old local resident of Saatli town. She is married and lives with her husband and two children. She breeds cattle with her husband. They have been engaged in this business for 20 years. She raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. She also sells milk and other dairy products. Cattle breeding is traditional in this region side, where there are no other jobs. Sevda wants to increase the number of cows they own. She wants to buy two more calves to add to their livestock. She has applied to Normicro Saatli branch for a loan in amount of $600.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel lives with his parents and two siblings on Huancarani street in the Tahauntinsuyo zone of El Alto.

He works in a repair shop, which he owns with his father. In the shop they repair and paint vehicles.

The loan will be used to acquire equipment for their shop, specifically: an air compressor and paint. This equipment will allow them to provide a better and more consistent product to their customers.

This is the first loan from Impro. Impro evaluated Daniel and his family and they were approved for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Daniel vive en la calle Huancarani de la zona Tahuantinsuyo ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a sus padres y dos hermanos.

El trabaja en un taller, que comparte con su padre, donde realizan reparaciones y pintado de vehículos.

El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de equipo de trabajo, una compresora y pinturas, para el mejor desarrollo de su labor.

Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of an air compressor and paint for the painting of vehicles.

loans.name: Raeli

texts.en:
Raeli is 23 years old and is married. Raeli sells clothes, a business she started in 2007. She works every day from 10 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Darcy

texts.es:
Doña Darcy is a member of “Banco Comunal Las Heroinas”, located at the “Mercado No. 1”, District of Calleria of the Department of Ucayali. She is 33 years old and a mother of 3. Her husband is a merchant but the income is not enough to support his family and therefore, with a previous first loan from Manuela Ramos, S/.300, doña Darcy decided to invest in a business selling juice. Presently she has a stall selling juice at the market. She gets up a 6 a.m. to prepare her juices and get ready for selling them on the market until 12 p.m. when she takes care of her children and does her chores. With this loan of S/.800 ($300) to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy a blender, a grill and other devices to increase sales. Darcy is very happy, she feels successful and important to her family as, thanks to her effort, she has been able to contribute at home, and on the other hand she is very thankful for the support from Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Darcy pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Heroínas, ubicado en el Mercado N° 1 del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 33 años y es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuenta no le alcanza para el sustento familiar, es así que Darcy con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de jugos. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un puesto de venta de jugos en el mercado, para ello se levanta a las 6 am, para preparar sus jugos y alistarse para ir al mercado a venderlos hasta las 12 pm y de allí se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y a los que haceres de su hogar. Con este préstamo de S/. 800 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 1 licuadora, 1 plancha, artefactos para vender, etc. Darcy esta muy contenta, se siente una mujer realizada e importante para su familia por que gracias a su esfuerzo puede aportar en su hogar y además esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase sales.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 34 year-old Jesca Buloba is 34 years old, married, and has no children. In 2004, Jesca started selling sacks wholesale. The sacks are used to carry products such as maize, rice, and beans.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. By lending to women, SELFINA contributes to the economic empowerment and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. The women are considered not credit worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, and poor access to basic needs and services for these women with low incomes.

Jesca has already received and successfully repaid three loans from SELFINA, and now requests a new loan in order to purchase additional sacks to add to her inventory. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks, which are used to carry maize, rice, and beans, to sell

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia baji, the wife of M.F., has lived in Chichawatni, Pakistan for the last 20 years. She owns a two room brick house, and her husband has a motorbike rental business. She is applying for a loan for her husband, who wants to buy an additional motorbike.

She is joined in her loan group by three other members: Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine; Zubaida baji wishes to buy an auto-rickshaw (three-wheeled local vehicle); Allah Rakhi baji seeks a loan for her milk business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans, so if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: John

texts.en: A. is a pharmacist and also sells drugs. He is married, but his wife's income is not sufficient for John A. and their 5 children. Demand for his goods is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business.

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en:
Haytham, 39 years old, married with 2 children, lives in a village in the Northern Bekaa. Haytham raises his children from the income generated by his business of aluminum installation.

Haytham is known in the area where he lives to be a specialist in this domain. He hopes to receive a loan in the amount of USD 1,200 to purchase a stock of aluminum. This inventory increase will allow Haytham to expand his business. This is the first time that Haytham is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: Purchase a stock of aluminum

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal M. is 33 years old and has a small restaurant where he serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. Prior to opening his own business, he worked at a restaurant where he learned the ins and outs of the trade. When he first opened his cafe he served only lunch, and being right next to the local business center, this attracted many people. Once his place became popular, he was able to add breakfast and dinner menus. 

Jamal would like a loan to invest in tables, chairs and utensils. He is asking for US$1200. With this money, Jamal will be able to expand his business, earn more profit and in turn, help his two children complete their school studies and continue on to university. Contribute to the growth of his business and they will be grateful.

loans.use: to purchase tables, chairs and utensils

loans.name: Graciela Alejandrina

texts.es:
Con 3 de sus 52 años puestos en la venta de menúes por pedido, la señora Graciela se muestra más empeñosa día a día con tamaña labor a pesar de la irregularidad de las ventas. Con 3 de sus hijos ya mayores, ella vela ahora por su última hija, una escolar de 12 años, para que pueda salir adelante tal y como lo hicieron sus hermanos a cargo de su madre. La señora aprovecha cuanta ocasión pueda para vender sus menúes: construcciones, grupos de trabajo de familiares, personas cercanas, etc. forjando así su propio desarrollo en base a su esfuerzo.

En aras de seguir empoderándose, la señora Graciela necesita de 1500 soles, los cuales le permitirían poder elevar su capital (para poder adquirir los insumos necesarios para su labor) y, por ende, sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Having dedicated 3 of her 52 years of life delivering meals, Ms. Graciela S. is more and more hard-working everyday with such a huge task despite inconsistent sales. She and her 3 grown up children watch over the youngest in the family, a 12-year-old school girl, so that she can get ahead in life just like her siblings did under their mother’s care. Ms. S. takes advantage of any chance she gets to sell her meals: construction sites, her relatives’ work groups, acquaintances, etc., thus forging her own development on the basis of her efforts. In order to keep empowering herself, Ms. Graciela S. needs 1,500.00 PEN, which will allow her to raise her capital (so that she can obtain the ingredients necessary for her meals) and in so doing her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients necessary for meal preparation

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es: Leoncio tiene 52 años, vive con su esposa. Es agricultor desde su niñez, cultiva principalmente papa y cebada, de las cuales las ganancias se ven recién cuando se cosecha, es así que por años esta actividad le ha servido para educar a sus 5 hijos, que hoy son personas adultas,  y hoy sólo se queda con su esposa, ambos trabajan, aunque por el paso de los años ya es para ellos difícil realizar mucho esfuerzo físico. Leoncio y su esposa siguen trabajando motivados por sus deseos de seguir activos. Es la primera vez que Leoncio solicita un préstamo en MFP  y se compromete ser puntual en la devolución de sus pagos. ¿Qué hará con el dinero? 	La cantidad solicitada será usada en al compra de sacos de abono, de esta manera  aprovechará esta época de siembra para asegurase una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Leoncio is 52 years old and lives with his wife. He has worked in agriculture since childhood, growing primarily potatoes and barley, profits from these are seen soon after harvest. This activity has made him able to educate his 5 children which are now adults. He is currently alone with his wife, they both work even though as years go by it becomes more difficult for them to do physical labor. Leoncio and his wife continue working motivated by their desire to remain active. This is the first time that Leoncio is requesting a loan at MFP and promises to make the payments in a timely manner. What is he going to do with the money? The proceeds will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizer, this way he can take advantage of this planting season to ensure a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Lesbia Lorena

texts.es: Lesbia Lorena L.
texts.en: Lesbia Lorena L.

loans.use: To buy materials for making shoes

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Mrs Rosalinda T., 47 years old, is married and a resident of Roxas, Zamboanga del Norte. Her husband is a fisherman. The fish caught by her husband will be sold at the public market or to their neighbors. They have been in this business for many years already.

Because they wanted to buy fishing nets, both agreed to join Paglaum MPC in May 14, 2008 to have access to a loan. But aside from financial assistance they received, they also enjoyed the add-on benefits like insurance, savings etc. Since she wants to be more productive, she is applying for a loan amounting to 5,000PHP. She believes that with Paglaum’s help, and with the patience & diligence of her husband, she is looking forward to being a successful vendor someday and can own a stall at the public market.

loans.use: to buy fish for sale

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus M. is engaged in a village store business.  He is thankful that his business is generating a monthly income of PHP 10,000 that supports their daily needs of their family and weekly allowance of his daughter.  His store serves as their sole source of income, thus he wanted to improve it and he is now asking for financial assistance of PHP 10,000.  This amount will enable him to purchase different stocks such as soft drinks, biscuits and canned goods.  He also plans to buy some vegetables and meat for additional income.  Jesus is doing his best for the welfare of his family.  He also shared that through patience and hard work; someday he will achieve his goals. He was thankful that through the lenders, he can have a chance assistance to develop his business.  

Jesus is 44 years old and married to Cynthia, his business partner.  They were blessed with three children: Ricky – 22 years old, a vocational course graduate in electronics; Richard – 19 years old, a graduate of a two years course and Diana Rose – 17 years old, college student.  They have a good relationship in the family and he was glad that two of their children are already working.  He hopes that his daughter will also finish her college education.

loans.use: To purchase additonal stocks

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah has been a local alcohol cooker and seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 2 years. She belongs to Upendo group loan (Group code 2002). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 135. Every day she works at her business for 8 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for alcohol preparation for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Leah is 34 years old, married, and has six children: ages 18, 15, 12, 7, 5, and 1.

loans.use: To buy more items for the expansion of her business

loans.name: Najma Parveen  Noor Muhammad Group

texts.en:
Najma Parveen baji is a citizen of a mid-size city named Vehari, Pakistan for the past 11 years. Najma baji is married to a man whose name is N. M. and he is a butcher by trade. He sells particularly chicken meat. He runs a shop in the main market of Vehari. People come to him to buy chicken meat because his scales are very fair. Najma baji is applying for a loan to buy more chickens to sell as chicken meat.

Najma baji is the group leader for three other women from her locality. Ishrat baji wants a loan to buy thread to sell. Naseem Kosar baji wants a loan to buy furniture (chairs and tables) for her tutoring center. Kosar baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (lentils, cooking oil, and spices) for her food-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy chickens for chicken meat business

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena C. is a 61-year-old mother of two. Her eldest son, Efren, is a security guard who helps support the family after his father’s death. Her second son, Alberto, is not employed since he was not able to finish his secondary education because of poverty.

Magdalena applied for this loan to continue her present business. She will use her loan to buy 50 kilos of mong beans, 15 bundles of native tobacco, and 2 sacks of rice. She hopes to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy native tobacco, mong beans, and rice for resale

loans.name: Claudia Cecilia

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Claudia Cecilia S. le esta haciendo falta los acabados del interior de la casa, pero en está momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar la pintura que desea para realizar la mejora ya que su esposa el señor Juan Gabriel Ordaz realizara los acabados. 
Cuando se realizo la visita a la casa de la señora Claudia no se encontraba estaba trabajando ya que es encargada de una guardería del gobierno y don Juan Gabriel quien es la persona que aparece en la foto trabaja en una funeraria como empleado general, estos son los ingresos que tiene para darle los mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The interior of Mrs. Claudia Cecilia S.’ house is not finished. She does not have the money to buy the paint she wants. Her husband, Juan Gabriel Ordaz, will make the improvements. When the home visit was made, Claudia was at work. She is in charge of a government child care facility. Juan Gabriel, the man in the photo, works as a general employee in a funeral parlor. This is the income they have to give the best to their children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish the interior of the house

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Дилшод Худойкулов проживает в районе Турсунзода. Возраст 33 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Дилшод уже более 5 лет занимается животноводством. До этого он работал по своей специальности, крановщиком 10 лет. Т.к. заработной платы не хватало, он решил заняться своим бизнесом. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы приобрести бычка для откармливания и в дальнейшем для продажи.
texts.en:
Dilshod H. lives in Tursunzode. He is 33 years and is married with 4 children. Dilshod has been doing cattle farming for over five years. He had spent 10 previous years working as a crane operator. Since his salary was not enough, he decided to start a business. He is applying for a loan in order to buy a bull calf that he would raise and sell.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: livestock

loans.name: Ileana Del Socorro

texts.es: Ileana del Socorro Jirón tiene 31 años de edad, su estado civil es casada, y tiene 2 hijos que son el motor de su vida, la actividad económica a la que se dedica Ileana es el servicio de belleza de manera ambulante lo que también le permite vender productos  cosméticos, este negocio lo inicio hace 15 años aproximadamente, ella pudo emprender este negocio por la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo en la manutención de la familia, pues el pequeño negocio de su esposo no solventaba todas las necesidades del hogar, a pesar de ser personas humildes Ileana posee ideales y sueños en grande pues en ella existe un deseo de superación, estos sueños y metas los pretende lograr con la ayuda que esta institución esta dispuesta a brindarle pues ha demostrado ser una mujer con valentía y con visión, es por eso que ella desea con gran anhelo este financiamiento para agrandar su negocio creando un establecimiento donde puedan llegar todos sus clientes y ella pueda ofertar todos sus productos de belleza.
texts.en:
Ileana del Socorro Jirón is 31 years old, married, and has two children that are her reason for being. Illeana works in the beauty industry as a traveling saleswoman. This is how she sells her cosmetics. She started this business about 15 years ago. She got into this business so she could help her husband maintain their family since he wasn’t able to cover all of the household necessities. Apart from being simple people, Ileana is idealistic and has big dreams. She would like to better herself. She hopes to achieve these hopes and dreams with the help that this institution is ready to offer her since she has shown that she is a courageous woman, who has a vision. This is why she desperately wants this loan, so she can grow her business creating an establishment where her clients can visit and where she can sell all of her beauty products.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en:
Mr. Fidel G. is a professional photographer. He is 44 years old and married to Mrs. Milva Liz Figueredo, who is 34 years old. They have two children that study and live in the San Miguel neighborhood.

Fidel worked as a secretary to a photographer from a very young age. The photographer helped Fidel learn and understand the field and after several years he was able to start his own business. He started his photography business 22 years ago and through his work he has been able to pay for household expenses as well as the education of his daughters.

Fidel found out about the Fundación Paraguaya through a friend. He applied for a loan in order to inject more capital into his business, to change some elements of his job and to replace equipment that wasn’t working well anymore.

loans.use: To purchase lights, cables and flash

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is 57 years old and has five children. She sells drinks and pepper soup. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. Mariam says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Эшонкулова Фотима- 40летняя молодая женщина, семейная женщина. У неё 3е детей, муж-Дадабаев Кузибой занимается откормом скота на дому, также в свободное время помогает жене закупать товар и продавать на рынке. Часть своего  товара они получают со своего земельного участка, а часть покупают у дехкан. Фотима получает хорошую прибыль от этого бизнеса и довольна нашей организацией, так как получив кредит она расширила свой товарооборот
texts.en:
Fotima A. is a 40-year-old, young, family woman. She has 3 children, and her husband, Kuziboi Dadabaev is involved in raising livestock at home. He also helps his wife buy products and sell at a market in his free time. They get some of their product from their plot of land and buy some of it from farmers. Fotima makes a good profit from this business and is pleased with our organization because she was able to increase her product turnover with a credit.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en: N. Alice is a widow that is taking care of her 3 children of which 2 are still in school and she works so hard to ensure that their school dues payments are on time. Alice has a retail shop in Bajjo since 1998 and is blessed with the help of her children in managing the shop in times when she is not around and attending to other duties. She also has a restaurant in the same area and prepares local foods and sauce for 1 year. She says that she managed to utilize her profits and savings to start up the restaurant business and vies to continue expanding it with the more profits and savings derived from the retail shop. She needs a loan to help restock her shop with more products.

loans.use: Buying more products for her retail shop's expansion so as to make more profits.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: La señora Lidia se dedica a la venta de pescado frito y caldo de pescado conocido como "wallake", está ya bastante tiempo en esta actividad, vive en la casa de su mamá y colabora también con los gastos de la casa, tiene un pequeño hijo que matiene ella sola, en su casa vive con sus hermanos quienes se apoyan y se ayudan mutuamente, es una cliente muy puntual y muy responsable, el crédito lo inevrtirá en la compra de papa, chuño (papa desidratada) y oca (tuberculo andino) por mayor, ya que su mamá está viajando a su pueblo y traerá estos insumos a menor precio y en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Lidia sells fried fish and a fish stew known as "wallake". She has been involved in this activity for a long time now. She lives in her mother's house and contributes to the household expenses. She has a small son for whom she is the sole source of support. She also shares her home with her siblings, all of whom help each other out. She is a very punctual and responsible client. She will use this loan to purchase potatoes, dehydrated potato, and oca ( which is a type of andean tuber) wholesale taking advantage of her mother's trip to her home town where these raw materials are available at lower prices and greater quantity.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to prepare fish-based meals

loans.name: Teodula

texts.en:
Teodula D. is from the village of Punta. She is 56 years old. Teodula is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Teodula owns and operates a "carenderia" (restaurant) in the food sector. The main source of income for the business comes from serving local foods to customers in the local community. Teodula has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for this activity.

In 2005, Teodula joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teodula has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Teodula is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Teodula from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline H. is a little depress in what happen to the education of her children. At her age of 56 she has now 4 children namely: Rowena 30 years old, Fernando Jr. 25 years old, Angelo and Wennalyn the youngest, most of them are only attain a secondary level of education. Her husband Fernando H. is now 65 years old and helping her to improve their business, their helping each other and also their children to overcome their poverty.

Their main source of income today is their fishing business. Her husband is a fisherman that is why she manages their business with the help of Evangeline. This business run for 4 years now and until now it gives them income for their daily expenses. When Evangeline joined the Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) she used the loan that she received for this business like today she will also use the loan to buy necessary things needed in her business like small boat for their fishing business and same things needed in expanding the fish cage like fishnet, accessories for the fishnet and bamboo. She was sure buying for this will make her business improve the income than before.

One really hope of Evangeline is her grandchildren finish their studies until they become a degree holder, she doesn’t want to happen what happen to her children that only attain a low level of education. She assures to herself that he will do everything for them not to experience the hard things in life.

loans.use: For additional capital to her fishing business

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es: María  es una mujer dinámica y perseverante, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 29 años, es madre de dos niños, ella se dedica al alquiler de motocarro (transporte), ya que este negocio le genera  un ingreso diario, también se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos, en este negocio trabaja  junto a su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Innovadoras” desde hace seis años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que lo invirtió en la compra de bebidas como gaseosas, refrescos, para vender en su casa, ahora María necesita un crédito de 1500 soles, que será utilizado, una parte para el mantenimiento del motocarro y otra parte será utilizado en la compra de alimentos balanceado para pollos que posteriormente serán vendidos en el mercado de Bellavista de esta localidad. La meta de María es tener un local propio en el mercado para la venta de pollos y seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
María is a dynamic and persevering woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 29 years old and is the mother of two children. She makes a living renting out a motorcycle taxi (for transport), since this business generates a daily income for her; she also raises and sells chickens, and works in that business with her husband. She has been a member of “Las Innovadoras” (“The Innovative Women”) Communal Bank for six years. For her first loan she received 300 soles, which she invested in the purchase of soft drinks and other beverages to sell at her home. Now María is requesting a loan of 1500 soles, which will be used in part for maintenance on her motorcycle taxi and in part for the purchase of balanced feed for her chickens; her chickens will later be sold in the Bellavista market in Pucallpa. María’s goal is to have her own stall in the market for selling chickens and to get ahead in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance on her motorcycle taxi and purchasing balanced feed for chickens

loans.name: Las Lideres Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Lideres” esta representado por señora Piedades y conformada por 12 miembros los cuales van cumpliendo ya su cuarto ciclo demostrando capacidad, responsabilidad y ganas D. trabajar. Todas las socias se dedican al comercio D. productos como cosméticos por catalogo, vidrio, ropa, pan y zapatos. Dentro del ámbito comercial la competencia es siempre alta pero gracias a su experiencia las socias ya cuentan con clientes fieles que confían en sus productos y cuando las ventas descienden buscan mercados como ferias vecinales. El destino del crédito es para la adquisición D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar más ingresos para seguir creciendo para darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida con formación D. un futuro para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Piedades represents the Las Lideres Group, which is comprised of 12 members. They are completing their fourth cycle; they demonstrate capability, responsibility, and the desire to work. The members sell products like cosmetics by catalog, glass, clothes, bread, and shoes. Competition is always high in the commercial field. But, thanks to their experience, the members have loyal customers who trust their products. When sales are down, the members look for other markets like neighborhood fairs. The loan is to get merchandise, supplies, and tools to help generate more income to keep growing. They want to give their families a better quality of life by building a future for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Blanca Edith

texts.es:
Blanca Edith P. es socia del   Banco Comunal  Fe y Progreso formado en la ciudad de Portoviejo en la provincia de Manabí,  las socias de éste banco se reúnen  cada quince días en las oficinas de la Fundación Espoir  y se caracterizan por ser muy organizadas.

Blanca Edith es comerciante  tiene un mini bazar  en la sala de su casa que está ubicada en la ciudadela Libertad 2  en las afueras de la ciudad de Portoviejo, ofrece porta retratos, semi joyas, ropa intima para damas, caballeros y niños  y  accesorios de cocina y hogar en general, los exhibe en vitrinas distribuidas en un lugar de la sala de su casa , también recorre su ciudadela ofreciendo a crédito su mercadería, este negocio lo tiene hace 9 años

En esta ocasión el préstamo solicitado a la Fundación Espoir es para comprar  tollas,  sábanas y también adornos, porta retratos y más para surtir su bazar para la época navideña,

Su mayor sueño es poder agrandar su bazar y sabe que con la ayuda de la Fundación Espoir lo lograra.
texts.en:
Bland Edith P. is a member of the Fe y Progreso communal bank (Faith and Progress) in the city of Portoviejo, in the Manabi province. The members of this bank meet every two weeks in the Fundacion Espoir offices and are considered to be very organized. Blanca Edith sells from a “mini bazaar” in her living room located in the Libertad 2 area in the outskirts of the city of Portoviejo. She sells pictures, jewelry with semi-precious stones, underwear for men, women and children, and kitchen utensils and items for the home. She displays these in cases around her living room. For the past 9 years she has also gone around the town selling her products on credit. She is asking for the current loan from Fundacion Espoir to buy towels, sheets and decorative items, picture frames, and more to supply her bazaar for the Christmas season. Her biggest goal is to be able to expand her bazaar and she knows that she will succeed with the help of Fundacion Espoir.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy towels, sheets, picture frames and decorative items for sale during the Christmas season

loans.name: Richelle

texts.en:
Richelle J. is 28 years old and lives in the village of Dalig in Antipolo, an attractive province of Rizal. Richelle makes potholders. She has been in business for more than 6 years. 

Richelle joined Ahon SA Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva field partner, in 2009 to realize her dreams for her family. She believes that her proposed loan will be a big help and will contribute to the growth of her business. That is why she is very firm and carefully controls the use of money that is lent to her. She uses all of the loan funds for her business so she can earn more profits and pay for her family's daily expenses. 

Richelle dreams of sending her children to school and hopes that they end their studies with a degree. She is also a good mother to her three children and silently dreams of the best for her family. She believes that poor families need support so that they can change their standard of living and build beautiful houses for their families to live. 

All of her goals in life are supported by her devoted partner, Joel J., who is 29 years old and a welder. They have three children, Rochelle Ann, 7 years old and a grade 1 student; Rozane, 4 years old; and Jamie, 2 years old. Richelle is a positive and optimistic mother with many dreams for her future.

loans.use: To buy sewing machine oil, thread, needles, and cloth for her potholder business

loans.name: Guido

texts.es:
Guido V. J. es un  señor de 37 años de edad quien vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en una comunidad llamada El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías. El Sauce se localiza aproximadamente a hora y media en bus de Turrialba, el centro de comercio más cercano. Sin embargo, varias veces al año el camino se vuelve intransitable por las lluvias que azotan la zona. Este es sin duda uno de los principales desafíos para la comunidad. 

Cuando no existían actividades muchas personas optaron por salir a buscar trabajos en Turrialba o en fincas bananeras ubicadas en la Zona Atlántica de Costa Rica. Actualmente los precios del café y la leche han mejorado, por lo tanto los vecinos buscan cómo invertir en proyectos en la misma zona y de esta forma evitar migrar.

Hace dos años, se instaló en la comunidad una planta de elaboración de quesos de la Asociación de Productores de Leche de El Sauce. Por lo tanto, en los últimos dos años don Guido ha ido especializándose en la producción de leche que luego vende a esta planta. 

Don Guido desea obtener un microcrédito por ¢670.000(seiscientos setenta mil colones) para comprar más vacas y así aumentar la producción de leche. El sabe que contar con más  vacas es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo pero dice que si quiere sacar su familia adelante tiene que esforzarse en producir más.

Actualmente don Guido ordeña en una pequeña instalación de madera que acondicionó como sala de ordeño. Dice que por día logra producir aproximadamente 20 litros de leche y con más vacas su producción aumentaría a 70 litros diarios por lo cual esta muy emocionado de poder ver como su negocio crece y se fortalece.

Don Guido es socio de la Asociación de Productores de El Sauce, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su noveno préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Guido V. J. is 37 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in a community called El Sauce in Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Province of Cartago. This is a small rural community with around two thousand people. They are work producing milk and growing coffee. It has an irregular terrain and a lot of it is maintained as humid tropical forest. The community has traditional landscapes that mix with the tropical forest, with two nice lagoons, coffee plantations and milk factories. El Sauce is located about an hour and a half from Turrialba, the closest commercial center. However, several times a year, the road is closed due to the heavy rain in the area. This is without a doubt one of the main challenges of the community. When there was nothing to do in town, a lot of people decided to go to Turrialba for work or to banana farms in the Atlantic coast in Costa Rica. Right now, coffee and milk prices have improves, so the neighbors are looking for ways to invest their money in the area and avoid migrations. Two years ago, he installed a cheese manufacturing company in his community for the El Sauce’s Milk Producer’s Association. Therefore, Guido has been focusing in the production of milk during this time, that he later on sells to this plant. This time, Guido would like to get a ¢670.00 loan (six hundred and seventy colones) to purchase more cows and increase the production of milk. He knows that having more cattle will imply greater sacrifices, but he wants to support his family so he's willing to make the effort. Right now, Guido milks his cows in a small wooden facility that we turned into a milking room. He says that he’s able to produce around 20 liters of milk a day and with more cows his production will reach 70 liters, so he's very excited about seeing his business grow and get stronger. Luis is a member of the El Sauce Farmers Association, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his ninth loan. He hopes to continue growing at a personal level and financial level. He also believes it’s important to mention that thanks to these type of organizations he is able to devote more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase milking cows

loans.name: Juana Emilia

texts.es: En el municipio de Somotillo, la señora Juana A. se dedica arduamente a laborar para llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y así beneficiar a su hijo que depende de ella. Se ha destacado por ser muy trabajadora y tener muchos deseos de continuar mejorando su nivel de vida. Ha iniciado a mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y para ello lo realiza para brindarle a su hijo un techo digno donde vivir. El crédito solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de los materiales de construcción con el propósito de continuar en esta obra y así lograr su sueño de mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Señora Juana A. works very hard in the municipality of Somotillo to provide a home for her son who is dependent on her. She is well known for being very hardworking and for wanting to continue improving her life. She has started to improve her home so that her son has a decent place in which to grow up. The loan she is asking for will be used to buy construction materials so that the work can continue enabling Juana to achieve her dream of a better home.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Esfuerzo Gracias A Dios Group

texts.es:
El grupo Esfuerzo Gracias a Dios está integrado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y con el ferviente deseo de salir a delante.
