She currently has a stand in the La Hoyada market, where she goes very early each day to sell her products, like cecina and chorizo, which are in high demand in the area. She sells all her products because of the quality of the meat and the attention she gives her customers, with her charisma and smile.

With a loan, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy: pork, corn, chorizo and cecina.

Nora is happy with the loans she has received as they have helped her to get ahead and to have a better future with her children and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nora pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Almendras, ubicado en el Mercado D. la Hoyada, D. Distrito D. Calleria D. Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 56 años y es madre D. 7 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuanta no le alcanza para mantener a su familia, es así que Nora con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta D. cecina y chorizo regional.

En la actualidad tiene un puesto D. venta en el mercado D. la Hoyada donD. acuD. todos los días muy temprano para poder vender sus productos, como la cecina, el chorizo, tiene una gran demanda en nuestra región, termina toda su venta por la calidad que tienen sus carnes y la atención que ella da con su carisma y sonrisa.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,200 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará: chanchos, maíz, chorizo, cecina.

Nora esta feliz con los prestamos recibidos la están ayudando a salir adelante, a tener un futuro mejor a lado D. sus hijos y su familia.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
NILDA is a humble woman who loves to raise her little lambs because she knows that by doing this she can provide the necessities for her home and grow economically as a framer. But without a doubt Nilda like everyone would like to increase her income through the efforts of her daily activities and her wish is to buy a pair of sheep, possibly purebred, and in this way improve the lineage of her animals and increase their sale price. In order to buy the pair of sheep she is asking for a loan and she hopes to receive a positive answer soon.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

NILDA, es una humilde mujer que ama criar a sus corderitos porque sabe que con esta actividad puede atender las necesidades de su hogar y crecer económicamente como ganadera.Pero sin duda Nilda como toda persona desea acrecentar sus ingresos con esfuerzo a través de su desempeño diario y su anhelo es comprar un par de ovejitas que puedan ser de raza y así mejorar la descendencia de sus animales y aumentar su valor de venta.Para comprar el par de ovejitas solicita un préstamo y espera recibir pronto una respuesta satisfactoria.

loans.use: To buy two sheep

loans.name: Tehmenaneh Group

texts.en:
Yeabu T. is 41 years old and married with three children. She sells local agricultural products such as rice, palm oil and peanuts. She works hard go generate income for her children's school requirements. Married to a subsistance farmer, Yeabu invested part of her loan into food production and she is happy that the family had good harvest of rice, cassava and peanuts to last until next season. Her business and income also increased, and she would like to further diversify the business.

Yeabu is the leader for a business group that also includes Ya Marie S., who sells dishes; Ya Marie T., who sells used clothing; and Ismail K., who owns a stall of African-print cotton materials in the same town. The group is requesting a loan so each member can expand their business.

loans.use: Increase inventory of used clothes, African-print material, and local food produce.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. T. is 41 years old. Her husband is a ship pilot; therefore, he has to be away from home for a long time. She has to raise the animals to earn money and spend time raising her 2 children. In 2001, she joined the TYM Fund to borrow money. Because of her experience and her hard work, she used the borrowed money effectively. Her living conditions are improved. She earns 225 USD/month. She uses her money in sending her children to school, furnishing her home, and expanding her farm. This time, she wants to borrow 925 USD to invest more in raising animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

 Chị T. năm nay 41 tuổi. Chồng chị làm nghề lái tàu nên thường xuyên phải đi làm xa nhà vì thế ngoài công việc chăn nuôi, trồng trọt chị còn phải dành thời gian để dạy dỗ 2 con đang tuổi đến trường. Năm 2001 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Với kinh nghiệm chăn nuôi và sự chănm chỉ lao động chị đã sử dụng vốn rất hiệu quả vì thế thu nhập của gia đình chị đã ngày càng được cải thiện. Với thu nhập ổn định 3500.000đ/ tháng chị T. không chỉ đầu tư cho các con ăn học mà còn có điều kiện để sửa sang nhà cửa và mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 15.000.000đ để tiếp tục đầu tư vào chăn nuôi phát triển kinh tế gia đình.

loans.use: Rasing animals

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en: Bassam C. is 29 years old, married and the father of 2. He lives in Burj Al Barajneh, a neighborhood in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. Bassam works as a tailor, altering and mending clothes. He has asked Al Majmoua for a loan of $1000 to purchase a vehicle. This is the third time Bassam has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To help purchase a vehicle

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en: Gulnora I. lives in Khujand and she is divorced with two children. She works in the Joint-Stock Company "Navbakhor" and she is busy in the commercial industry of making national dresses. Gulnora has been a client of MicroInvest since 2005, and she recommends herself as an executive client. She has been in business for 2 years and has good ideas on business modernization. She is also engaged in selling socks and bags, trading in the weekend bazaar. Gulnora is now applying for a business development loan of 3100 STJ for 4 months. This will allow her to import new goods to resell that will increase her business turnover and then permit her in the future to open her own trade outlet of self-made national dresses. She thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: Gulnora would like to purchase new imports to resell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera, estudió el quinto año de secundaria y vive en el Jr. 7 de Junio s/n, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Asunción” de Yunguyo. Desde hace un año, con el primer préstamo de S/. 300, aumentó su capital y compró galletas, gaseosas, arroz, azúcar, etc., para su tienda de abarrotes. A los 17 años de edad se fue a trabajar a Lima con su hermana y después de un año y medio regresó y puso una pequeña tienda cerca de la Plaza 2 de Mayo, en la que vende todos los días.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará dos sacos de arroz a S/. 280, dos sacos de azúcar a S/.140, fideos, gaseosas, etc.

Su deseo es tener una tienda grande y viajar a otros lugares.
texts.en:
Esther is 19-years-old, is single, and studied through her fifth year of secondary school. She lives in the area of "7 de junio" in the district and province of Yunguyo, in the department of Puno. She is a member of the communal bank, "Virgen de la Asunción" in Yunguyo. Since one year ago, when she started with a loan of 300 nuevos soles, she has increased her capital and purchased cookies, soft drinks, rice, sugar, etc., for her general store.

At 17 years of age, she went to work in Lima with her sister, and after a year and a half, she returned and started a small store near the "2 de Mayo" Plaza, where she sells every day. With this loan of 1,500 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase 2 sacks of rice for 280 nuevos soles, 2 sacks of sugar for 140 nuevos soles, noodles, soft drinks, etc. Her dream is to have a large store and to travel to other places.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase 2 sacks of rice for 280 nuevos soles, 2 sacks of sugar for 140 nuevos soles, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Gregoria Lurdes

texts.es: La Señora Gregoria C., tiene una tienda de barrio en la zona de Sopocachi, un barrio residencial de la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia. Empezó vendiendo dulces, pan y refrescos trabaja varios años en su tienda y actualmente es más grende y surtida. Con el dinero que gana ayuda a su esposo en la mantención del hogar, es así que es una persona muy trabajadora y aspira a mejorar cada vez más su negocio y las condiciones de vida de su familia. Es una persona muy responsable, y buena cliente  de la institución. El crédito será invertido en la compra de productos al por mayor para asi proveer a su negocio  de productos para las fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gregoria C. has a neighborhood store in the Sopocachi zone, a residential area of La Paz, Bolivia. She began selling sweets, bread and soft drinks several years ago and now has a larger shop with greater inventory. With the money that she makes, she helps her husband with household expenses. She is a hard-working person and aspires to improve her business and her family's living conditions. She is very responsible and a good client of the lending institution. The money that she borrows will be invested in the purchase of products at wholesale prices to stock her store for the holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Deise

texts.es: Deise tiene 20 años, es madre soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos. A pesar de las circunstancia que le tocó atravesar nunca se dio por vencida,  estuvo siempre dispuesta a seguir adelante, desde hace 3 años se dedica a la crianza de animales y a la venta de leche, la cual obtiene todas las mañanas al ordeñar sus vaquitas, logrando con esta actividad una de las más rentables, si se le pone el esfuerzo necesario, para ello requiere alimentar adecuadamente a sus animales y vender la leche por los alrededores, caminando varias cuadras, con el fin de llevar alguna ganancia diaria a su hogar. Deise está en su 2do crédito con MFP, y se caracteriza por ser una madre joven, muy responsable en sus pagos. Con la cantidad solicitada adquirirá una vaca que le ayude a incrementar su venta de leche y por ende sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Deise is 20 years old, is a single mother, and lives with her parents and siblings. Despite the circumstances she has had to confront, she has never given up. She has always tried to get ahead. For the past 3 years she has been raising animals and selling milk, which she gets every morning when she milks her cows. This is one of the most profitable businesses if one puts in the necessary effort. In order to do this, she needs to feed her cattle well and sell the milk nearby, walking a few blocks, with the goal of bringing home some daily earnings. Deise is in her second loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she is young mother who is very responsible with her payments. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy a cow that will help her increase her milk sales and thereby her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Olena

texts.en:
Olena is a married woman with two children, Natalia and Dmytro. She sells men's clothing at a city market. She explains that her business is in a good location and that she sells such clothes for affordable prices, which makes for a successful business.

Olena has been in this business for 10 years. She decided to work for herself in order to help her husband, Dmytro, provide for their family. Her long-term goal is to raise their two children with her husband.

Olena is seeking a loan in the amount of 3,000 UAH to expand her inventory. More specifically, she would like to purchase more winter clothing and to thereby generate an increase in sales.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional clothes

loans.name: Shamim Aslam Masih Group
loans.use: To buy clothes for her clothes-selling business.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: Dolores V. is a 51-year-old mother of six. Her husband drives a "tricycle" -- a motorcycle with a sidecar that's used as a taxi to transport people and goods -- and many of his passengers are students in their community. For extra income, Dolores and her husband also raise chickens.  Dolores plans to put the money from this loan towards the purchase of a new sidecar for her husband's tricycle.  In the future, she wants to be able to buy another tricycle, perhaps for one of her children to use. Dolores hopes to earn enough income to be able to send all of her children to college.

loans.use: To buy a sidecar for a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed N. is 22 years old and lives with his wife and his 3 children in Gaza, Palestine. Mohamed operates an Internet café that also offers photocopying services. He needs a loan of $1200 so that he can buy additional computers to serve more customers. Please help him by financing this loan. Thank you!

loans.use: Buy additional computers

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana O. sells fish traps. Like bait, the fishermen use them to get plenty of catch to feed their families. Susana is 48 years old and has six children. She is working very hard to provide for the needs of her children and to pay for their schools and their books. 

She is asking for a loan of Php 9,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more materials to make fish traps. In this way, she believes, she will earn more income for her family. The loan will also be used to help her get started in a new business. 

CEVI is reaching out to more people, especially the poor, to start and have their own business. It helps people provide a livelihood for their families. CEVI is not only giving credit but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy materials to make more fish traps

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna C. is 53 years old and married to Loreto C. who works as a jeepney driver. They live happily in the village of San Jose Norte I, Mallig, Isabela. Edna manages a small variety store in their village, which serves as additional income for them. Edna retails different goods and basic commodities. She has many customers because she is approachable to everyone. She wants to make her business more productive to be able to earn a good profit. But they don’t have enough capital to improve their business.

Then, Edna heard about ASKI, and she learned that it helps entrepreneurs with their financial matters and also provides them with good benefits. That’s why Edna is now asking for financial assistance to expand her variety store. She is asking for a loan of PHP15,000.00 to buy more items to sell and stock more products in her store. The loan will be a great help in making her business profitable, and she will then be able to help her husband to provide for their basic daily living needs.

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Faridah's Group

texts.en:
Faridah N. is 49 years old. She is the leader of Kisimba group in Lugazi. She is a devoted and hard-working lady. She has had a clothing store for 20 years in the Najja trading centre.

She is married with seven children. Two of her children are graduates while five are still in school. She cares for twelve dependents, though she does not stay with all of them.

Faridah has been successful in business because of her networking tricks and good customer care. She makes sure that she knows what is available at the market and ensures that her customers get the best outfits. She needs a loan to help restock her shop with more clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Juan Erasmo

texts.es:
Juan Erasmo P. E. ha ido construyendo su casa poco a poco desde ya hace varios años. El señor quiere dejar un buen patrimonio para su esposa e hijos aparte quiere que se vea la casa bonita y también para darles un buen confort a su familia. El proyecto  que tiene en mente es hacer un cuarto en la parte de arriba de la vivienda. Para extenderse y hacer más recamaras para cada uno de sus hijos ya que con el tiempo van creciendo cada día mas  y necesitan su propio espacio y privacidad.
Juan es un señor que le gusta trabajar para darle mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Erasmo P. E. has been building his house little by little for a few years. He wants to have a good patrimony for his wife and children and also wants the house to look nice and provide comfort to his family. The project that he has in mind is to build a room in the upper level of the house to extend and make bedrooms for each of his children because they grow up every day and need their own space and privacy. Juan likes working to provide his family with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material to build new bedroom

loans.name: Elci

texts.es:
La señora Elci, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas D. Jorge Chávez II”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 54 años, 02 hijos, que aun dependen D. ella.

Deseando ver profesionales a sus hijos, y tener sus propios ingresos para poder lograrlo, decidió emprender su propio negocio. Nos cuenta que en su vida paso por diferentes dificultades, su espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas D. salir adelante sola le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio D. preparación y venta D. bebidas como: chichas D. maíz y chichas D. jora y como complemento también venD. sus gaseosas.
Elci venD. sus bebidas en su misma casa y también sale por las calles a ofrecer sus bebidas y poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes que la mayoría son sus vecinos, chóferes, transeúntes D. la ciudad  y amigos, tiene mucha acogida y sus ventas le van muy bien, en las mañanas y en las tardes.

Con este préstamo D. S/ 1,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando insumos para sus preparar sus bebidas como: 2 kilos D. maíz y azúcar, que los compra a diario, ingredientes para dar sabor a sus bebidas como: clavo D. olor, canela, piñas, hielos. Parte del dinero lo invertirá también en la compra D. leña. Y paquetes D. gaseosa D. diferentes tamaños y sabores. 

Elci,  se siente con muchas fuerzas para seguir con sus ventas D. bebidas, sueña con  implementar mas su negocio con un Restaurant bien acondicionado para brindar a sus clientes un mejor servicio y atención. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento D. sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Elci is a member of the Las Estrellitas D. Jorge Chávez II communal bank, Tarapoto District, San Martin Province, San Martin Department. She is 54 years old and married, with two dependent children. Wishing to see her children become professionals, and have their own money in order to achieve this, she decided to start her own business. She tells us that she has faced many difficulties in her life, but her characteristic fighting spirit and her desire to get ahead compelled her to start her business preparing and selling beverages, such as different kinds of chicha (traditional Peruvian corn drinks), as well as sodas. Elci sells these drinks in her own home, and also goes into the streets to sell them. Little by little she became well-known among her customers, who incluD. her neighbors, drivers, visitors to the city and friends. She has been well-received and her sales are going well, both in the morning and in the afternoons. With this loan of 1,000 soles, she plans to purchase ingredients for her drinks, including 2 kilos of corn and sugar, which she buys daily. She will also purchase other ingredients to add to her drinks, including cloves, cinnamon, pineapple and ice, as well as firewood and sodas in different sizes and flavors. Elci is dedicated to continuing her beverage sales, but dreams of opening a well-equipped restaurant in order to give her customers better service and attention. She appreciates the Manuela Ramos movement for helping her achieve her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for her beverages

loans.name: Abosede

texts.en: Abosede sells palm oil and she is also a stylist. Abosede lives in Abulegba and she has been a LAPO client for the past two years. Abosede is 35 years old and married with two children. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more palm oil and hair extensions to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil and hair extensions

loans.name: Samya

texts.en:
Samya is a single woman working with her brother in managing this business; they have a big shop at Ya'abad Village selling kitchen equipment and accessories for the house. Since her brother is an employee she spends her time at the business till noon, when her brother comes to stay at the shop. They want to buy a container full of house equipment so they approched FATEN for the loan.

Samya appears in the picture at her business

loans.use: To buy home products for resale

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie S. is from the village of Zone 2 in Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 29 years old. Jessie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jessie runs a sari-sari (variety) retail store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Jessie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Jessie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Jessie is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be Jessie's 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr: Maïmouna S., 55 ans, mariée et 5 enfants en charge est membre du Banc Villageois de BELFORT depuis 8 ans et demi. Avec son crédit elle développe un commerce de fruits. Son objectif est de mettre en place une boutique pour faire la promotion de son activité de vente de fruits. Elle soutien beaucoup son marie pour les dépenses familiales et la prise en charge de la santé
texts.en:
Maimouna S., 55 years of age, is married with 5 dependent children. She has been a member of the Belfour Village Bank for 8 and a half years. With her loan she will develop a fruit business. Her aim is to set up a shop to promote her fruit-selling business. She plays a large role supporting her husband cover the household costs and taking charge of their health.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow her business

loans.name: Corona

texts.en:
Corona C. is from the village of Camp Philips Bukidnon. She is 55 years old. Corona is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Corona owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Corona has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Corona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Corona is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Corona from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Siama

texts.en: Siama R. is currently in the business of selling bread and ice cream and is requesting a loan to purchase a fridge. Siama is 39 years old and is married to a soldier. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a bar for selling wine and beer. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy a fridge

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora Maria Elena tiene 57 años de edad, reside en el barrio Monseñor Lezcano en la capital de Managua, con dos hijos que procreo los cuales están mayores de edad, su negocio es una pulpería  con 24 años de experiencia en las ventas, su negocio lo inicio con capital propio para apoyar a su esposo en ese tiempo, por que actualmente esta separada de el. Este es su tercer ciclo en Afodenic el cual invertirá en la compra de granos básicos, productos de higiene personal, lácteos, jugos y gaseosas, para aumentar las ventas ya que es lo que el cliente consume diario. Agradece a la institución por la oportunidad de los préstamos ya que a podido invertir en su negocio y cubrir las necesidades personales. A futuro espera mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Elena is 57 years old. She lives with her two adult children in the Monseñor Lezcano neighborhood in the capital of Managua. Maria Elena has 24 years of experience managing her own grocery store. She started her business using her own capital so that she could support her husband at the time, but now they are separated.

She is in her third loan cycle with AFODENIC and will use the money to buy basic grains, personal hygiene products, dairy products, juices, and sodas to increase her sales. Her customers consume these products on a daily basis. Maria Elena thanks the Institution for providing this credit opportunity so that she can invest in her business and cover her personal necessities. In the future, she hopes to make a few home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, personal hygiene products, dairy products, juices, and sodas

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 63 years old and married with 5 children. Her greatest joy is the high season for her business. She is happy because the demands for her tubers of yam will increase and she hopes to make more profits. She sells tubers of yam at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting for a loan amount of 70,000 NGN to purchase more tubers of yam to sell. She says "Thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yams to sell

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
Jesusa tiene 34 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 3 hijos, en su casa propia. Anteriormente trabajaba con los niños de su pueblo en un programa educativo del gobierno, pero para este año no la volvieron a contratar. En vista de ello, empezó a trabajar junto a su esposo en sus chacras de café y plátanos. El plátano es una fruta que ellos cosechan dos veces por semana y lo veden desde su misma chacra a los comerciantes que los visitan. 
Para Jesusa, los trabajos agrícolas no son complicados, pero quiere dedicarse a la compra y venta de plátano, pues así podrá obtener mayores ganancias para su hogar. Por este motivo, se esmera en tener limpias de arbustos sus chacras de plátanos, pues entre más produzca podrá vender más de sus propios productos y comprará menos a otros agricultores.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, en todas las reuniones de su banco comunal asiste junto a su esposo, ya que a él le gusta estar enterado y participar con sus ideas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos para abonar sus cultivos de plátanos y café.
texts.en:
Jesusa, 34, lives with her life partner and the father of her three children in her own house. She previously worked with the children of her village in a governmental educational program. But, they are not going to hire her again this year. In light of this, she started working with her husband in their coffee and banana fields. Banana is a fruit, which they harvest two times a week. They sell it from their own farm to the merchants who visit them. To Jesusa, the farming work is not complicated. She wants to devote herself to buying and selling bananas. That is the way she can get greater earnings for her household. That is the reason she carefully clears her banana fields of shrubs. The more she produces the more of her own products she will be able to sell. Then she will buy less from other farmers. This is her third loan with MFP. She attends all of her communal bank meetings with her husband. He likes to be informed and participate with his ideas. She will use the money she is asking for to buy chemical fertilizers to fertilize her banana and coffee crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to nine children. Most of her children are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is a coastal town in the Western Region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people. 

Although she does not own a refrigerator, Efua sells fresh fish. She buys from the local fishermen/women. Efua hawks (sells door-to-door) in the morning to sell her goods, especially to food vendors. She has been in business for a year now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn T. is from the city of Tibag, Tarlac. She is 53 years old. Evelyn is single. To make a living, Evelyn runs a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately $160 a month from this activity

In 2003, Evelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her 12th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Oum

texts.en:
Oum R., 41, is married and lives with her four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.

R. is engaged in the business of selling vegetables and is able to earn an income of US$104 per month to help cover the family expenses. She has been with this business since 1994. Her husband is engaged in the business of growing rice and some kinds of crops, earning an income of US$4 per day.

R. and her husband try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family and they are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, R. is requesting a loan of US$800 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase a motorbike with a trailer attached to transport her vegetables for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike  with an attached trailer to transport her vegetables

loans.name: Jonaliza

texts.en:
Rice farming is what 28-year-old Jonaliza does for a living. She started farming in 2006. She also tried out hog-raising and still raises pigs.

Jonaliza wants to maintain her business involvement and also wants to improve her income. She currently needs farm inputs and feeds. She applied for a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI which she will use to buy seeds, fertilizer and pig feed.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pig feed

loans.name: El Malinche 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo El Malinche 2 está integrado por Alba Luz Sánchez quien comercializa cosméticos de forma ambulante desde hace cinco años en los cuales su negocio fue creciendo. Su compañera de grupo Sandra Dávila R. trabaja el piuter con el cual realiza retrateras, espejos, casuelas, pailas etc.

Mientras Patricia Lorena Pavón G.  vende nacatamales un plato típico a base de masa, ane de cerdo, arroz, papa, etc.…este platillo nicaragüense generalmente se desayuna el viernes, sábado o domingo.
texts.en:
Alba is a member of the group, “El Malinche 2.” She has been selling cosmetics on foot for the past five years, during which her business has been growing. Her associate, Sandra works with pewter, with which she makes picture frames, mirrors, pots, and pans, etc. Patricia sells “nacatamales,” which are a typical Nicaraguan food, consisting of pork, rice, potatoes, etc, wrapped in a corn flower dough. These are generally eaten for breakfast on Fridays, Saturdays, or Sundays.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Manos Asendosas Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del grupo Manos Asendozas son tres mujeres muy trabajadoras, este grupo esta ubicado en El Municipio de El Paraiso, se conocen bien y siempre han trabajado juntas ya que son vecinas. el apoyo que se les brinde este credito sera de mucha importancia ya que podran adquirir mas mercaderia y materia prima para sus negocios, a contunuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan para ganarse la vida:
YOLANDA R. D.: se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una pequeña tiendita donde vende ropa y calzado, tiene 3 años de laborar en este tipo de actividad comercial, las ganancias que su negocio genera le permiten contribuir con los gastos del hogar a su esposo, tiene 3 hijos que cursan la educacion primaria.   
JUANA LUCILA R. V.: Cuenta con una taller de satreria,  tiene 19 años de tenerlo, esta es su fuente de generacion de ingresos los cuales le permiten cubrir gastos familiares y otros compromisos. en estos momentos Juana necesita el credito ya que tiene mucho trabajo por realizar y ella necesita tener toda la tela para poder hacer los trabajos y que los clientes le paguen cuando tenga terminado los pedidos.  
MARIA DEL ROSARIO Z. : Su actividad principal es el comercio, cuenta con un pequeño taller donde 
se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de piñatas y manualidades.
actividad que tiene mas de 19 años de experiencia, lo que le permite tener muy buena clientela, su producto lo vende a diferentes confiterias, negocios y personas particulares que le solicitan piñatas para la celebracion de cumpleaños y fechas especiales en que las personas revientan piñatas.
texts.en:
The members of the group Manos Asendozas are three very hardworking women. This group is located in the municipal of El Paraiso. They know each other well and have always worked together since they are neighbors. The support that this loan gives them will be very important since they will be able to acquire more merchandise and raw material for their businesses. Below they will describe the different activities they do to earn a living. Yolanda R. D.: She has a small store where she sells clothing and shoes. She has worked in this way for 3 years and the earnings her business generates allows her to contribute to her husband’s household expenses. She has 3 children who are in their primary studies. Juana Lucila R. V.: She has owned and worked in her tailor’s shop for 19 years. This is her source of income generation that allows her to cover family expenses and other commitments. Currently Juana needs the loan since she has a lot of work to do and she needs to have all the fabric to be able to do the jobs and then the customers will pay her when she has finished their requests. Maria del Rosario Z.: Her primary activity is in trade, she has a small shop where she makes and sells piñatas and handicrafts. She has more than 19 years of experience in this activity, and it allows her to have a very good clientele. She sells her products to different candy stores, businesses, and particular people who ask her for piñatas for birthday celebrations and special days in which they resell the piñatas.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing, shoes, fabric, thread, sponges, lace, decorations,  decoraciones, paper, glue, pumps, wire, and forros, and linings

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Vero is married 4 children. She is 48 years old and her husband is a civil servant and he also supports the home. Vero sells cosmetics and jewelry at retail prices. She hopes for a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more cosmetics and jewelry to sell. She hopes to grow her business. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Nicole

texts.fr: D. S. Nicole est née en 1981 et vit à Adogléta, un quartier D. Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Nicole est célibataire et mère D. deux enfants tous scolarisés. Nicole a un troisième enfant à sa charge. Nicole vit seule avec ses enfants et subvient seule à leurs divers besoins. Pour assurer la scolarisation D. ses enfants, Nicole vend D. la nourriture et parallèlement à cela, elle commercialise des boissons à son domicile.  Nicole se ravitaille à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Nicole a arrêté les classes au cours primaires mais cela fait déjà 4 ans qu’elle exerce son activité.  Nicole a déjà obtenu un crédit auprès D. ALIDé, crédit qui a été bien remboursé. Dans le souci D. répondre aux nombreuses attentes D. sa clientèle, Nicole sollicite un deuxième près chez ALIDé pour renforcer son commerce.
texts.en:
Nicole D. S. was born in 1981 and lives in Adogléta, a district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Nicole is single and the mother of two children, both in school. Nicole has a third child entrusted to her care. She lives alone with the children and is the sole provider of the household. In order to be able to send her children to school, Nicole sells food and, as a parallel activity, she also sells beverages out of her home. She buys her stock in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Nicole left school while still at the primary level, but she has been running this business for four years now. She already had a loan from ALIDé and duly reimbursed it. Wanting to respond to heavy customer demand, she is seeking a second loan from ALIDé in order to boost her business.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing beverages and bags of corn and rice

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa R. C. lives in Namaacha, Mozambique, very close to the Swazi border. She was born in the capital of the country, Maputo, 42 years ago. She moved to Namaacha because she got a job there, working for TDM, the national telecommunications company. She has been working there for the last 23 years.

She is studying 10th grade at the moment and plans to continue until 12th grade, the last year before undergraduate university level. She studies by night at the local secondary school. She is single and has four children, aged 7, 10, 19 and 21. All of them go to school, the three youngest in Namaacha and the oldest one in Maputo. She needs to take care of all four children on her own.

She explains that she previously asked Kiva for a loan to start a clothes selling business, but the business did not turn out well. The main problem was that people were taking the clothes home and promising to pay at a later date but ultimately never paid, so she had to close her business. She is determined now not to make the same mistake again and wants to have a small shop. She says that people will pay or not take the items home so she will not have the same problem again.

She is not sure of what to sell yet, so she is asking for a loan just to build the stall this time. Once the stall is built, she will decide what is best for her to sell and ask for another loan. She is confident she will be able to repay without problems, since she has her fixed salary in the telecom company and has some savings.

loans.use: to build a stall to start a small shop

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal Belen.

Elizabeth es soltera, tiene 23 años y 1 hija, Elizabeth viaja a la comunidad de Pucaloma en donde compra leche y quesos que vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho de casa en casa.

Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche y quesos. Elizabeth sueña con construir su casa y brindar una buena educación a su hija.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Belen Communal Bank. She is single, 23 years old, and has a daughter. She travels to Pucaloma to buy milk and cheeses, which she sells door to door in Ayacucho. She needs a loan of 600 soles, to purchase milk and cheese. Elizabeth’s dream is to buy land to build her house and provide her daughter with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk and cheese

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 40 años, es una madre soltera muy trabajadora y amorosa, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 4 queridos hijos y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. En el pequeño pueblo de Paucarmarca, Julia a pasado la mayor parte de su vida aprendiendo y practicando la agricultura, actividad familiar, es por eso que ahora se dedica al cultivo de de choclo, papa y alverja, trabajo que le ha brindado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a ella y a su familia. Todo lo cosechado, lo vende en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, que es donde mejores precios obtiene por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, es así que lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado mayorista, ya que los transportes son muy escasos por su zona. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, con el fin de incrementar su producción. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus créditos y espera serlo también ahora, en su grupo comunal es muy activa y es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus chacras.
texts.en:
Julia, 40, is a hard-working, loving single mother who lives in her own home with her four beloved children; her greatest wish is to improve their quality of life. She spent most of her life in the small town of Paucarmarca learning and doing farming, this was the family occupation. Now, she grows corn, potatoes and peas, an occupation that provides for the support of herself and her family. Everything she harvests she sells in Tarma’s wholesale market which is where the best prices are to be had. What she likes most about her work is planting which she does with much care. She has been in this line of work for 20 years and considers the most difficult part of it to be transporting her product to market because transportation services in her area are scarce. In time, she’d like to buy more land to increase production. This is her 5th loan with MFP; she’s been very punctual with her repayments and expects to continue to be so. She is very active in her communal group and held in high esteem by her fellow members. She will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy more manure and fertilizers for her fields.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers for her fields.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty A. is from the village of San Rafael. She is 49 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Betty owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling alcoholic beverages including beer and wine in the local community. Betty has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Betty joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Betty is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the fourth loan she has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Goreth

texts.en:
Goreth is married with three children and all her children go to school. She  also takes care of additional family members (cousin, sister). She owns a pharmacy selling tablets and syrups. She wants to use this loan to buy more tins of  tablets and boxes of syrups.

She has been in this business for a very long time. She rents her shop at 45000/= per month and sells mainly on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. Her business challenges are thieves and debts. She aspires of seeing her business grow big and own a fully stocked pharmacy. She joined MCDT because it offers good services and customer care.

She resides in, and owns, a two room house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying utility bills, food, rent for her business premises, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of syrups and tins of tablets.

loans.name: Solange Elizabeth

texts.es:
la joven solange Elizabeth C. P. tiene 21 años de edad, vive en el Barrio San Luis de la ciudad de Choluteca, Solange es una mujer muy trabajadora se dedica a la venta de ropa americana, tiene 3 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, Solange es madre soltera tiene 1 hijo, cuando sale a vender su ropa quien le cuida su hijo es su abuela.
todos los dias se levanta temprano para hacer los trabajos diarios de la casa y luego salir a vender su producto. los tiempos libres se los dedica a su hijo.
el prestamo lo utilzara para comprar mas ropa y zapatos para tener mejores ventas y mas ganancias, las cuales las necesita para cubrir con los gastos de su hijo.
texts.en:
The youthful Solange Elizabeth is 21 years old and lives in Barrio San Luis in the city of Choluteca. Solange is a very hard-working woman who dedicates herself to selling used American clothing. She's been doing this for 3 years. Solange is a single mother who has one son. When she is out selling clothes, her grandmother cares for her son. Every day she rises early to do the household chores, then leaves to sell her goods. Her free time is dedicated to her son. The loan will be utilized to buy more clothes and shoes and improve sales and earnings, which Solange needs to cover her son's expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING BAGS OF AMERICAN USED CLOTHING AND SHOES TO SELL

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah was born in 1974 and is married with five children. Her husband is a businessman. This family works hard in order to supply all the needs of their family.

Sarah owns a small business selling various products such as soap, underwear, suits and so on. Her business is well-known in her area which is the reason why she wishes to increase her business.

Sarah is seasoned in her business because this is her fifteenth year of successful operation! The hours of her shop are from 6 in the morning to 9 in the evening, every day except Sunday. Sarah employs one person from her community as a helper so that her business runs well.

Sarah is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more products such as sugar, rice, and so on. With this loan she expects to earn more profits which will allow her to pay school fees for her children and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia G. is from the village of Barangay 2, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 47 years old. Sylvia is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Sylvia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling and dealing daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste from a direct selling companies in the local community. Sylvia has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Sylvia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sylvia is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Sylvia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en: Luciana E. is a widow who lives in Pantalan, Brgy. Asia, Hinobaan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a general store, the buying and selling of rice, and farming. Luciana joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Luciana has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 19th loan, she is borrowing PHP 23,000, which she intends to use to purchase a rice field so that she could continue to save up for future acquisition of rice fields in order to earn more income and improve their living conditions. Luciana E. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase a rice field

loans.name: Carmen Luz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS PERLAS”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia  Carmen; tiene 27 años de edad y es conviviente, ella tiene 1 hijo,  trabaja elaborando bisutería, La socia realiza aretes, collares, pulseras, todo tipo de joyas en alambre con mostacillas y pines, la socia los vende los sábados en la feria de Túpac Amaru. La socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Carmen, 27, has a live-in partner and a son. She works making costume jewelry. She makes earrings, necklaces, bracelets and all kinds of jewelry made of wire, beads and pins. She sells her wares during the Saturday Túpac Amaru Market. She needs funds to buy materials. She is a member of the “LAS PERLAS” (Pearls) communal bank located in Huanchac, Cusco province, Cusco department. She makes us of this forum to express her gratitude for the loan and to commit to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies to make costume jewelry.

loans.name: Emma  Judith

texts.fr:
Femme de 41ans celibataire et mère de 3 enfants dont l'âge varie de 7ans à 20ans et ayant 5 personnes en charges.Elle débute son commerce de vente en gros et detail de banane plantin en 1990 avec un capital de 31000frs. 
ses recettes journalières varie entre  50000 et 85000,elle s'approvisionne sur les marchés auprès des camions et à la gare ferrovière. 

Avec ce prêt elle va renforcer son commerce en achatant plius des regimes de banane et ouvrir 1 ou 2 coins de ventes afin de generer plus de benefices.
Pour satisfaire ses clients, elle fait frire des bananes et evite de perte.
Quand elle aura plus de revenues, elle va efrfectuée des déplacements à l'interieur  du pays pour se ravitailler.
 elle veut améliorer ses conditins de vie en achetant une parcelle et encourager ses enfants à poursuivre  leurs études.dans son quartier, elle est comptée parmis les femme ambitieuse.
texts.en:
This entrepreneur is a 41-year old woman, single and the mother of three children from 7 to 20 years of age, with five people to provide for. She launched her business selling plantains retail and wholesale back in 1990, with a starting capital of 31,000 Francs. Her daily sales range between 50,000 and 85,000; she stocks up at the market near the truck stop and the railroad station. With this loan, she would like to strengthen her business i by purchasing more bunches of plantains and opening an additional sales location or two in order to increase her profit. To meet her customers’ needs, she also fries plantains, avoiding loss due to spoilage. When she has higher income, she is going to travel inside the country in order to stock up. She would like to improve her life conditions by purchasing a land plot and encouraging her children to continue with their studies. In her neighborhood, she is known as a goal-oriented person.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing plantains

loans.name: Zilpha

texts.en:
Zilpha D. is from the village of Dela Paz, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Zilpha is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Zilpha owns and operates a transport business. The main source of income for the business comes from operating service-based services. Zilpha has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Zilpha joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business. Zilpha has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC.This previous loan was used as additional capital for his business. Zilpha is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories.This will be the third loan taken out by Zilpha from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive co-operatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfok and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Johanna Beatriz

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecrist,i ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Johanna, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y  de esta linda relación tiene un hermoso bebe de un año y dos meses, lo que para ella es lo mejor de su vida junto a su esposo,  el mismo que trabaja en la fabril en Manta.

Es una ama de casa que se dedica al hogar y de lleno a su bebe que requiere de muchos cuidados, nos cuenta que la situación con la llegada de su bebe se les ha puesto difícil es por eso que quiere poner un  negocio de venta de ropa, aprovechando que su suegra le va a ayudar en el cuidado de su hijo.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar mercadería para así empezar con su negocio de venta de ropa, en estos días piensa viajar con una amiga a Guayaquil para comprar su mercadería. Este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le ha gustado por la facilidad para conseguir el crédito.

Su sueño es llegar a tener su casa propia ya que vive en la casa de los suegros.
texts.en:
The community bank named "Los Corrales" meets every two weeks in the community of Los Corrales, a few minutes from the city of Montecristi. It is a region where the populations have various occupations, including: artisan and general merchant. 

Johanna is 26 years old. She is married and from this beautiful relationship came a beautiful 14-month old baby boy. For her this is the best part of life, living together with her husband.  He works in the La Fabril company in Manta. 

She is a housewife who takes care of her home and her baby who needs so much of her. She says that since the arrival of their baby the situation has been difficult which is why she wants to start a clothing business. Her mother in law has offered to care for the baby. 

This loan will be used to purchase merchandise to start up her business. She's plans on traveling to Guayaquil with a friend these days to make her purchases. This is her first loan with her community bank. She enjoys being a member for the ability to access loans. 

Her dream is to have a house of her own. They currently live with her parents in law.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Peter. He is married and has one child aged ten. He has two additional dependents living with him - his mother-in-law and an adopted child. 

In 2007 Peter established his provisions business. He began this business because he wanted to be self-reliant. Peter would like a loan for the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Peter has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional provisions. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 274,800. In the future Peter plans to open a bigger shop, build a house and educate his child to university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy provisions for store

loans.name: Nelia América

texts.es:
Nelia tiene 54 años de edad, es viuda y vive junto a su hija en el caserío Tejedores del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona que se encuentra ubicada a mas de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio, este se encuentra ubicado frente al colegio y la posta médica del lugar, lo que genera que siempre tenga clientes ya que el lugar es bastante transitado, ella atiende a sus clientes con amabilidad y trata de tener en stock diversos productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda que posee.

Nelia desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más productos de modo que pueda seguir satisfaciendo la demanda de sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante y que gusta mucho de sentirse activa y útil. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y respeto.
texts.en:
Nelia, age 54, is a widow.  She lives with her daughter in the Tejedores settlement in the agricultural community of Tambogrande.  This zone is located over four hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells basic needs products and groceries in a grocery store in her house.  It is located in front of the school and the local medical clinic.  She always has customers because the location is well traveled.  She waits on her customers amiably, and she tries to have a stock of diverse products.  That way she is able to satisfy the customer demand that she has. 

Nelia wishes to expand her business by getting more products.  That way she will be able to satisfy her customers’ demand.  That is why she believes it is advisable to request a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  

She is a woman with a great desire to get ahead.  She really likes to feel active and useful.  The people that know her hold her in high esteem and respect her.

loans.use: To buy basic needs items and groceries to expand her business

loans.name: Keneth

texts.en:
Kenneth C. is 26 years old and married to Angelina Aiyabei who is a housewife. They have four children between 6 years and 2 years of age. Kenneth runs a hotel in Kabarnet town and he started this business two years ago. He gets a profit of Kshs 8,000 a month from this business.

He has borrowed a second loan of Kshs 21,000 from KADET LTD, which he intends to use to purchase wheat flour, rice, beans, carrots, cabbages, onions and other ingredients needed for preparing food in his hotel. He anticipates using the profits from the business to expand the business and open another hotel in a different location within Kabarnet town.

Kenneth's hope and dream is to have a big restaurant in the future and be able to give the best education to his children.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare food

loans.name: Conseta's Group

texts.en:
Conseta M. is from the village of Lanna. She is 53 years old. Conseta is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Conseta M..

Conseta is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately $91 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Conseta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
From the town of Nkubu in eastern Kenya, 41-year-old Benson M. has been practicing mixed farming for the past ten years. His main products are potatoes, french beans, maize and milk which are all sold to middlemen. Farming is his main source of income.

Benson has requested this loan of 47,250KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this cow will improve his milk production, ensuring that his family will have enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The additional income resulting from this loan will enable Benson to pay school fees for his children. In five years' time, he hopes to have expanded his dairy farming by acquiring four more dairy cows. His major challenges have been a lack of market for his products, the high cost of pesticides and poor weather conditions.

Benson is married with three children between the ages of 2 and 11, two of whom are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: James Murage

texts.en:
James Murage is 31 years old.  He is married to Hellen, who helps in his restaurant business and also does subsiststance farming. He has one child. He has been running his restaurant for a period of two years, earning an income of about KES. 6,500 per month.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD.  He intends to use it to pay rent for the restaurant space, which he pays annually. He hopes to buy a plot of land for development and give his son a quality education.

loans.use: To pay rent for restaurant

loans.name: Grupo Brisas 1 & 2 Group

texts.es:
Francisca pertenece al Grupo Brisas 1 & 2, un grupo formado por 10 miembros, cada uno D. ellos días a días realizan sus actividades D. negocios en una zona D. pocos recursos D. L. ciudad D. Santo Domingo, especificamente ubicada al norte D. L. ciudad, ya sean con negocios establecidos en sus propias viviendas y/o locales,  o D. manera ambulante. Se dedican mayormente a L. venta D. Ropa, Calzados, Accesorios, cosméticos, alimentos, entre otros productos misceláneos.  

Francisca posee una familia conformada por su 3 hijos y sus padres. En una vivienda alquilada construida en una estructura simple D. madera. Esta madre ha sido muy dedicada en su trabaja con L. finalidad D. ayudar a sus hijos a salir adelante, siendo profesionales, educados y que puedan formar sus propias familias. Sus desafíos más difíciles han sido trabajar siempre para llevar ingresos extra a su familia. 

El negocio D. Francisca es ventas D. tocino y carne D. cerdo, las cuales elL. prepara para vendarL. a un mejor precio y se puedan conservar mas, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad D. negocio y nos cuenta que inicio gracias a L. motivación D. algunos amigos, y D. un dinero que pudo conseguir junto a su esposo, luego pudo aplicar a los prestamos D. Esperanza pudiendo invertir. Francisca ha tomado ya 3 prestamos con Esperanza Internacional, y se siente muy agradecida por que con los préstamos a podido avanzar y poder invertir en su negocio. Este nuevo préstamo será invertido en L. compra D. varias libras D. tocino y carne D. cerdo. 

Su historia está siendo usada para representar a los demás miembros D. su grupo y a los clientes D. Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayoría ha emigrado hacia L. República Dominicana desD. Haití, algunos D. ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas D. escasos recursos en L. República Dominicana, carecen D. agua potable y energía eléctrica constante.
texts.en:
Francisca belongs to the “Grupo Brisas 1 & 2” (Breezes 1 & 2 Group).  The group is comprised of ten members.  Each one of them works day to day at their business activities .  They do this in an area with scant resources in the city of Santo Domingo.  The group is located to the north of the city.  The members work in established businesses in their own homes and or other places or in an itinerant manner.  They mostly sell clothes, footwear, accessories, cosmetics, food, and other miscellaneous products.

Francisca’s family is maD. up of her three children and their parents.  They live in a rented home, which is a simple structure maD. of wood.  This mother has been very dedicated to her work.  She does this to help her children be able to get ahead, become professions, get an education, and form their own families.  Her most difficult challenge has been always working to bring in extra income for her family.

Francisa’s business is selling bacon and pork.  She prepares the meat in order to sell for a better price and to be able to save more.  She has been engaged in this business activity for two years.  She tells us that she started thanks to motivation from some friends and some money that she was able to get together with her husband.  Then she was able to apply for loans from Esperanza, and she was able to invest.  Francisca has now had three loans with Esperanza Internacional.  She is very grateful because she has been able to move forward, and she has been able to invest in her business.  She will use this new loan to buy several pounds of bacon and pork.

Her story is being used to represent the other members of her group. Her story also represents Esperanza’s other clients, the Haitians (most of whom have immigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some of them recently) as much as the Dominicans. They generally live in very poor communities.  This zone, like a lot of other zones with scarce resources in the Dominican Republic, lacks potable water and steady electricity.

loans.use: To buy bacon and pork

loans.name: Saba Allah Ditta Masih's Group

texts.en:
Saba lives in Mian Channu, a small city known for its agriculture industry in Punjab, Pakistan. She owns a two-roomed brick house there where she lives with her family.
Saba is 21 years old and married to A. D. M., who sells bricks. He makes contracts with different construction companies to provide them with bricks in bulk quantity. For this purpose he makes business contracts with a variety of brick furnace owners.
Saba is a housewife who prefers to stay at home and carry out her household responsibilities. She is recently married and has no child yet. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy bricks in larger quantity for supplying to his customers. He has been operating this business for ten years and Saba is hopeful that a loan investment will bring better profits to her husband’s business. She is a new loan user of Asasah.

loans.use: To buy bricks for resale

loans.name: Chantsal

texts.en: Chantsal, 56, is married and lives with her husband and daughter in the province of Tuv in Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic tent home, on a small plot of land that they own. Her husband and daughter are self-employed. Chantsal operates a cafeteria which is located in an office building. She has her regular customers, and her income is very stable, since her cafeteria is located in a building where there are many offices.  She is requesting a loan of 400,000 MNT to buy new kitchen tools and equipment for her cafeteria.

loans.use: To buy new kitchen tools

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
SOUTOURA  est un regroupement de 7 femmes ayant en moyenne trente cinq ans, six enfants et vivant  dans des familles traditionnelle à MANA, un des quartiers de la ville de OUELESSEBOUGOU (2ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce du charbon de bois, à l’image de  Assan  T., du bois de chauffe, etc.
Assan  T.  compte acheter avec son  prêt,  40 sacs de charbons de bois. Elle s’approvisionne à MANA  et marchés  environnants  auprès des grossistes. Elle effectue sa vente au  marché de Ouelessebougou ,BAMAKO et à domicile à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
SOUTOURA is a group comprising seven women, who average 35 years of age and six children. They live in traditional families in MANA, a neighborhood in the city of OUELESSEBOUGOU (2nd administrative region of Mali).

They are seeking their first loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet customer demand. The members of this group buy and sell charcoal and firewood, as does Assan T..

Assan  T. intends to use her share of the loan to buy 40 sacks of charcoal. She gets her supplies from wholesalers in MANA and in the surrounding markets. She retails at the market in OUELESSEBOUGOU, in BAMAKO, and at her home, to a clientele comprising mostly women, for cash and on credit.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 10'000 (ca US$ 20), to be used in part to help her husband with the daily expenses. The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy 40 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Kin

texts.en:
Kin K. is a 40-year-old married woman who currently earns a living by purchasing cashews in bulk from farmers who plant cashew trees. She and her husband then sell the cashews to their regular clients for a profit. They can generate an income of approximately $3 US per day to use for their daily expenses. Kin K. has five single children who have no jobs yet.

Kin K. has decided to request a loan from Kiva to have more funds to buy cashews in bulk for selling. This loan will help her improve her profit. Kin K. and her husband appear in the photo.

loans.use: to buy cashews in bulk

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana Maria tiene 49 años, tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. Su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Inicio este negocio ya que siempre le ha gustado trabajar desde muy joven, la mayoría de sus clientes son jóvenes que le solicitan una gran variedad de productos. Ella se levanta temprano desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, pues también sale de manera ambulante  para ofrecerlos. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de lápiz labial, cremas, perfumes, lociones, calzado, ropa en general. Ella sueña con aumentar su inventario y además agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is 49 years old and has one child in her care.  Her business is selling general merchandise.  She started her business because she has always enjoyed working since she was very young.  Most of her customers are young peolple who request a large variety of products from her.  Ana Maria gets up early and works from 7.00am to 9.00pm.  She goes out and sells her products as an itinerant street vendor.

Ana Maria will use her loan to buy lipsticks, creams, perfume, lotions, footwear and clothes.  She dreams of increasing her stock and enlarging her business.

loans.use: to buy lipsticks, creams, perfume, lotions, footwear and clothes

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy equipment like fishing nets for her fishing business. 

Marina has been in this business for 36 years. Marina earns more income from fish vending. 

Marina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to repair and renovate her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy equipment like fishing nets for her business

loans.name: Taj's Group

texts.en:
Taj is a 52-year-old housewife who prefers staying at home and doing her household work. Her husband is a farmer by profession and grows different seasonal crops on his small piece of land. He is a very hard working person and mostly works until late evening to get the desired output from his crops. 

Taj is the mother of two daughters and a son. Her son works with his father in his agriculture business and her daughters stay at home. Taj couldn’t educate them due to poor financial conditions. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides to get better crops from his land and earn more profits. Taj is hopeful that her husband’s business will grow by investing the loan money into it, which will result in a better financial living standard for her family.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Taj.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides
