loans.name: 44. Thiệu Dương Thiệu Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nghi works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Nghi is 53 years old and she is married with two children. Nghi is the group leader of the 9.6.44 Thieu Duong solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Nghi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Nghi has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nghi has been involved in this business for eight years. The main hardship that Nghi faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nghi hopes to maintain  a successful business, to remodel her house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock

loans.name: Diego Manuel

texts.es: Diego Manuel es un hombre muy trabajador, el tiene su negocio que es la venta de golosinas, tajaditas y eskimos esta no es la primera vez que Diego realiza un financiamiento para su negocio. Esto le ha permitido ampliar su inventario para ofrecerles a sus clientes variedad en golosinas y otros productos. El tiene que levantarse temprano para llegar a las afueras del colegio a vender. Este crédito es para la compra de caramelos, bombones, chicles, galletas, tajaditas y eskimos.
texts.en: Diego Manuel is a very hard-working man who owns a business selling candies, plantain chips and 'eskimos' (a brand of iced treats).  This is not the first time that Diego has taken out a loan for his business.  Loans have enabled him to expand his inventory so that he can offer his customers a range of candies and other products.  Diego has to get up early in order to reach the spot outside the high school where he sells his products  He will use this loan to buy candies, chocolates, gum, cookies, plantain slices and 'eskimos'.

loans.use: to buy candy, chocolates, gum, cookies, plantain chips and 'eskimos' (a brand of iced treats)

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga es una mujer muy trabajadora que vive en el municipio D. Soledad y  tien 6 maquinaas D. lavar, que ofrece en condiciones D. arrendamiento y con las cuales genera ingresos que sirven para apoyar la gestiòn D. su hogar; este servicio lo ofrece adiariamente D. contado la comunidad D. su barrio y en general D. una gran parte del sector, especialmente a las amas D. casa, a quienes les envia la màquina cuando la solicitan, transportadas en una carretilla. El promedio D. ventas es D. 900 horas D. alquiler mensualmente  y presenta un muy bajo nivel D. cuentas por cobrar. Su negocio presenta una buena autonomia financiera lo cual le permite cubrir futuras obligaciones. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento con el cual harà mantenimiento preventivo D. sus maquinas, para continuar en el negocio sin ningun contratiempo, por cuenta D. daños en alguna D. ellas.  Su sueño es aumentar su capital D. trabajo y el volumen D. servicios por eso mas adelante planea adquirir un numero superior D. ellas, mediante el trabajo persistente y disciplinado que caracterizan a Olga.
texts.en:
Olga is a very hardworking woman who lives in the town of Soledad.  She has 6 washing machines which she rents out, and with which she generates revenue used to support her household.  This service is provided on a daily basis to her community in the neighborhood and in general to much of the area, especially to housewives.  She sends the machine to them when requested, transported in a wheelbarrow.  

Her average sales are for 900 hours of monthly rentals, and she has a very low level of accounts receivable.  Her business has good financial autonomy which allows it to cover future obligations.  Her Kiva loan is her first financing; with it she will do preventive maintenance on her machines so as to continue in business without the hitch that could be caused by damage to any of them.  Her dream is to increase her working capital and the volume of service, so she plans to acquire a greater number of machines later on.  This will be through the persistent and disciplined work that is characteristic of Olga.

loans.use: to do preventative maintenance on her washing machines.

loans.name: Benkadi  2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI 2 est constitué de femmes mariées du village de KIGNELE dans la sous préfecture de SELINGUE, région de SIKASSO (troisième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 25  ans,  3 enfants et  cultivent de l’arachide, du gombo etc.   
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont à leur  deuxième  prêt  de campagne.
MAIMOUNA, la première debout à droite en rouge,  compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles,  au grand marché de SELEFOUGOU. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de SELEFOUGOU,SELINGUE et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail, souvent en gros, au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 400.000 à 60.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi 2 group is made up of married women from the village of Kignele in the sub-prefecture of Selingue, which lies in Sikasso (the Republic of Mali's third administrative region). They live in traditional families, average 25 years of age with three children each, and grow groundnut, gombo etc.

With a view to making their farming activities profitable, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program and are on their second farming loan.

Maimouna, who is standing on the far right and dressed in red, is planning to use her loan to buy sufficient groundnut seeds, small materials and farm inputs at Selefougou's large market. After the rainy season the crops that have been harvested are stocked for a certain amount of time in order for them to gain value before being sold at the large markets in Selefougou and Selingue, as well as in the surrounding markets, on a retail basis, but often wholesale, for cash, to customers generally coming from large towns.

The group members are expecting to make a profit of 40,000 to 60,000FCFA each, once they have sold their farming produce; this will be used to repay interest on their loans and to cover their families' running costs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, seeds and small materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi C Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe BENKADI C sont toutes mariées ayant en moyenne 29 ans, 4 enfants et vivant dans des familles polygames à Banco ville, chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, ROKIA deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché de Banco et au niveau de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten women in the Benkadi C group are all married, an average of 29 years old with 4 children, and living in polygamous families in the city of Banco, the seat of the Dioïla rural commune, in Mali’s 2nd administrative region, Koulikoro.

They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI in hopes of better organizing their business at the start of the rainy season.  The crops they work with are rice and peanuts.  This is the group’s first time working with this MFI.

Rokia, the second person from the right in the row of seated women, plans to use this loan to purchase farm inputs and small equipment, and pay costs of labor and hoeing involved to maintain about half a hectare (1.25 acres) of rice and peanuts.

After the harvest, the crops are sold from a stall in the Banco market, and also at N’Golobougou, to customers including both men and women.  The group plans on making an average profit of about 20,000 CFA francs per growing season.

loans.use: to purchase labor (including hoeing), seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and small equipment

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es: María Concepción de 45 años de edad, habita en su propia casa junto con su compañero de vida y cuatro hijos. Ella se dedica al comercio desde hace ya varios años. Posee una tienda en la cual vende productos de primera necesidad y a la vez se dedica a la venta de deliciosas tortillas. Sin duda alguna, es una mujer emprendedora la cual hace todo por sacar adelante a su querida familia. Para María lo más importante es su familia y es la que la inspira  a trabajar duramente día con día. Su sueño es satisfacer a una mayor demanda la cual le permita aumentar su nivel de ventas y por consecuencia su nivel de ingresos que le permita tener acceso a una mejor calidad de vida. Todo esto la ha inspirado a tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en lo necesario para su negocio. Es decir, con el crédito desea comprar: granos básicos, bebidas, gas propano, agua, etc. De tal manera que  su tienda y tortillería florezcan cada día más.
texts.en: Maria Concepción is 45 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner and 4 children. She has been in business for many years. She owns a store where she sells staples and also delicious tortillas. Without doubt, she is an enterprising woman who does everything in her power to give her family a good start in life. For Maria, the most important thing in her life is her family and they inspire her to work hard every day. Her dream is to satisfy the increased demand for her products which in turn would allow her to increase her sales and consequently her income thus improving her quality of life. This dream has prompted her to ask for a loan with INTEGRAL to buy what she needs for her business. That is to say, with the loan she wants to buy basic grains, beverages, propane gas, water and the like. In this way, her store and tortilla making business will flourish.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, beverages, propane gas, water and the like.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. She is 45 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her husband works as a farmer and a driver.

Liberty helps her husband plant rice and corn crops on their land. She also runs a sari-sari store business. She sells canned goods, noodles and other items to the people in her community. Liberty plans to use her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.  In the future, she hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Zoila Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora. Zoila es socia del banco comunal Feria Libre, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es admirada por su arquitectura, visitada por la naturaleza y gastronomía, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus ancestros.
 
Doña Zoila tiene 50 años, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 26, 23, 19 y 9 años de edad, sus dos primeras hijas son casadas e independientes, su hijo de 19 años es soltero, trabaja y vive independientemente, su ultima hija estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad, la casa en la que vive es fruto de su trabajo y sacrificio.

La Señora. Zoila es de profesión costurera, tiene un taller de costura 8 años y se dedica a realizar delantales, sus productos los vende en los días de feria y trabaja de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 4 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tela, botones, hilos y cierres para continuar con su negocio.
 
Su meta es crecer en su negocio y tener un taller más grande.
texts.en:
Señora Zoila is a member of the Feria Libre communal bank. She lives in the outskirts of Cuenca city, a city admired for its architecture and visited for its nature and gastronomy. Its people maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

Zoila is 50, widowed, and has 4 children ages 26, 23, 19 and 9. Her two oldest daughters are married and independent. Her 19-year-old son is single and works and lives independently. Her youngest daughter attends school in the city. Zoila lives in her own home, thanks to her hard work and sacrifice.

Zoila is a seamstress. She has had a workshop for eight years and she makes aprons. She sells her products on market days and works Monday to Saturday without a fixed schedule.

She has been a member of the communal bank for four years. She will invest her new loan in the purchase of fabric, thread and clasps in order to continue with her business.

Her goal is to grow in her business and have a bigger workshop.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, buttons, threads and clasps.

loans.name: Ashurali

texts.ru: Ашурали занимается купля продажей продукты питание. Он женат и у него двое детей. Он целеустремленный и  трудолюбивый человек. Он продает ежедневные продукты, такие как хлеб, печенье, конфеты и другие. Он является владельцем данного бизнеса и у него очень хороший опыт. Более 6 лет он успешно продолжает данный бизнес. Ашурали хотел бы получить займ для покупки нового ассортимента товаров с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Ashurali is involved in buying and selling food products.  He is married and has tow children.  He is a goal-oriented and hard-working person.  Ashurali sells everyday products, such as bread, cookies, candy and others.  He is the owner of this business and has a very good experience.  He has been running this business for over six years.  Ashurali wants to obtain a loan for the purchase of a new assortment of products in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: José Gilberto

texts.es:
Don José tiene 65 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y tres hijos.

Él se dedica a cuidar y trabajar con ganado, desde los quince años, fue su papá quien le enseño, pues él siempre le dijo que para llegar a tener algo se debe luchar y trabajar muy fuerte. Se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. de la mañana para ordeñar sus vacas, luego se dirige a cuidarlas, además siembra maíz y trabaja con su familia, elaboran tamales de elote y sus hijas se encargan de procesar la leche de las vacas en cuajada y la venden en la comunidad.

Para comprar los productos que necesita para desempeñar sus actividades, el señor José debe caminar a pie unos diez minutos, luego aborda un autobús durante diez minutos que lo lleva al lugar donde compra los insumos.

Don José solicita el préstamo, para comprar dos vacas lecheras, por que su familia procesa la leche y venden cuajada en la comunidad donde viven, además comprara alimento para sus vacas. Con la compra de dos vacas más, la producción de leche será mayor y tendrán más cuajada para satisfacer la demanda, por lo que abra mas ganancia y le servirá para satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar.

Él sueña con sacar adelante a su familia y planea ahorrar para dejarles a cada una de sus hijas un lote para que construyan su propia casa y seguir enseñándoles a trabajar, para que sus familias tengan mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
José is 65 years old living with his spouse and three children.  He works with and cares for cattle; he’s been in business for 15 years.  His father taught him because he’d always say that one must work hard and struggle much if one is to have anything.  He rises at 4:30am to milk his cows and then heads out to care for them.  He also grows corn and works with his family making corn tamales.  His daughters process the cow milk into curds that’s then sold in the community.

To buy the products he needs to carry out his activities, José must walk for ten minutes to catch a bus that takes another ten minutes to reach the place where he buys his supplies.  José is requesting the loan to buy two dairy cows because his family processes the milk and sells the curd in the community where they live.  He will also buy feed for his cows.

The purchase of two more cows will increase milk production and they’ll have enough curd to satisfy demand which will lead to higher profits to meet household needs.  He dreams with moving his family forward to leave each of his daughters a lot so that they can build their houses and to continue teaching them how to work so that their families will have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Lord Share Group

texts.en:
Lillian is a married woman, age 38. She lives with her husband and her three children age 7, 12, and 18, all of whom attend school. Her husband works for city of Mutare as a plumber and his salary adds to the total family income.

Lillian is a cross-border trader and mainly buys from South Africa and Botswana. She buys and sells blankets, jeans, shirts, dresses, and other clothes. The business has been in existence since 2005. The main drawback to the business is the import duty charges, late payments from her customers, and theft.

Currently she requests a loan of $400, which she will use to increase her stock. If the business goes on well, she looks forward to get more income and be able to pay school fees for her children and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase blankets, jeans, shirts, dresses, and shoes for resale

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Oeun, a 44-year-old mother of three, one of whom is still in school, is a farmer who also raises chickens and ducks. As well, she sometimes works in construction with two of her children.

A farmer for almost 24 years, this will be her second loan with VisionFund which she will use to buy fertilizers for her farmland and feed for her chickens and ducks. Oeun hopes the loan will help to increase her crop yield and enable her chickens and ducks to be healthy and fat, resulting in more income to feed her family, save for the future and allow her youngest child to continue in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland and poultry feeds.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sacks of corn, sugar, wheat flour and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Darcy

texts.es:
El socio Darcy sigue participando en el banco comunal  “ÑAHUPACMAN PURISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. 

El socio Darcy sigue vendiendo productos de salud llamados herbalife. El socio Darcy solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de salud y continuar su crecimiento en cuanto llegar a ser uno de los líderes de ventas.

El socio Darcy agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Darcy continues to participate in the “ÑAHUPACMAN PURISUN” communal bank of the Arariwa Association in Cusco.

He continues to sell Herbalife health products and is asking for this loan in order to invest in health products and continue to grow toward becoming one of the sales leaders.

He is grateful and appreciates the loan he got through this medium.  He is committed to making his payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy more health products.

loans.name: Félix

texts.fr: Félix est marié à une marchande du nom de Suzanne. Le couple a onze enfants dont certains scolarisés et huit restent à leur charge. Félix vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Félix n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Félix mène comme activité depuis trente cinq ans environs, la culture des céréales (haricot et maïs) et des légumineuses (piment et tomate) qu’il vend dans sa région. Parallèlement à cette activité, Félix fait la pêche. C'est dans une ville du Bénin que Félix exerce ses activités. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Félix sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Son ambition est d’accroître le niveau de son activité. Les quatre premiers crédits reçus antérieurement par Félix ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Félix is married to a trader called Suzanne. The couple have 11 children, some of whom attend school and 8 of whom remain in their care. The couple share the household expenses.

Félix has no formal education. In order to be able to take care of his and his family's needs, Félix has grown corn, beans and vegetables (peppers and tomatoes) for around 35 years. He also fishes. He sells his produce to customers in his local town in Benin.

Félix is requesting a 5th loan from ALIDé so that he can invest in and strengthen his business, and better satisfy customer demand. He would like to increase his level of business activity. His 4 previous loans have all been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy crop-growing products (for peppers, tomatoes, beans and corn)

loans.name: Oscar Leopoldo

texts.es:
Es señor Oscar Leopoldo es casado tiene 55 años de edad,  curso los grados de educación secundaria, tiene 1 hijo el cual esta estudiando, se dedica a presta servicios de trasporte, lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien es maestra de educación.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de repuesto ya que es necesario para que siga trabajando, y mejorar su condición de vida, espera ver su negocio prospero.
texts.en:
The man, Oscar Leopoldo, is 55 years old and married with one child, who is studying.  He finished high school.  He works offering transportation services.  He has 10 years of experience and has the support of his wife, who is an education teacher.

He is requesting a loan that he will use to buy spare parts because it is necessary for him to continue working and to improve his living conditions.  He hopes to see his business prosper.

loans.use: to buy parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Tamalinda Group

texts.en:
Mwanahamis, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children who go to school.  She has been running a business of selling food for seven years now.  She works from 6:00 am to 4:00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase on the food stock and to pay school fees and household expenses.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She hopes for a new loan to increase on the food stock and sell more food. Her dream is to be able to build her own house one day.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Tamalinda", which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more food to sell.

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German se encuentra casado y tiene 4 hijos, y para generar los ingresos que requiere en su hogar trabaja como oficial de construcción desde hace unos 33 años. Gracias a la experiencia adquirida ya tiene un gran reconocimiento en su municipio y eso le ha permitido tener muy buenos clientes, lo que le permite tener muy buenas ventas y así generar los ingresos que se requieren en su hogar. La principal dificultad que presenta es el bajo capital con el que cuenta constantemente para poder iniciar proyectos productivos, lo que le limita en gran medida recibir contratos por parte de algunos clientes para trabajar en su actividad. Con el ánimo de realizar un trabajo de un cliente, German busca un préstamo para comprar materiales como cemento, baldosa, pintura, entre otros.

De esta manera podrá seguir trabajando en su actividad y así seguir generando los ingresos que requiere en su hogar para brindar una buena calidad de vida en su familia.

loans.use: Comprar materiales como cemento, baldosa, pintura, entre otros.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is 36 years old, married and a mother of four children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transport services.

Bushra is a clothes seller. She purchases clothes at wholesale prices and sells at retail to her clients to earn profits. She is very knowledgeable about the latest trends in fashion and her clients like her variety of clothes very much.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further improvement of her business. With the loan investment she will buy wider variety of clothes to increase her sales and income.

loans.use: To buy clothes for her clothes selling business

loans.name: Kpang Manga-Nyong Gumah Group

texts.en:
Damu is an active, 45-year-old woman from Nyong-Gumah in the northern part of Ghana. She is married to Rahaman, with whom she has five children. She is the third person from the right as you face the group picture. 

Damu is a member of a shea butter processing group who have been in the business for the last three years. Their group also belongs to a mother group called Kpan Manga Women's Association. She makes good profits from the business since she and every member of her solidarity group have been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to process high quality premium shea butter for both European and local markets.

Damu has asked for a loan of 1,500 cedis to enable the solidarity group to buy and store 27 bags of shea nuts. By so doing, Damu will increase production and, hence, make more profit, repay the loan, and support her children’s educational needs.

loans.use: to buy and store 27 bags of shea nuts such that they can have enough raw materials to process all year round.

loans.name: Anar

texts.ru: Анар, 43 года, замужем, есть 4 дочери. Она очень честная, трудолюбивая, доброжелательная. У Анар - среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Собственный бизнес начала в 2005 году и развила его. В хозяйстве Анар есть 2 коровы, 21 овца. На 3,44 Га земли Анар выращивает перец, клевер и фасоль. На сегодняшний день ежемесячный доход Анар составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади, нетели и 2 дойных коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Анар планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, также она планирует дать ее дочерям достойное образование.

loans.use: to  buy one horse, one heifer and two dairy cows in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.en:
Maria Luisa is mother of three daughters, is married and lives in the city of Villa de Garcia in the State of Nuevo Leon. The necessities of the home have been greater each time and seeing as her husband\'s income was not enough she decided to start a new business, a grocery store. Until today she still manages the business and with the active support of her two adult daughtre she has been able to make a success of her business.

Now Maria Luisa requires a loan in the amount of $200 which she will use to add variety to her merchandise and be able to offer a better selection, thus attracting more clients and increasing her earnings. You can help her to go on, and above all, expand her business. It is the major source of income for the family. Decide and help her. She and her family need you. They thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Luisa es madre de 3 hijas, es casada y vive en Villa de García, en el estado de Nuevo León. Las necesidades del hogar cada vez eran mayores y al ver con el sueldo de su esposo no se completaba ella decidió emprender un nuevo proyecto, una tienda de abarrotes. Hasta la fecha continua y con el apoyo activo de sus dos hijas mayores ha podido salir adelante con el negocio.

En estos momentos María Luisa requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $200 DLLS, mismos que utilizará para surtir más mercancía y poder ofrecer una mayor variedad, atrayendo así más cliente e incrementando sus ingresos. Tú puedes ayudarla a continuar y sobre todo hacer crecer su negocio, pues es la principal fuente de recursos que posee su familia, decídete y apóyala, ella y su familia te necesitan, ellos te lo agradecen.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock in her retail shop by buying household goods and cereal

loans.name: Xuan

texts.en: The saving and credit group was set up in March, 2006. Mrs Xuan is the leader of the group. The group has 8 members who are Ha, Thu, Loan, Toan, Gam, Tinh, Nu between 23 and 55 years old. They gather weekly so that they can save money and then rotate borrowing. In addtion, this can help them learn something by sharing experiences with each other and helping to repay loans. Average income is about $30/member/month. However, the loan from their savings is small so the loan doesn’t have enough for the members of the group. They want to borrow a loan of $500 for 8 members of group so that they will do small selling at local market, raising pigs at house, buying fertilizer for rice, cassava, and cashew nut trees. They hope the loan will help increase income. They will repay part of their loan every week.

loans.use: selling and raise pig and cassva, cashew nut trees

loans.name: Iyobosa Isere

texts.en: "My LAPO loan has lifted my business," says Mr. Iyobosa Isere E., who lives in the urban area in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He is 37 years old and has 2 children. He sells fairly used clothes and needs the above amount for the expansion of his business. He has been in business since 2000.

loans.use: To buy bales of fairly-used clothes to add to his inventory

loans.name: Ni Putu Warniasih

texts.id:
In a very traditional Balinese custom interpretation, women are often expected to stay at home to take care her children and her husband. That does not apply to Ni Putu Warniasih. She is a mother of three. Two of her three children are in elementary school. That condition creates the needs to cover school tuitions in addition to the living costs. One of her obsessions is to have the children to get the highest education possible so they can transform their life to be better than their parents. Although her husband is selling vegetables door to door, Ni Putu Warniasih does not want to sit around and do nothing. Utilizing a small lot in her yard, she and her husband made a small shed with three compartments. The first compartment is to grow the piglets, the second compartment is for the sow and the third compartment is for breastfeeding. With the loan from Dinari, Ni Putu Warniasih can buy a sow that will soon deliver the piglets which will then occupy the shed. She plan on harvesting every three months. She decides to do so to get a fast turn around to allow her to use the profit for additional capital and to help cover her family's living expense.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Di adat Bali kuno, seringkali muncul pemahaman bahwa wanita hanya diam dirumah untuk merawat anak dan melayani suami. Namun, hal itu tidak berlaku bagi Ni Putu Warniasih. Ni Putu Warniasih adalah ibu dengan 3 orang anak. Dua dari tiga anaknya sudah mengenyam pendidikan di bangku Sekolah dasar ( SD ). Kondisi seperti itu tentunya membutuhkan banyak biaya, baik untuk kebutuhan sehari – hari atau biaya sekolah. Satu keyakinan Ni Putu Warniasih adalah ia berkeinginan anaknya dapat menempuh pendidikan setinggi mungkin sehingga mereka akan dapat mengubah hidupnya menjadi lebih baik atau menjadi lebih baik dari orang tuanya. Walaupun suaminya berprofesi sebagi pedagang sayuran keliling, hal itu tidak membuat Ni Putu Warniasih berdiam diri saja. Dengan memanfaatkan sepetak tanah dibelakang rumahnya, Ni Putu Warniasih dengan suaminya membuat sebuah kandang dengan 3 ruangan. Ruangan pertama untuk anak babi yang digemukkan, ruang 2 untuk induk dan ruang 3 untuk induk yang menyusui. Dengan pinjaman dari Dinari, Ni Putu Warniasih membeli induk babi yang sudah dikawinkan. Perhitungannya induk babi itu akan segera melahirkan anak dan segera mengisi kandangnya. Ni Putu Warniasih berencana memelihara babi untuk babi guling yang dipanen 3 bulan sekali. Hal itu dipilihnya karena perputaran modalnya cepat, sehingga Ni Putu Warniasih bisa menyisihkan untuk modal dan kebutuhan sehari – hari. Dengan kegiatannya sekarang, Ni Putu Warniasih mampu membantu keuangan keluarganya.

loans.use: To purchase sows

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: "LAPO have really assisted me in my business," says Mrs. Mabel O., who loves to talk about LAPO and the poor women in her community.  According to her, she learned her trade from her auntie whom she stayed with before she opened her business in 1997.  She has been with LAPO for 5 years and is requesting a loan of $400 to buy more drinks and provisions to sell.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.id:
Ali has one employee helping him making 6-10 buckets of grass jelly everyday. He pays the employee 25,000 IDR per day (1USD ~ 9,000 IDR). Grass Jelly is an important mix for 'es campur' (a popular desert). To produce one bucket of grass jelly requires a working capital of 10,000 IDR. Each bucket is sold for 20,000 IDR. Hence he grosses 10,000 IDR per bucket. Ali sells the grass jelly to his customer at the market. Currently he wants to expand his business by finding a new place to sell. He needs 3,000,000 IDR. He is running the business with his wife as well.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Ali memiliki satu orang orang tenaga yang membantunya membuat 6 - 10 ember cincau/hari dengan ongkos kerja Rp 25.000,00/hari. Cincau adalah salah satu campuran dari es campur. Satu ember cincau memerlukan modal Rp 10.000,00. Per ember akan dijual Rp 20.000,00. Jadi keuntungannya Rp 10.000,00/ember. Ali menjualnya kepada langganannya di Pasar. Saat ini dia ingin mengembangkan usahanya dengan mencari tempat berjualan di pasar yang baru. Untuk itu dia memerlukan modal. Pinjaman senilai Rp 3.000.000,00 akan dia manfaatkan. Dia menjalankan usaha ini dibantu dengan isteri.

loans.use: to increase grass jelly production capacity

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es:
Early in 2003, because of her family, Edelmira decided to start a business selling tacos in a cart outside of her house so that she can help her family because her household was going through a financial crisis. During the day she would study, and at night she would set up her taco stand. Little by little she acquired customers until she managed to get an established locale. A year ago she had a son, to whom she would like to offer the best so he can have more opportunities in life. Currently she has two employees who help her in the business because she cannot tend to it by herself.

However, Edelmira would like to keep growing because there is a high demand for her tacos. This is why she is requesting a loan for US $750, which she is willing to pay in a period of 6 months. With this money Edelmira will be able to buy two griddles to make tacos quicker. With your help Edelmira will be able to support her child.

In the photos Edelmira is in the kitchen, in front of her is one griddle where they make tacos and behind her a table where they prepare them and the refrigerator.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

A inicios del 2003, debido a que su familia, Edelmira decidió poner un negocio de venta de tacos en un carrito fuera de su casa. Para así poder ayudarle a su familia puesto que en su casa pasaban por una crisis económica. Durante el día se iba a estudiar y por las noches ponía el puesto de tacos. Poco a poco se fue haciendo de clientes hasta que pudo hacerse de un local establecido. Hace un año que tuvo un hijo al cual desea darle lo mejor para que pueda tener más oportunidades. Actualmente tiene dos empleados que le ayudan en su negocio puesto que ella no puede atenderlo sola.

Sin embargo Edelmira desea seguir creciendo puesto que la demanda que tiene es buena. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $750 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Edelmira podrá comprar dos parrillas para poder hacer mas rápido los tacos. Con tu ayuda Edelmira podrá sacar adelante a su hijo. Dentro de la fotos Eelmira se encuentra en la cocina frente a ella está una parrilla donde hacen los tacos y tras de ella está una mesa en dónde se preparan y el refrigerador.

loans.use: Buying two griddles to prepare tacos (Comprar dos parrillas para elaborar los tacos)

loans.name: Bahaddin

texts.en:
Bahaddin is a 39 year-old man who is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan in the Fizuli region. He settled in the Mahmudliu village.

This hard-working man is married and has two children. Seven years ago, he started this business. Now, he needs a loan of $600 to buy a calf in order to improve his business and take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila belongs to the Comunal Bank Las Ucayalinas, located on Padre Irazola Street, Mz. 10, Lt. 21, in the District of Manatay, Department of Ucayali. She is 53 years old, has 6 children, and is separated from her husband. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in the sale of soft drinks and lolipops. The business has grown and currently she also sells fruits from the area. In the morning she prepares the lollipops with the help of her children, and in the afternoon she sells fruit. With this loan of 1,200 soles, which will be repaid over 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of soft drinks, ingredients for her lollipops, sugar, milk and fruit. Luzmila is very happy with the successes she’s had in her work.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Luzmila pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Ucayalinas, ubicado en Jr. Padre Irazola Mz. 10 Lt. 21, del Distrito D. Manantay del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 53 años es madre D. 6 hijos, es separada. Con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 decidiD. invertirlo en la venta D. gaseosas y chupetes. En la actualidad su negocio ha crecido ahora también venD. frutas D. la región, en las mañanas se dedica a la preparación D. sus chupetes con la ayuda D. sus hijos, y en las tardes a la venta D. sus frutas. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra D. gaseosas, insumos para sus chupetes, azúcar, leche y frutas. Luzmila esta muy contenta con los logros que ha obtenido con su trabajo.

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks and other products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: EXPAND BUSINESS

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena started the business in order to support her children and help them get ahead in life because after her divorce, she was left without her husband’s financial support. Eight years ago, she started selling tacos in her spare time outsiD. the factories in her district, taking advantage of the workers’ lunch hour. She currently sells her tacos full-time in front of her house.

She currently needs a loan of $475 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can buy the ingredients needed to prepare her tacos, offer a greater variety of food, and purchase new pots and pans. With your help, Magda’s business will prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Magdalena inició el negocio para poder mantener a sus hijos, y sacar adelante su casa y su familia, ya que después D. su divorcio se quedo sin el apoyo económico D. su esposo. Comenzó hace ocho años vendiendo tacos en sus ratos libres con una hielera afuera D. las fábricas D. su localidad, aprovechando L. hora D. L. comida D. los trabajadores, actualmente venD. afuera D. su casa D. tiempo completo

ElL. requiere un crédito por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima y tener más variedad en sus comidas, así como comprarse unos sartenes nuevos. Con tu apoyo Magda seguirá adelante con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and supplies needed to make tacos

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Fati A. is 49 years old. She is married and has seven children who are currently in school. Fati has been a local manufacturer of palm kernel oil for 11 years. Palm kernels are processed through various stages to obtain the oil, which is used to prepare many local dishes. She supplies her oil to food vendors. However, her production is on a small scale because of her low working capital. The loan would allow Fati to buy more palm kernels and an electric milling machine; the machine would increase her efficiency in producing larger quantities. Fati believes this will help expand her business and raise more income to help her husband provide food for her family and to finance her children’s educations. She belongs to the community group called “Megyefo Tease” (My Redeemer Lives) Trust Group and she was photographed at a group meeting. In this group, members serve as social collateral for one another, both to access loans and as peer pressure to repay loans.

loans.use: To buy more palm kernels and an electric milling machine.

loans.name: Aydalina Del Socorro

texts.es:
Aydalina is 37 years old, with two children of 18 and 2 years of age, her life companion is a taxi driver and supports her in maintaining her family. She hopes to benefit from good health to raise her small two year old child, and continue the education of her other 18 year old child. She wants to educate them and support them in all they need.

For 4 years she has had a small general store in her home, which she set up with her own funds and whose plans are to make her business larger and convert into a general store. With the loan she will fortify the inventory to increase her sales and begin the desired growth.

Aydalina tiene 37 años de edad, tiene dos hijos de 18 y 2 años de edad, su compañero de vida es taxista y la apoya en la manutención de su familia. Espera poder gozar de buena salud para criar a su pequeño niño de 2 años, y seguirle dando estudios a su otro hijo de 18 años. Quiere educarlos y apoyarlos en todo lo que necesiten.

Tiene 4 años de tener una pequeña pulpería en su vivienda, la que montó con fondos propios y cuyos planes son poder hacer más grande su negocio y convertirla en miscelánea. Con el crédito fortalecerá el inventario para aumentar sus ventas y así empezar su crecimiento tan deseado.

Translated by Mark Holmes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fortify inventory to increase sales

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu is a 47-year-old mother of seven children. All the children currently attend school. Salamatu enjoys selling and takes pride in serving her customers. She has been selling maize and gari for 10 years to support her family. Gari is produced from cassava and it is one of the dietary carbohydrate supplements. She obtains her supplies from the farming communities and sells retail to her customers.

She plans to use the loan to buy maize and gari in bulk in order to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to pay her children's educational fees. Salamatu is a member of a community group called Adekyensroma Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: Buy maize and gari in bulk and resell retail

loans.name: Chut

texts.en: Mrs. Chut S. was born in 1978 and she now lives in Ankg Village in Kandal Province. She is a silk weaver who weaves silk together to process into silk fabric. Aside from this business, she is a farmer. Since it is now the rainy season, Mrs. Chut S. needs to cultivate rice, so she decided to ask for a loan to hire laborers to work on the field. In addition, she will use the rest of the loan to purchase fertilizer and fuel to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Noem Noeurn, is a middleman who buys chickens and then re-sells them at a better price. Mrs. Chut S. is 30 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending school.

loans.use: To hire laborers to work on the field and to purchase fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Salomat

texts.en: Salomat G. is 39 years old, and she is married with two children. She owns a specialized fabrics store at the central market in Dushanbe city. Salomat works in a sphere of trade where the demand is always very consistent and high, because the national dresses in Tajikistan are very popular and a very important item of the dowry of any girl. She is one of the leading fabric vendors in the market where she works. She is very persistant and determined in all of her business endeavors, which has helped to sustain her venture for 5 years. Salomat is a skilled entrepreneur – when she started this trade, she decided to implement basic concepts of integrity and hard work in her business to reach ultimate success. This laid a firm foundation for winning results and Salomat has obviously been a successful small business entrepreneur. However, she doesn’t want to stop. She would like to continue seeing her venture grow. Today she is requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni ($1200 USD) for 12 months to increase her assorted inventory and possibly open a new vending location in the future. Salomat is counting on your help. Your support will really help her.

loans.use: Salomat would like to purchase new fabrics to increase her range of goods.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Isabel  enviudó hace 9 años, es madre D. nueve hijos, D. los cuales dos formaron su familia, estudió el quinto año D. secundaria y vive en el Jr. Santa Rosa Nº 424, distrito D. J., provincia D. Chucuito, departamento D. Puno.

Es socia del Banco comunal “Pequeña Roma” D. Puno. Con su primer préstamo D. S/.300 aumentó su capital y compró mercadería como ropa interior, medias, etc. para vender en la Ciudad D. Arequipa, lamentablemente se enfermó y se encuentra un poco delicada D. salud y decidió dejar D. lado su negocio hasta que se encuentre mejor. Por el momento se encuentra dedicada al bordado en bayeta, el cual venD. en Puno y J..

Con este préstamo D. S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará mas bayetas para seguir trabajando los bordados.
 
Su deseo es mejorar su salud  para continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Isabel became a widow 9 years ago. She is the mother of 9 children, two of whom now have families of their own. She studied through high school and lives in the neighborhood of Santa Rosa, Number 424, J. district, Chucuito province, in the department of Puno. She is a member of the communal bank “Pequeña Roma” D. Puno. With her first loan of S/.300, she increased her capital and bought merchandise such as underwear, pantyhose, etc. to sell in Arequipa City. Unfortunately, she got sick and she is a little delicate of health and decided to put her business to the siD. until she got better. Currently she is working in embroidery, which she sells in Puno and J.. With this loan of S/.300, which she will repay in 4 payments, she will buy more cloth so she can continue working in embroidery. Her greatest wish is to improve her health so that she can continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more cloth for embroidery.

loans.name: Macedonio

texts.es:
Macedonio A. M. vive en casa propia, en la zona de Llojeta, con su esposa la señora Candelaria Jiménez y sus dos hijos.
Macedonio trabaja como albañil en construcciones particulares, también realiza cosecha en el área rural en temporadas.
La vivienda que habita aun no esta concluida totalmente, ya que falta el acabado en cubiertas y pisos.
El crédito será para la conclusión de su vivienda en revoque interior.
Esta es la primera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado le califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Macedonio A. M. owns his own home in the Llojeta area with his wife Candelaria Jiménez and their two children. Macedonio works as a mason in private construction. Also he does agricultural work in rural areas during the harvest season. The house he lives in is not totally completed and the floors and roof still need finish work. The credit will be used to plaster the interior of his home. This is his first loan request and the socioeconomic analysis shows that he is well qualified to receive credit.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Nguon

texts.en: Ngoun EngL., 32, is a rice farmer, while her husband, Mr. Pat Bune, also works farming rice. They both work hard on the business. She grows potatoes for another source of income. She farms on her farmland and even rents more farmland. She has three children, all of whom are young and in school. The family lives in Banteaychey Village in the Kampong Cham Province. Now her potatoes are growing, and it is time to collect the yields. Hence, EngL. would like to request a loan to pay for workers to collect the potato yield and to rent more farmland to use for her farming business.

loans.use: To pay for workers to harvest potatoes and to rent more farmland

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua B. is a married woman with two children. Sadly, she notes that she has received no formal education. Her husband is a fisherman.

Efua and her husband are in the fish-selling industry. Specifically, her husband buys fish from other fishermen and brings the fish home for processing and preservation purposes, and then Efua sells the fish at the market at Tatermu in Elmina. Efua explains that she has been in this line of business since 1998 and that she uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills, and other basic living expenses of their family.

Efua is now seking a loan in order to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and re-sale. With the expected increase in profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to reinvest in her business so as to continue to meet the financial needs of her ever-expanding family.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing fish in larger quantities

loans.name: Altanchimeg

texts.en: Altanchimeg Tsedendamda is a middle-aged, married woman with three children who lives with her relatives. Her husband is a plumber who works mainly in the summer and only a little during the winter. Altanchimeg's has a 15-year-old daughter (Tsetsegsuren) and an 8-year-old son (Batzorig) who both go to school. Altanchimeg works at a clothing business in Narantuul, Mongolia's largest outdoor market. The money she earns goes to pay for housing and for her children's education. She says "I want my children to contribute to Mongolia's development in the future." She is one of XacBank's many repeat borrowers who maintains a strong credit history.  Altanchimeg would like to take out a loan to buy more used clothes to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es: Marcial tiene 34 años de edad, vive con su pareja hace 11 años, es padre de 3 hijos y actualmente viven en su casa propia. Los padres de Marcial  son personas dedicadas al cultivo de todo tipo de frutas, y él desde pequeño apoyaba a su padre en lo que le encomendara. A los 15 años sintió inclinación por la carpintería, por ello que buscó trabajar con personas con este oficio; empezó pasando maderas, cepillando retazos y finalmente, de a pocos, empezó con el lijado. Desde entonces decidió  independizarse, cultivaba sus propios productos y con las ganancias invertía en máquinas y herramientas de carpintería. Hasta que hace dos meses viene trabajando en este oficio, pero aun no le es muy rentable porque le lleva mucho tiempo la fabricación de un mueble porque todavía no cuenta con todas las herramientas necesarias, por ello que también trabaja como chofer, y no descuida sus cultivos, donde su esposa es su mayor apoyo, de esas tres maneras puede solventar los gastos de su familia. Pese a que recién se inicia en la carpintería, Marcial está muy contento con este trabajo, porque dice tener imaginación y creatividad para la fabricación de cada mueble. Ahora desea comprar mercadería para abrir una bodega que sea atendida por su esposa y así contar con un ingreso económico adicional. Marcial es un nuevo cliente de MFP, por lo que hace compromisos de cumplir con sus pagos de acuerdo al cronograma establecido por su asesor de crédito, también tiene muchas expectativas  del buen funcionamiento de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita lo derivará en dos partes: una mínima para la compra de lijas y clavos de diversas pulgadas para su trabajo de carpintería; y la otra cantidad para la compra de mercadería para hacer realidad su sueño de contar con una bodega en su casa.
texts.en:
Marcial is 34 years old and has been living with his partner for 11 years. He is the father of 3 boys and now they live in their own house. Marcial's parents grow all types of fruit and ever since Marcial was little he has helped his father out where he can. When he was 15 he became interested in carpentry so he looked for work with people who worked in this profession. He began by passing wood, brushing pieces and finally, little by little, he began sandpapering. Since then he has decided to become independent, growing his own products and investing the profits in machines and tools for his carpentry. He has been working in this way for two months but it is still not very profitable because he still does not have all of the tools he needs so it takes a lot of time to make furniture. For this reason he also works as a driver and cares for his crops, where his wife is his greatest support. With these three businesses he is able to support his family. Despite being new to carpentry, Marcial is very happy in this job because he says making each piece of furniture takes imagination and creativity. Now he would like to buy merchandise to be able to open a warehouse that his wife would take care of and which would mean an additional income.

Marcial is a new client of MFP, which is why he is committed to meeting his payments in agreement with the timetable established by his credit assessor. He also has high expectations that his communal bank will work well. The money he is asking for will be divided into two parts: a certain amount will be used to buy sandpaper and nails of a variety of sizes for his carpentry work, the rest will buy merchandise to turn his dream of a warehouse in his house into a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy carpentry materials and merchandise for his warehouse

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde F. is a hair stylist who also sells hair extensions and hair creams. He is 40 years old and married with two children. He lives in Ballo Alaka Street, Church Bus Stop, Lagos State, Nigeria and has been in business since 2004. Kehinde would like to sell hair extensions and hair creams wholesale. He needs a loan of NGN100, 000 to purchase more hair extensions and creams to sell in order to meet customer demand. He says a big 'thank you' to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and hair creams to sell

loans.name: Mkorofi Si Mwenzetu Group

texts.en:
Subira is a clothes seller in the Jang’ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar. She currently earns an average monthly profit of about $90. She works at her business daily.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes (khanga) for her business. She hopes to increase her profits and grow her business through this loan.

Subira is 23 years old and married, and she has two children, ages three and four. She also cares for two additional dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Edita, who also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more clothes (khanga) for her business.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita N. is 54 years old and lives at Southern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She has 6 children. She has been faced with many challenges. Her husband is a fisherman.

Mercedita is a business-minded person. The business runs smoothly and has become her primary source of income. 

She heard of Paglaum MPC and decided to join. She has taken several loans already and has expanded her business successfully. Now she is applying for a loan of PHP 7,000  ($150 US) to purchase additional ready to wear clothes to sell. In the future, Mercedita wants to operate a big store.

loans.use: To purchase RTW (ready to wear) clothing to sell.

loans.name: Chuob

texts.en:
Chuob H. has been a grocery seller for many years. She is 39 years old and married with five children, one of whom is employed as a garment worker. Her husband drives a taxi around the community.

Chuob H. currently sells such items as cooking ingredients and sweets for kids. Her customers are her fellow villagers. She is a self-sacrificing woman who is working hard to meet all her children's needs.

She has requested a loan in order to purchase a plot of farmland near her house. She hopes to earn additional income by leasing this land out to local rice farmers.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of farmland

loans.name: Ferma

texts.en:
Ferma B. is from the village of Maquilao Tangub City. She is 52 years old. Ferma is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Ferma owns & operates a business buying and selling a variety of seafood. Ferma has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ferma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Ferma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Ferma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which she will use to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Ferma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the her business and to support her family's daily needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the seafood business.

loans.name: Hortensia

texts.es:
La señora Hortensia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Unión 28 de Julio”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Yunguyo, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 33 años de edad, estado civil casada, es madre de 03 hijos y  tiene estudios de segundaria completa,  vive en el Barrio Chacapata.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 10 años, su  primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra de artesanías. 

Con este  préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, podrá comprar arroz en cantidad (al por mayor)
por sacos.  Ella los compra directamente en Camana.

Su deseo es darles una educación a sus hijos.   
A ella le gusta la forma de trabajo en especial la responsabilidad de las demás socias.
texts.en:
Señora Hortensia is a member of the “Unión 28 de Julio” Community Bank which is located in the district of Yunguyo, Yunguyo province, Department of Puno. She is 33 years old, married with three children, and has completed high school. She lives in the Chacapata neighbourhood. She has worked with Kiva partner, Manuela Ramos, for ten years; her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy crafts. With this loan of 3,000 soles she plans to buy large bags of rice at wholesale prices in the town of Camana. Her wish is to be able to provide her children with a good education. She likes working with a community bank, especially the responsibility that the other members demonstrate.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice at wholesale prices

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence sells provisions and foodstuffs. She has been in her business for the past 10 years. Florence is 25 years old and married with 2 children. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to enable her to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity makes a living selling second-hand clothing from her home. She is very business-focused and determined to lift her family out of poverty. She supplements her income by working as a fashion designer. Charity is 40 years old and has two children. She has applied for this loan to buy more second-hand clothing and a sewing machine. She extends her thanks to all Kiva participants who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes and a sewing machine

loans.name: Ayaba Claire

texts.fr: Ayaba Claire est née vers 1971 à Pahou dans la Commune de Ouidah au Sud du BENIN. Claire est veuve et mère de 3 enfants encore sous sa responsabilité. Claire vit avec ses enfants à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Depuis bientôt 10 ans, Claire vend des poissons frits ainsi que les condiments de sauce (tomate fraîche et en boîte, oignon, poivre, ail, gombo, sésame, piment, cube…). C’est dans une boutique sise à son domicile, que Claire vend ses produits. Claire a besoin de moyens financiers pour renforcer son capital afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. C’est pourquoi Claire sollicite l’appui d’ALIDé.
texts.en:
Ayaba Claire was born around 1971 in Pahou in the Township of Ouidah in the south of Benin. Claire is a widow and the mother of 3 children, all of them still her responsibility. Claire lives with her children in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin.

For almost 10 years, Claire has been selling fried fish and condiments used for sauces (fresh and tinned tomatoes, onions, pepper, garlic, okra, sesame seeds, hot peppers, Maggi cubes, etc.) She sells her products in a little shop located in her house. Claire needs to bolster her working capital so that she can better meet the needs of her clientele. This is why Claire has asked for the support of ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cartons of fish, baskets of fresh tomatoes, baskets of hot peppers, sacks of onions, and spices

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma tiene 31 años, es una mujer que ha trabajado mucho para salir adelante, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es tener una mejor calidad de vida. La actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de zapatos, su puesto está ubicado en el mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), el cual es muy concurrido, ya que los modelos de zapatos que vende son muy novedosos, además ella posee un carisma muy especial y agradable para la venta. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre los nuevos modelos que están saliendo al mercado, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su puesto, ya que sabe que los clientes pueden llegar en cualquier momento. Con el tiempo espera que su negocio crezca y le pueda dar los ingresos necesarios para darle una mejor vida a su familia. Este es el quinto préstamo de Norma con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más zapatos para incrementar el stock que actualmente tiene.
texts.en:
Norma is 31 years old, and is a woman who has worked hard to get ahead. She lives in her own house, and what she most desires is to have a better quality of life. She sells shoes from a stall that is located in the San Jose market (an important market in the City of Juliaca), which is very busy, since the styles of shoes that she sells are very new. In addition, she possesses a very special and friendly charisma for sales. What she most likes about her job is advising her customers about the new styles that are coming on to the market. She has spent 8 years in this business, and she considers that the most difficult part of the job is to remain all day in her stall, since she knows that her customers could arrive at any moment. With time she hopes that her business grows and is able to generate the income necessary to give a better life to her family. This is the 5th loan that Norma is taking from MFP and she hopes to be very punctual in her payments since she does not want to cause any problems for her communal bank, with which she is very content. With her request of 1,200 nuevos soles she will buy more shoes in order to increase the stock that she has available for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Phuc's Group

texts.en:
Phúc Thị Đào was born in 1968. She lives in Xom Mit, Co Loa, Dong Anh, Ha Noi. She has three children. Her husband is a policeman in the commune. She has a store. She sells items like cigarettes, beer, sweets, Coca-Cola, etc. Besides the store, she also grows rice and raises chickens and pigs. 

She has taken part in SEDA for four years. She is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by SEDA. Everyone in her group repays loans on time. This time, she wants to borrow 5.886.000 VND to breed the pigs and the poultry. 

About the other borrowers in her group:

Xuân Thị Nguyễn was born in 1978. She has three children. She wants to borrow 4.578.000 VND for a small business.

Phương Thị Trương was born in 1983. She is a tailor. She wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND to buy sewing machines.

Hà T. Nguyễn was born in 1978. She has two children. She sells fruit in the market. She wants to borrow 3.706.000 VND to buy more kinds of fruit to sell.

Duyên Thị Hoàng was born in 1982. She has two children. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to breed pigs and poultry. 

Lan Thị Nguyễn was born in 1979. She has two children. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy goods to sell.

loans.use: To breed pigs and poultry

loans.name: Jose Ricardo

texts.es: El señor Ricardo Alonso Gaitán tiene la edad de 36 años habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como domestica en una casa privada, para poder apoyarle con los gastos del hogar; ellos tienen a su cargo una hija la cual estudia su primaria, los planes hacia su familia es poder apoyarle a sus hija en sus estudios siempre y lograr construir su vivienda, don Ricardo desde hace siete años trabaja como bombero y se siente contento con el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic a través de Kiva ya que son  muchas las personas que logra poco a poco construir su casa , con este sexto préstamo va a construir las divisiones de su vivienda para poder tener mas privacidad ya que actualmente todo esta junto en el hogar.
texts.en:
Ricardo Alonso Gaitán, 36, lives in the Ticuantepe municipality with his wife. She does domestic work in a private house in order to help him with the household expenses. They have a daughter who is in primary school. The plans for the family are to always support their daughter in her education and to get to build a house. For seven years Ricardo has worked as a fireman. He is happy with the support that Afodenic offers through Kiva as there are a lot of people who, little by little, build their house. This is his sixth loan. He will use the loan to build divisions in his house to be able to have more privacy. Currently everything in the house is together.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to make divisions in his house

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter es un joven soltero de 28 años, vive con sus padres en su acogedora casa en un populoso distrito de la ciudad de Lima. Él es taxista y desde hace 6 años, se dedica a tiempo completo a este oficio. Ser chofer no es fácil, pues es un trabajo muy sacrificado, y esto lo sabe bien Walter que sale desde muy temprano de su casa para movilizar a personas que tal vez nunca ha visto en su vida, pero que confían en él para que los transporte.
Este carismático taxista trabaja de lunes a sábado durante todo el día porque el trabajo es rentable y debe mantener a sus padres y además, progresar personalmente. 
Así transcurren los días de Walter, entre calles y autos, avanzando en la vida y buscando cumplir sus metas. El quiere mejorar su auto, su única herramienta de trabajo, y con este préstamo piensa cambiar el motor, ya que el actual está fallando.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual en todos los pagos. Con el nuevo motor que piensa comprar podrá manejar seguro y no dejar de conducir. Su meta a futuro es poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Walter is a single young man who is 28 years old. He lives with his parents in a cramped home, located in a crowded district in the city of Lima. He has worked full-time as a taxi driver for the past 6 years. His job is not easy and requires tremendous sacrifice. Walter knows he has to leave the house early in order to find customers. Most of these people are complete strangers who he has never met before, but rely on him for transportation.

Walter is a charismatic driver who works Monday through Saturday all day because the work generates good income and enables him to support his parents and grow on a personal level. As he spends his days driving through the streets, Walter dreams of advancing in life and fulfilling his goals. He wants to repair his car, his only tool for work, because the current engine is failing. He will use his loan to purchase a replacement.

This will be Walter’s second loan with MFP. He promises to be punctual with all of his payments. Along with a new motor, he plans to buy insurance so that he can continue driving. His future goal is to provide a better quality of life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a new motor for his vehicle

loans.name: Jahuer

texts.es:
El Sr. Jahuer Tiene 22 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Lizeth Zurita desde hace 2 años, juntos tienen una niña de 2 años que acude a la guarderia. Viven todavia en la casa de la madre de Lizeth.

El Sr. Jahuer trabaja como taxista, es propietario de un auto con el cual trabaja por toda la ciudad de Cochabamba, su esposa vende Carbon ecologico en una zona comercial llamada "la cancha". Juntos generan ingresos para poder sustentar a la familia.

El Sr. Jahuer necesita dinero para poder comprar un lote de terreno y asi poder independizarse y construir su casa propia. Para mjorar la calidad de vida para su hija y esposa. En el futuro quiere solicitar otro credito para poder terminar de construir su casa y seguir progresando y mejorando las condiciones de vida para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Jahuer is 22, and he has been married to Lizeth Zurita for two years. They have a two year old daughter who goes to nursery school. They still live in Lizeth’s mother’s house. Jahuer is a taxi driver. He has his own car, which he uses to work all over the city of Cochabamba. His wife sells ecological coal in La Cancha, a commercial area. Together they generate enough income to be able to support their family. Jahuer needs money to be able to buy a plot of land. That way he would be able to become independent and build his own house. This would improve the quality of life for his daughter and his wife. In the future, he wants to ask for another loan to be able to finish building his house, to keep progressing, and keep improving life conditions for all of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a plot of land

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina tiene 34 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 3 hijos, con los que vive en su casa propia.
Laboriosamente y con mucha agilidad trabaja en sus cultivos de café y plátanos, de este modo se da tiempo para trabajar como peón en las chacras de sus vecinos, donde le pagan 13 soles a ella y 15 soles a su esposo por el día. Si reciben contratas para quitar la maleza se levanta a las 4 de la mañana, prepara los alimentos y a las 8 de la mañana ya deben estar en las chacras. Por muy pesado que parezca esta labor, a Marcelina no le parece nada cansado, es más ama lo que hace. De ese modo obtiene el dinero que puede gastar independientemente con las necesidades de sus hijos y su madre anciana. 
Sus anhelos para el futuro son de incrementar sus siembras para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Es su tercer crédito con MFP y ratifica su compromiso a su banco comunal de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos para abonar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Marcelina, 34, lives with her husband and three children in her own home. Laboriously and with much agility she farms her coffee and banana plantations so that she can have time to also work as a paid laborer on her neighbors' farmlands. For this work she is paid 13 soles a day (her husband earns 15 soles a day). If they are hired to do weed removal she gets up at 4am, prepares the daily meals and must be on the farmlands at 8am. As heavy as the work might seem, Marcelina does not find it tiring, what is more...she loves what she does. This allows her to obtain money which she can spend independently on 'the needs of her children and her aged mother. Her dreams for the future are to enlarge her plantings to improve her family's quality of life. This is her third loan with MFP and she pledges to repay on time. The funds will be used to buy chemical fertilizers for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Nkosuo Group

texts.en:
Joyce is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people.

She is a baker. Joyce is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nkosuo,' meaning progress. The members of the group are mainly into fishing and other commercial activities and they request a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Joyce, the group leader, is in the middle of the photograph. It is their desire to give their children the best of education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Mrs. Kalpana D., a resident of Chapagaun, lives in a single family with her husband and one daughter. Chapagaun is one of the developing villages of lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Her husband Mr. Sankhar D. works in a private office and her daughter is in pre-primary school.

Mrs. D. is engaged in goat farming and has four goats in her farm. She sells the goats in the local market. This business helps her to contribute something to upgrading the living standard of her family. She is requesting her third loan of Rs 20000.00 to buy more goats and grain for goat feed.

loans.use: to buy young goats and feed

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarin M. is 50 years old and lives in Kouk Doang village in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 4.5 hectares on which to cultivate rice. On this plantation, she has some problems because her field has infertile soil. Thus, Mrs. Sarin Men decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field. She would use the rest of the loan to buy a watering machine to water her crop. 

Her husband, Mr. Lorn Om, is a house contractor and he can earn a little income to help his family. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the youngest is attending the local school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the field and to buy a watering machine to water her crop

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael O. R. is 48 years old, married and has six children between the ages of ten and one years old. He owns a garage and sells auto spare parts on a busy street in Kisumu. He employs three people. He has been in this kind of business for the last 19 years. 

Since his business is doing well, he made a decision to take out a loan to buy more auto spare parts to expand his business. He works hard from early morning to late evening to make sure that he is not thrown out of business as there are so many people doing the same kind of business as his. He hopes to buy a car some day. He is a very hardworking and determined man.

loans.use: Auto spares

loans.name: Salam

texts.en: Salam P.'s main source of income comes from selling cooked food for daily meals as well as vegetables like squash and fruit like pomelo. She is 46 years old, married and has four grown-up children. They are from the village of Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Salam has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Salam joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Salam has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Salam is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha Lorena D. en el 2004 instalo un pequeño taller de calzado que carecía de las condiciones necesarias para el trabajo pero con los créditos ella ha logrado además de invertir en la producción mejorar las instalaciones con sus ganancias. Esto hizo que establecer un negocio más prospero actualmente invertirá en la producción de una línea veraniega de calzado por lo que está cerca semana santa.
texts.en:
In 2004 Martha Lorena D. set up a small cobbler's shop that lacked the necessary components to do the work.
