However, with funding she has been able to invest in production and to improve the installations with her profits. This led to a more prosperous business and she will currently invest in a line of Summer shoes because Holy Week is approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoemaking supplies and raw materials.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora confecciona buzos y chamarras deportivas para niños, que son comercializadas en la feria 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto; es madre soltera de un hijo de 17 años, quien le ayuda en la confección de sus productos.

Vive en la casa de sus abuelos ubicada en la zona 16 de julio de la misma ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para comprar materia prima (tela) para poder incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Kiva, la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado por Dora.
texts.en:
Dora makes sportswear for children that she sells in the city of El Alto's 16 de Julio market; she is a single mother of a 17-year-old son, who helps her make the clothing. She lives in her grandparents' house, which is located in the 16 de Julio neighborhood of El Alto as well. She will use the funds to buy raw materials (fabric) in order to increase her income. This is her first Kiva loan; the evaluation we carried out indicates that Dora qualifies for loan approval.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric to continue making children's sportswear.

loans.name: Small-Small Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'Small-Small' group from Magubraka town, in northern Sierra Leone. They are small-scale entrepreneurs who have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each member of the group in order to expand their businesses. Consequently, they can make more sales, better profit and improve their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Fatmata S. K.. Fatmata was born in Magburaka. She is married and has five children. Fatmata’s husband is a motor mechanic and her children are attending schools – one in secondary school and four in primary school. For eight years now, Fatmata has been selling medicines. With her share of the loan, she will buy Penadol, Chloroquine, ORS, and many different kinds of tablets to add to her pharmacy inventory. 

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.)

loans.use: Buy Penadol, Chloroquine, ORS, etc., to add to her pharmacy inventory

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin se dedica a  trabaja como chofer; su esposa es pasanaquera (Pasanaco es un sistema básico de ahorro donde un grupo establecido de personas acuerdan a ahorrar un monto definido de dinero al año, a ser pagado cada mes y cada mes se sortea a la persona a quien le toca todo ese dinero, y así sucesivamente durante el periodo que dura el pasanaco) la labor de la psanaquera es asegurarse de recoger la cuota mensual de cada uno de los participantes y entregar el total recogido a la persona sorteada; por este trabajo ella recibe una comisión. Estas dos actividades constituyen las principales fuentes de ingreso mensual  con las que cubren la manutención de su familia, tienen 3  hijos con las edades de 15, 6 y 3 años. Tiene su domicilio en la  Zona de Ernesto Torrez  de la  ciudad de La Paz.
 
El préstamo lo destinará a la compra de motor y caja para su movilidad.
 
Es su primer crédito con Impro a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Edwin works as a driver, his wife is pasanaquera (Pasanaco is a basic system of savings where an certain group of people agree to save an established amount of money in a year, to be paid every month and every month a member who will received the money is drawn, and so on during the period that the pasanaco lasts). Her job is to collect the monthly fee from each of the participants and deliver the total collected to the chosen person; for this work she receives a commission. These two activities are the main sources of their monthly income, that they use to support their family. They have 3 children, of 15, 6 and 3 years of age. They live in the area of Ernesto Torres in the city of La Paz. The loan will be used to purchase a new engine and a gearbox for his vehicle. This is his first loan from Impro through Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of engine and gearbox for taxi

loans.name: Valeai

texts.en:
Valeai S. is 40 and married with 6 children (ages one month - 23).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Valeai has 5 years of experience in this business.  Valeai needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Valeai joined SPBD.    This is her 5th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Valeai's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Yanina

texts.es: Yanina, de  31 años, vive con su hijo de 9 años y sus padres  en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 5 años, trabaja en la venta de artesanías. Aprendió de muy pequeña pues sus padres producen  tejidos y  artesanías. Paralelamente a esta actividad también se dedica a la  venta de comida  en su  casa que esta ubicada en una de las principales avenidas de su localidad. Trabaja durante todos los días, de manera incansable a fin de tener las ganancias que necesita, según ella, la ubicación de su negocio es el punto clave de las considerables ventas que tiene. Y para más adelante desea instalar un local más amplio, muy presentable para mejorar la imagen de su negocio.Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y agradece  a todas las personas que hicieron posible el préstamo, pues le será muy útil  en el progreso de su negocio.Yanina tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar la infraestructura de su local.
texts.en:
Yanina is 31 years old and lives in the home of her parents with her nine year old son. She has been selling handicrafts for the past five years. As a young girl, Yanina learned how to make woven and handcrafted items from her parents. In addition, she sells food from her home which is located on one of the main avenues in her community. According to Yanina, she works tirelessly every day to earn the income that she needs. The location of her business is a key factor behind her significant sales. In the future, she wants to move into a larger location that is presentable so that she can improve the image of her business.

This is her first loan with MFP. Yanina is grateful to everyone who made this loan possible since it will be very useful for making progress in her business. She plans to invest the money in the purchase of construction materials to improve the infrastructure of her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials to improve the infrastructure of her store

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa G., from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela, is 49 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Teresa has been planting and harvesting rice for sale for over 29 years, earning approximately 65000 PHP during harvest season.

In 2009, Teresa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her fourth from ASKI for 50000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise, Teresa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Honey Fe

texts.en:
Honey Fe G. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 40 years old. Honey Fe is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Honey Fe owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling beauty products and other cosmetics in the local community. Honey Fe is just starting this business.

In 2010, Honey Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Honey Fe is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Honey Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 32 años, es una mujer trabajadora, que vive con su pareja Giovanni, de 37 años y sus cuatro hijos, en su casa propia, el cuál construyó para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Lleva 15 años dedicada al cultivo de café y plátanos, en donde su esposo la acompaña en este trabajo que le resulta gratificante, ya que depende de ello para mantener a su familia. Por tanto procura cuidar estas plantaciones e incrementar su producción. Por otro lado, administra una tienda, instalada en el interior de su casa, en donde aprovecha la afluencia de personas que trabajan en una mina cerca de su domicilio. De esta manera vende productos como: golosinas, bebidas gasificadas y hojas de C. que son muy solicitados por los trabajadores de dicha mina. Por tal razón desea surtir productos de primera necesidad hasta convertirla en un mini Market. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y está seguro que cumplirá con cada pago puntualmente, como lo hizo en el primer crédito, además le gusta trabajar con su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de plantas de café y varios sacos de abono orgánico, que plantará en los terrenos libres que tiene.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 32, is a hard-working woman who lives with her partner, Giovanni, age 37, and their four children, in their own home which she built to offer their children a better quality of life. For 15 years she has grown coffee and plantains, with her husband. It is a gratifying job, and she depends on it to maintain their family. Thus, she wants to take care of these crops and increase her production. She also runs a store, located in their home, where she takes advantage of the flow of people who work in a mine close to her home. She sells products such as: candy, soft drinks and C. leaves which are highly requested by the mine workers. For this reason she wants to stock basic products and convert her store into a mini market. This is her second loan with MFP, and she is sure that she will complete each payment on time, as she did on the first loan. Furthermore, she likes working with her community group. With the requested loan, she will invest in the purchase of coffee plants and some bags of organic fertilizer, which she will plant on her empty land.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: th purchase coffee plants and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 37 years old and has three children, aged 2, 10, and 12 years. Two of her children are in school, while the other is not yet of school age.

Francoise and her husband are both welders. She has been in the business for 16 years. She is a person of integrity and she makes good equipment. For these reasons, people like the products she sells.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy more raw materials so she can increase production and make more profits.

loans.use: To buy raw materials in order to increase welding production.

loans.name: Panfila

texts.en:
Panfila C. is from the town of Baclayon. She is 55 years old. Panfila is married and has 5 children. Her youngest is 15 and still goes to school. To make a living, Panfila owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Panfila has been engaged in her business for over 10 years. She recently started cooking meals that she also sells to community members. 

Panfila joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Panfila has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Panfila is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house and pay her child's tuition fees. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nicha

texts.fr:
Jeune femme de 24 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant. En 2007 elle se lance dans la vente des produits cosmétiques, mèches, et tissages. Son étalage est juste devant sa maison, donc tous les matins, elle étale sa marchandise et le soir elle la fait rentrer.
Ses ventes journalières sont de 15000 à 20000 fers par jour, ses clientes sont les femmes du quartier, les clientes des salons de coiffure qui sont aux alentours.

A l’octroi de son prêt elle a l’intention d’acheter des produits de beauté comme des douzaines de  lait de toilette, des crèmes de beauté, savons de toute marques , des mèches et tissages de toutes qualités …
Elle épargne parce qu’a l’avenir elle veut aller dans une école professionnelle de coiffure et  a la fin de sa formation ouvrir son propre salon de coiffure ou elle pourrait employer au moins deux coiffeuses.
texts.en:
This young 24-year-old woman is married and has one child. In 2007, she started selling cosmetic products, hair extensions and weaves. She displays her merchandise right outside her home, bringing it out every morning and putting it away every night. Her daily sales average 15,000 to 20,000 francs. Her customers are women from the neighborhood, clients of the local hair salons. With her loan, she plans to purchase beauty products including dozens of lotions, face creams, various brands of soaps, hair extensions and weaves of any grade. She is saving in order to enroll in a professional hairstyling school. Upon finishing her training, she would like open her own hair salon and hire at least two hairdressers.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase hair extensions, weaves, cosmetic products and imported beverages

loans.name: Wilmer Antonio

texts.es:
Wilmer es casado con la Sra. Maritza Hernandez con quien tiene 3 niños: Ana Maria de 13 años estudiando el 1er año de secundaria, Luis Manuel de 10 años en 4to grado de primaria y el menor de 11 meses de edad de nombre Wilmer. Trabaja para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como policia municipal desde hace 6 meses. 

Esta solicitando  su 1er credito con el objetivo de construir un anexo en su casa y asi contar con mayor comodidad, pues su familia esta creciendo y desea que sus hijos tengan mas espacio y privacidad.  

Wilmer sueña con poder brindarle a su familia las mejores condiciones posibles.
texts.en:
Wilmer is married with Mrs. Martiza Hernandez and they have 3 children together. Ana Maria is 13 years old and she is in grade 7, Luis Manuel is 10 years old and he is in grade 4, and the baby is 11 months old and his name is Wilmer. He has worked as a municipal security guard in the city hall of Juigalpa. He requests a first time loan with the goal of making an addition to their home, to improve the family's comfort. His family is growing and he wants his children to have more room and greater privacy. Wilmer dreams of providing his family with the best living conditions possible.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build an addition to his house.

loans.name: United Group

texts.en:
Helena K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called the United Group. She is 33 years old and married with five children who are between the ages of 2 and 18 years. She was only able to attend school through 10th grade due to financial constraints.

For three years, she has been selling ladies blouses in the Waterside Market in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000-Liberian-Dollars portion of this 30,000-Liberian-Dollars group loan to buy more dozens of ladies blouses.

She describes herself as a friendly woman whose dream is to improve her business and to continue to educate her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more dozens of ladies blouses

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria B. is from the city of Gango Ozamiz City. She is 50 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Maria owns & operates a general store where she sells a variety of products like dried fish, bagoong (fish paste), rice and corn grits, ripe fruits, candies and bread. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Maria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Maria is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the third loan taken out by Maria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Mrs. Laxmi C. lives in Bhaishipati, Lalitpur. She lives in a single family household with four members: herself, her husband and two sons. Her husband, Mr. Bishnu C., is a driver. Her older son studies at the university and younger son is studying in grade 12.

Mrs. Laxmi C. started selling cows' milk three years ago. She already owns one cow. Now she is requesting a loan of Rs 15,000.00 to buy another young cow to sell milk, because she lives in a growing neighborhood and in that area the demand for milk is increasing. In Nepal, people love to drink cows' milk so the demand for milk is increasing constantly.

loans.use: to buy a young cow

loans.name: Silva

texts.en:
Silva B. lives in Yerevan with her husband, a son, a daughter-in-law, and a grandchild. 

For about 7 years Silva has been engaged in trading women's clothing.  On weekdays she trades clothes in a rented place in “Surmalu” market, and on weekends at night she runs her business in “Hrazdan” market (where villagers come for wholesale purchases to resell).  

At her stalls she sells tracksuits, dressing gowns, and house suits, which she purchases from Syria and Turkey twice a month.  

Silva's husband helps her a lot at her business, and they support their family and their son's young family, because Silva's son is a singer and he doesn't earn a lot of money yet.    

Silva intends to use part of her business profit to purchase merchandise from China in the future, as it is more profitable (Silva says in China clothes are cheaper than in Syria and Turkey).

Silva is asking for a $2,500 loan to buy a new assortment for her business: blouses, sweaters, etc.

loans.use: To buy blouses and sweaters for resale

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal "VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO"; la socia vive en la comunidad campesina D. Pongobamba distrito D. Chinchero y provincia D. Urubamba, departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Agustina; ella tiene 59 años D. edad ella es V. y tiene 2 hijos;  la socia se dedica a la agricultura como principal fuente D. ingreso económico, la socia trabaja en sus tierras junto a sus hijos ellos solicitan ayuda D. la comunidad porque actualmente como era en el tiempo D. los inkas existía el famoso AYNI (ayuda al projimo en sus tierras para sembrar y cosechar); la socia siembra papa y maíz luego ella venD. estos productos y es así como se mantiene y ayuda en los estudios a sus hijos, la socia no tuvo la suerte D. estudiar ni la secundaria y desD. muy niña se puso a trabajar en las tierras D. sus padres, hoy ella comprenD. que el estudio es muy importante ahora para que ellos tengan mejor oportunidad en la vida. La socia solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra D. maíz y pap para sembrar en sus tierras para cosechar el año entrante.

Los otros socios se dedican ala agricultura y a la crianza D. animales menores.

La socia agradece el préstamo que se le otorgará y se compromete a seguir trabajando con mucho ahincó para cumplir con los pagos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Agustina belongs to the “Virgen del Rosario” (Virgin of the Rosary) community bank.  She lives in the rural community of Pongobamba, in Chinchero district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Agustina is 59 years old.  She is a widow and has two children.  Her main source of income is farming.  She works on her land together with her sons.  They ask for help from their community because currently, as was the case in the time of the Inca,  there exists the famous AYNI system (a form of communal work where neighbors help each other on their lands at sowing and harvest time).  Agustina grows potatoes and corn which she then sells.  This is how she supports herself and helps her children with their studies.  Agustina herself wasn't lucky enough to study at secondary level and she started working on her parents' land when she was a very little girl.  Today she understands that studying is very important if her children are to have a better opportunity in life.  She is requesting a loan to invest in buying corn and potatoes to sow on her lands and harvest next year.

The other members of the group also farm and raise young animals.

Agustina is grateful for the loan which she will receive and pledges to continue working hard to make her repayments and improve her business.

loans.use: To invest in buying corn and potatoes to sow on her lands and harvest next year

loans.name: Mutangu

texts.en:
Mutangu is a 44 year-old man who is married to Mbula, who is a 40 year-old housewife. They are blessed with 2 children. Mutangu sells tomatoes in an open-air market in Emali town. He has been in this business for 20 years, and has been able to get very loyal clients, thus being able to make 15,000 KES as his monthly profit. 

Friends introduced him to KADET LTD. This is his first loan. He plans to use this loan to restock his business with more tomatoes. The anticipated profits will be used to expand the business. Mutangu hopes to become self-sustainable in his business.

loans.use: To restock his tomato business

loans.name: Amon

texts.en: Amon, a 29-year-old married father of three children, owns a house in Kasese, Uganda.  For 10 years he has been operating a retail shop and cattle-rearing business which he started with capital of 150,000 Uganda shillings.  Amon now has 3,000,000 Uganda shillings plus 30 cows. His hardships are low capital and lack of sufficient grazing land.  He dreams of having a wholesale business, cross-breeding his cattle, and educating his children. Amon is requesting  the loan to buy beer, bread and soap for his shop.

loans.use: To buy beer, bread and soap for his shop

loans.name: Pauline Nateleng

texts.en:
Pauline Nateleng L. is 29 years old and has been selling fruits and vegetables in Naivasha market for the last two years.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her second loan.  She repaid her first loan of 25,000 KES in good time.  She plans to use this loan to buy potatoes, carrots, and onions to sell.

In the future, Pauline hopes to be selling fruits and vegetables in large quantities, buying the produce directly from the farmers, and selling to the local retailers.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, carrots, and onions

loans.name: Confiance Group

texts.fr: Masika M. E.  est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe Confiance, âgée de 42 ans, mariée, mère de 8 enfants.  Son conjoint est entrepreneur d’une officine pharmaceutique. La cliente Masika M. E.  est artiste, elle tisse les chapeaux dames en files à son domicile et les vendre au marché central de Virunga.  Environs 4 ans, qu’elle exerce cette activité d’art.  Elle bénéficia de premier  crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$ vers janvier 2010. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des matériels de confection (files raphia, dentelles, tissus, etc.) et d’augmenter sa part du marché.  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son activité. La cliente Masika M. E.  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Le groupe confiance est constitué de 35 membres.
texts.en: Masika M. E. is an entrepreneur, the president of the Confiance group, 42 years old, married and the mother of 8 children.  Her spouse is a businessman in a pharmacy dispensary.  The client, Masika M. E., is an artist.  She weaves women's hats from threads at her home and sells them at the central market of Virunga.  It has been about four years that she has run this art business.  She benefited from her first loan of $50 from the IMF Hekima in January 2010.  This new credit should allow her to restock on clothing materials (raffia threads, laces, cloths, etc.) and to increase her share of the market.  Moreover, her ambition is to grow her business.  The client Masika M. E. thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of the poor, who are excluded from classic banks.  She group Confiance is made up of 35 members.

loans.use: raffia threads, laces, cloths, etc.

loans.name: Pablo Absalon

texts.es:
Pablo es un pequeño comerciante, con una pulpería que inicio hace quince años. Iniciando con ventas ambulantes en varios barrios de la capital, con ventas de atoles, cereales, frutas, verduras. Comenzando con poco dinero lo que con las ganancias lograba aumentar más sus ventas.
Buscando alternativas para hacer crecer su pequeño negocio, comienza con financiamiento de crédito a plazos en Afodenic, en donde en el transcurso del tiempo logra poner estable una pulpería que hoy en día se dedica a vender en su casa de habitación, debido a su edad. Con estos préstamos ha logrado mejorar estabilidad de ventas, la captación de clientes fijas así como la mejora de su vivienda.
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro para hacer un muro en la parte de enfrente el cual tiene cerrado con láminas de zinc. Lo que dará a su casa mejor seguridad, como  a su familia.
texts.en:
Pablo is a small business owner with a local store he started fifteen years ago. He began as a travelling salesman in different neighbourhoods of the capital selling atoles (a maize drink), cereals, fruit, and vegetables. He started with little money and with his earnings was able to increase his sales. Looking for alternatives to make is small business grow, he started with loan funding in installments from Afodenic, and as time went by he managed to open a local store in which he now works selling from his home due to his age. With these loans he has managed to improve the stability of his sales and attract loyal customers, as well as improve his house.
With this new loan he will buy construction materials such as stone, sand, cement, and iron to build a wall on the front of his house which he has closed with corrugated tin sheets. This will give his house and family better security.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a front wall to better protect his house and family

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita T. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 40 years old. Mercedita is married and has two children, ages 20 and 19. To make a living, Mercedita plants and harvests rice and corn for sale. Mercedita works hard to have a stable business.

Mercedita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Mercedita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Mercedita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to buy rice and corn seed, fertilizer, and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Rajube

texts.en:
Rajube is currently in the business of selling beans, fish, onions, cooking oil, small fish and siko (a local beer).  She is 31 years old and married to a man who is in the army.  They have 6 children and one of them goes to school.

Rajube borrowed a loan to stock more beans, fish, onions, cooking oil, small fish and siko to sell. She hopes to expand her business with any extra profits in the future.

loans.use: stock more beans, fish, onions, cooking oil, small fish and siko to sell.

loans.name: Nakali

texts.en:
Nakali is a widow with 10 children, all of whom attend school. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Nakali has operated a restaurant business for the past four years. Her potential customers visiting the restaurant are travelers, those who are in transit. Nakali dreams of expanding her business to a hotel in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour and sugar

loans.name: Nairi

texts.en:
Nairi N. was born in 1960 in Ijevan city. He is married and has four children: three daughters and a son, who is serving in the Armenian army now. Nairi’s two daughters are married and live separately, and the youngest is a student. Nairi lives in Achajur village within the area of Ijevan.

Nairi and his wife have farmed and raised animals for a long time. They have a fruit orchard and grow grapes, wheat and oats (which they use as a fodder for their farm animals) as well. Nairi and his wife raise pigs and cows and are also beekeepers.

With income from his farm Nairi was able to pay for his children’s education, organized his daughter’s wedding and bought necessary furniture for his home. Now with his income from farming, Nairi supports his son in the army and pays for his younger daughter’s education.

This is Nairi’s fourth loan from Nor Horizon. He is now asking for a loan of 1,000,000 AMD to buy a bull calf and some beehives for his farm.

loans.use: To buy a bull calf and some beehives

loans.name: Aubaine Plus Group

texts.en:
Jean is the president of a Community bank named “Aubaine Plus,” which is composed of 25 microentrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses.

Jean started his business in 2006 with an initial capital of US $80, selling spices. Today, he operates a general store in the northeastern area of Kinshasa.

He is 32 years old, married and has four children between the ages of 10 and 12 years old. The four of them go to school.  

Jean is happy to be part of one of HOPE’s groups. He joined in February 2010, and his business has been reinforced through the three loans he received. He has repaid them all correctly. His dream is to open a soft drink store. He will use the loan to increase the inventory of his business in order to reinforce the working capital

loans.use: to increase the inventory of his business in order to reinforce the working capital

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is 34 years old and married.  She has three children between the ages of three and nine. Her business is well-organized. She employs one person to help her. Seraphine has one year of experience and works from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day.

Seraphine has requested a loan from Kiva in order to purchase more bananas to sell. Seraphine will invest the loan in her business and save the extra income to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Сафарали житель района Хуросон. Ему 40 лет. Он женат, имеет 8 детей. Живет вместе с родителями. Его жена домохозяйка. В семье он один работает. У него высшее образование. По профессии он агроном. В этой области проработал 5 лет. На сегодняшний день он занимается торговлей. Рядом с домом он открыл продуктовый магазин. Кредит берет для покупки муки, сахара, масла, конфет, и колбасных изделий.
texts.en: Safarali lives in Khuroson. He is forty years old, married, and has eight children. He lives with his parents. His wife is a housewife. He is the only one in the family who is employed.  He has a higher education as an agronomist.  He worked in his field for five years. Now he works in trade. He opened a grocery shop near his house. He is taking out a loan to buy flour, sugar, oil, sweets, and sausages.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil, sweets, and sausages.
